original: dgra bcom pa dbang po du dag dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dbang po du dag dang ldan zhe na /
translated: How many faculties does an arhat possess?

original: smras pa / srid pa las bcu dgu kho na dang ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / srid pa las bcu dgu kho na dang ngo //
translated: He possesses only nineteen faculties.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa dbang po du dag dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa dbang po du dag dang ldan zhe na /
translated: How many faculties does one born in the form realm possess?

original: smras pa / srid pa las bco brgyad dang ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / srid pa las bco brgyad dang ngo //
translated: He possesses eighteen faculties.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa dbang po du dag dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa dbang po du dag dang ldan zhe na /
translated: How many faculties does one born in the formless realm possess?

original: smras pa / srid pa las bcu gcig dang ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / srid pa las bcu gcig dang ngo //
translated: He possesses eleven faculties.

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba na /🔽dbang po du dag ni spong bar byed /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba na / dbang po du dag ni spong bar byed /
translated: When one dies in the desire realm and is born there,

original: du ni 'thob par byed ce na /
analyzed: du ni 'thob par byed ce na /
translated: how many faculties are relinquished and how many are obtained?

original: smras pa / re zhig gzugs can rnams ni srid pa las ma tshang ba rnams spong bar byed cing ma tshang ba rnams 'thob par byed pa dang / ma tshang ba rnams spong bar byed cing tshang ba rnams 'thob par byed pa dang / tshang ba rnams spong bar byed cing ma tshang ba rnams 'thob par byed pa dang /🔽dman pa rnams spong bar byed cing /🔽dman pa rnams 'thob par byed pa dang / dman pa rnams spong bar byed cing /🔽khyad par du 'phags pa rnams 'thob par byed pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa rnams spong bar byed cing khyad par du 'phags pa rnams 'thob par byed pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa rnams spong bar byed cing /
analyzed: smras pa / re zhig gzugs can rnams ni srid pa las ma tshang ba rnams spong bar byed cing ma tshang ba rnams 'thob par byed pa dang / ma tshang ba rnams spong bar byed cing tshang ba rnams 'thob par byed pa dang / tshang ba rnams spong bar byed cing ma tshang ba rnams 'thob par byed pa dang / dman pa rnams spong bar byed cing / dman pa rnams 'thob par byed pa dang / dman pa rnams spong bar byed cing / khyad par du 'phags pa rnams 'thob par byed pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa rnams spong bar byed cing khyad par du 'phags pa rnams 'thob par byed pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa rnams spong bar byed cing /
translated: He said: First, those possessing form abandon incomplete meditative attainment and obtain complete meditative attainment, they abandon complete meditative attainment and obtain incomplete meditative attainment, they abandon complete meditative attainment and obtain complete meditative attainment,🔽they abandon inferior meditative attainment and obtain superior meditative attainment,🔽they abandon inferior meditative attainment and obtain inferior meditative attainment,

original: dman pa rnams 'thob par byed do ;
analyzed: dman pa rnams 'thob par byed do ;
translated: they abandon superior meditative attainment and obtain superior meditative attainment, they abandon superior meditative attainment and obtain inferior meditative attainment.

original: / yid kyi dbang po dang srog gi dbang po gnyis kyi dman pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa spong ba dang 'thob par byed pa dag kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: / yid kyi dbang po dang srog gi dbang po gnyis kyi dman pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa spong ba dang 'thob par byed pa dag kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The inferior and superior abandonment and attainment of the mental faculty and the life faculty should be understood in the same way.

original: tshor ba'i dbang po rnams kyi dman pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa spong ba dang 'thob par byed pa dag kyang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag las de kho na bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang po rnams kyi dman pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa spong ba dang 'thob par byed pa dag kyang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag las de kho na bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The inferior and superior abandonment and attainment of the faculties of feeling should be understood in the same way, according to the distinctions in the fruitions of karmic maturation.

original: dbang po dge ba rnams ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu las gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa 'thob cing sngon gyi dman pa spong bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po dge ba rnams ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu las gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa 'thob cing sngon gyi dman pa spong bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The superior abandonment and attainment of the virtuous faculties should be understood as the attainment of the superior and the abandonment of the inferior, due to the fruitions of karmic maturation.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa spong zhing dman pa 'thob pa skye ba las ni med de log pa'i sbyor ba med par byed do //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa spong zhing dman pa 'thob pa skye ba las ni med de log pa'i sbyor ba med par byed do //
translated: The abandonment of the superior and the attainment of the inferior do not occur in terms of birth, because that would be a perverse application.

original: dbang po tha ma gsum ni thams cad kyi thams cad du skye ba dang mi mthun pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dbang po tha ma gsum ni thams cad kyi thams cad du skye ba dang mi mthun pa kho na yin no //
translated: The three faculties of the last group are only incompatible with birth.

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs kyi khams su skye ba na dbang po du dag ni spong bar byed /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs kyi khams su skye ba na dbang po du dag ni spong bar byed /
translated: When one passes away from the realm of desire and is reborn in the realm of form, how many faculties are abandoned?

original: du dag ni 'thob par byed ce na /
analyzed: du dag ni 'thob par byed ce na /
translated: How many are obtained?

original: smras pa / sa 'og ma pa'i @93b dbang po thams cad ni spong bar byed la /
analyzed: smras pa / sa 'og ma pa'i @93b dbang po thams cad ni spong bar byed la /
translated: It is said: All the faculties of the lower stage are abandoned,

original: sa gong ma pa'i thams cad ni srid pa las 'thob par byed do //🔽'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs kyi khams su skye ba na ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba na yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sa gong ma pa'i thams cad ni srid pa las 'thob par byed do // 'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs kyi khams su skye ba na ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba na yang de bzhin no //
translated: and all of the higher stage are obtained.🔽Just as when one passes away from the realm of desire and is reborn in the realm of form, so it is when one is reborn in the formless realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba na yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba na yang de bzhin no //
translated: When one passes away from the realm of form and is reborn in the formless realm, it is the same.

original: dbang po tha ma gsum ni dge slong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu'i sbyor ba thob pa las dmigs par 'gyur gyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po tha ma gsum ni dge slong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu'i sbyor ba thob pa las dmigs par 'gyur gyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba las ni ma yin te /
translated: The three faculties of the last group are obtained in relation to the object field of the result of the path of the monk, not in relation to death, birth or the life-force.

original: sngon bsgoms pa'i stobs bskyed pas 'dir rgyu mthun pa ches gsal ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sngon bsgoms pa'i stobs bskyed pas 'dir rgyu mthun pa ches gsal ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Because of the power of previous cultivation, the clear and manifest causes arise here.

original: ches 'od gsal bar skye ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rkyen du gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: ches 'od gsal bar skye ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rkyen du gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: The ripened result is the condition for the clear and manifest result of conscious effort.

original: bar sdom ni /
analyzed: bar sdom ni /
translated: The summary is:🔽Karma, substance, form, etc., virtue, etc., ripened result,

original: las dang rdzas dang gzugs sogs dang // dge la sogs dang rnam smin dang // khams dang sa dang 'thob pa dang // 'chi 'pho skye ba kho na yin //
analyzed: las dang rdzas dang gzugs sogs dang // dge la sogs dang rnam smin dang // khams dang sa dang 'thob pa dang // 'chi 'pho skye ba kho na yin //
translated: realm, level, obtainment, death, birth.

original: dbang po du zhig yul gyi don dang ldan pa dag yin la du ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du zhig yul gyi don dang ldan pa dag yin la du ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are related to their object field?

original: smras pa / nyi shu rtsa gcig ni don dang ldan pa yin la gcig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / nyi shu rtsa gcig ni don dang ldan pa yin la gcig ni ma yin no //
translated: Twenty-one are related to their object field, but one is not.

original: du zhig gzugs can ma yin pa dang lhan cig tu don la 'jug ce na /
analyzed: du zhig gzugs can ma yin pa dang lhan cig tu don la 'jug ce na /
translated: How many are related to their object field without being form?

original: smras pa / gzugs can dang po bdun no //
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs can dang po bdun no //
translated: It is said: The first seven are material.

original: du zhig gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dang lhan cig tu don la 'jug ce na /
analyzed: du zhig gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dang lhan cig tu don la 'jug ce na /
translated: How many are engaged in their objects together with the material and immaterial?

original: smras pa / de las gzhan pa lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: smras pa / de las gzhan pa lhag ma rnams so //
translated: It is said: The rest are other than that.

original: don dang bcas pa gang dag yin pa las dbang po lnga'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dang bcas pa gang dag yin pa las dbang po lnga'i don gang zhe na /
translated: Among those that have an object, which is the object of the five faculties?

original: smras pa / gzugs la sogs pa yul so sor nges pa lnga'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs la sogs pa yul so sor nges pa lnga'o //
translated: It is said: The five objects such as form are their individual objects.

original: dbang po drug pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po drug pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the sixth faculty?

original: smras pa / chos thams cad do //
analyzed: smras pa / chos thams cad do //
translated: It is said: All phenomena.

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis kyi don gang zhe na /
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis kyi don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the two faculties of male and female?

original: smras pa / reg byas bsdus pa kho na'i pho dang mo'i dbang po phan tshun 'khrig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / reg byas bsdus pa kho na'i pho dang mo'i dbang po phan tshun 'khrig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is said: The male and female faculties are mutually engaged in sexual intercourse, and are included in the tangible object.

original: tshor ba'i dbang po lnga'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang po lnga'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the five faculties of feeling?

original: smras pa / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi gnas lta bu dag ste dbang po drug po de dag nyid kyi don rnams so //
analyzed: smras pa / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi gnas lta bu dag ste dbang po drug po de dag nyid kyi don rnams so //
translated: He replied: “The objects of the six faculties are the bases of pleasure, pain, mental pleasure, mental pain, and equanimity.

original: dad pa'i dbang po'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po'i don gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the object of the faculty of faith?

original: smras pa / spang bar bya ba dang thob par bya ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: smras pa / spang bar bya ba dang thob par bya ba'i yul lo //
translated: He replied: “The object is the object of abandonment and attainment.

original: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'i don gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / de gnyis kho na 'thob par bya ba la zhum pa med pa dang / spang @94a * //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'i don gang zhe na / smras pa / de gnyis kho na 'thob par bya ba la zhum pa med pa dang / spang @94a * //
translated: “What is the object of the faculty of perseverance?

original: bar bya ba la zhum pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bar bya ba la zhum pa med pa'o //
translated: He replied: “It is the absence of discouragement in the attainment of those two and the absence of discouragement in the abandonment of those two.

original: dran pa'i dbang po'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang po'i don gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the object of the faculty of mindfulness?

original: smras pa / mnyan pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa nges par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / mnyan pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa nges par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He replied: “It is the retention of what is heard, reflected upon, and cultivated.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'i don gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the object of the faculty of concentration?

original: smras pa / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ngo //
translated: He replied: “It is serenity and insight.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po'i don gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the object of the faculty of wisdom?

original: smras pa / shes bya'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: smras pa / shes bya'i de kho na'o //
translated: He replied: “It is the suchness of the knowable.

original: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po'i don gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / bden pa mngon par rtogs pa la brtson pa dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po'i don gang zhe na / smras pa / bden pa mngon par rtogs pa la brtson pa dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa nas bzung ste /
translated: What is the meaning of the faculty of understanding what has not been understood?🔽It is the faculty of faith, etc.

original: sbyor ba'i las thams cad la dbang po lnga'i don gang yin pa de nyid 'di'i don yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i las thams cad la dbang po lnga'i don gang yin pa de nyid 'di'i don yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the faculty of understanding what has not been understood should be understood as the meaning of the five faculties in all the activities of striving for the realization of the truths, beginning with the will to the wholesome.

original: kun shes pa'i dbang po'i don gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas bzung ste /
analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po'i don gang zhe na / smras pa / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas bzung ste /
translated: What is the meaning of the faculty of understanding?🔽It is the meaning of the five faculties in the fruit of entering into the stream, etc.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du dbang po lnga'i don gang yin pa de nyid 'di'i don yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du dbang po lnga'i don gang yin pa de nyid 'di'i don yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: up to the diamond-like concentration.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge?

original: smras pa / mi slob pa'i lam nas bzung ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mi slob pa'i lam nas bzung ste /
translated: It is the meaning of the five faculties in the path of no-more-learning, beginning with the fruit of entering into the stream.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi bar du dbang po lnga'i don gang yin pa de nyid 'di'i don gang yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi bar du dbang po lnga'i don gang yin pa de nyid 'di'i don gang yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the five faculties should be understood as the meaning of this verse up to the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: du zhig gzugs can dag yin la don kyang gzugs can dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig gzugs can dag yin la don kyang gzugs can dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are form and have form as their object?

original: smras pa / bdun no /🔽du zhig gzugs can ma yin pa dag yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / bdun no / du zhig gzugs can ma yin pa dag yin la /
translated: Seven are form and have form as their object.🔽How many are not form but have form as their object?

original: don ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: don ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are not form but have form and non-form as their object?

original: smras pa / srog gi dbang po ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa thams cad do //🔽du zhig gzugs can yang ma yin gzugs can ma yin pa yang ma yin pa dag yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / srog gi dbang po ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa thams cad do // du zhig gzugs can yang ma yin gzugs can ma yin pa yang ma yin pa dag yin la /
translated: All except for the life faculty.

original: don kyang gzugs can yang ma yin gzugs can ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: don kyang gzugs can yang ma yin gzugs can ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are neither form nor not form but have form and non-form as their object?

original: smras pa / srog gi dbang po de nyid yin te btags pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / srog gi dbang po de nyid yin te btags pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The life faculty itself, because it is a nominally existent phenomenon.

original: du zhig bstan du yod pa dag yin la don kyang bstan du yod pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig bstan du yod pa dag yin la don kyang bstan du yod pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are demonstrable and have a demonstrable object?

original: smras pa / thams cad kyang bstan du med pa dag yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad kyang bstan du med pa dag yin te /
translated: All are non-demonstrable.

original: gzugs can gcig dang lhag ma gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi phyogs ni don bstan du yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs can gcig dang lhag ma gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi phyogs ni don bstan du yod pa yin no //
translated: One form is demonstrable and the rest, which are not form, are not demonstrable.

original: du zhig thogs pa dang bcas pa dag yin la don kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig thogs pa dang bcas pa dag yin la don kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are impeded and have an impeded object?

original: smras pa / gzugs can bdun no //
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs can bdun no //
translated: Seven are impeded.

original: lhag ma gzugs @94b can ma yin pa thogs pa med pa dang bstan du med pa rnams kyi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma gzugs @94b can ma yin pa thogs pa med pa dang bstan du med pa rnams kyi phyogs yin no //
translated: The rest, which are not form, are unimpeded and non-demonstrable.

original: du zhig zag pa dang bcas pa dag yin la don kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig zag pa dang bcas pa dag yin la don kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are defiled and have a defiled object?

original: smras pa / bdun kho na'o //
analyzed: smras pa / bdun kho na'o //
translated: Seven are defiled.

original: lhag ma rnams las tha ma gnyis ma gtogs pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gnyis ma gtogs pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag yin la don kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med
analyzed: lhag ma rnams las tha ma gnyis ma gtogs pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gnyis ma gtogs pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag yin la don kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med
translated: The remaining faculties, except for the last two and the two faculties of pain and mental dissatisfaction, are either contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: pa dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of contaminated and uncontaminated should be understood in the same way.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag yin la don ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag yin la don ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The faculty of pain is either contaminated or uncontaminated, but its meaning is contaminated.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin la don ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin la don ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yin no //
translated: The faculty of mental dissatisfaction is contaminated, but its meaning is contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu dang thag ring zhing 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu dang thag ring zhing 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: The faculty producing complete knowledge of the unknown is contaminated when it is distant from the result of the śramaṇa path and when it is mundane investigation.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu dang thag nye zhing 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu dang thag nye zhing 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The supramundane thought which is close to the fruit of the religious praxis is to be regarded as uncontaminated.

original: du zhig 'dus byas dag yin la don kyang 'dus byas dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig 'dus byas dag yin la don kyang 'dus byas dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are conditioned and also have conditioned objects?

original: smras pa / thams cad kyang 'dus byas yin te brgyad ni don kyang 'dus byas dag yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad kyang 'dus byas yin te brgyad ni don kyang 'dus byas dag yin no //
translated: All are conditioned. Eight also have conditioned objects.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni don 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni don 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa dag yin no //
translated: The others have conditioned and unconditioned objects.

original: du zhig nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dag yin la don kyang nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dag yin la don kyang nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are defiled and also have defiled objects?

original: smras pa / zag pa dang bcas pa ji skad bstan pa de bzhin du 'di'ang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / zag pa dang bcas pa ji skad bstan pa de bzhin du 'di'ang blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be said that they are as they are taught as being with-outflows.

original: zang zing dang bcas pa dang zhen pa la brten pa dang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa bstan pa dag kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa dang zhen pa la brten pa dang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa bstan pa dag kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those that are taught as being with-materiality and with-attachment, and those that are taught as being mundane and supramundane, should be understood in the same way.

original: du zhig 'das pa dag yin la don kyang 'das pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig 'das pa dag yin la don kyang 'das pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: Those that are past and their object is also past

original: smras pa / dbang po gzugs can rnams dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa don dang ldan pa rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: smras pa / dbang po gzugs can rnams dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa don dang ldan pa rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: are one part of those that are possessed of an object, excluding the material faculties and the faculty of suffering.

original: gzugs can rnams dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni 'das pa dag yin yang don ni 'das pa dag ma yin no //🔽du zhig 'das pa dag yin la don ni da ltar byung ba dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs can rnams dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni 'das pa dag yin yang don ni 'das pa dag ma yin no // du zhig 'das pa dag yin la don ni da ltar byung ba dag yin zhe na /
translated: The material faculties and the faculty of suffering are past and their object is also past.🔽How many are past and their object is present?

original: smras pa / ji skad ba stan pa de dag @95a * //
analyzed: smras pa / ji skad ba stan pa de dag @95a * //
translated: Those that are past and their object is present

original: nyid kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: nyid kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: are one part of those that are possessed of an object, excluding the material faculties and the faculty of suffering.

original: de dag nyid 'das pa dag yin la don ni ma 'ongs pa dag yin par yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid 'das pa dag yin la don ni ma 'ongs pa dag yin par yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those that are past and their object is future should be understood in the same way.

original: de dag nyid da ltar byung ba dag yin la don 'das pa dag dang don ma 'ongs pa dag yin par yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid da ltar byung ba dag yin la don 'das pa dag dang don ma 'ongs pa dag yin par yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those that are present and their object is past or future should be understood in the same way.

original: de dag nyid da ltar gyi dag yin la /
analyzed: de dag nyid da ltar gyi dag yin la /
translated: Those that are present and their object is present

original: don yang da ltar byung ba dag yin par yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don yang da ltar byung ba dag yin par yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning is also present.

original: gzugs can thams cad dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang sngar bstan pa de dag nyid kyi phyogs gcig ni da ltar dag yin la /
analyzed: gzugs can thams cad dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang sngar bstan pa de dag nyid kyi phyogs gcig ni da ltar dag yin la /
translated: All the material faculties and the faculty of suffering, and one part of the previously mentioned faculties are present.

original: don yang da ltar ldan pa dag yin par yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don yang da ltar ldan pa dag yin par yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning is also present.

original: de dag nyid ma 'ongs pa dag yin la don 'das pa dag dang don ma 'ong pa dag dang / don da ltar byung ba dag yin par yang blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid ma 'ongs pa dag yin la don 'das pa dag dang don ma 'ong pa dag dang / don da ltar byung ba dag yin par yang blta bar bya ste /
translated: The same faculties are future, and their meaning is past, future, or present.

original: gzugs can rnams ni ma 'ongs pa dag yin yang don ni ma 'ongs pa dag ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams ni ma 'ongs pa dag yin yang don ni ma 'ongs pa dag ma yin no //
translated: Even though the material faculties are future, their meaning is not necessarily future.

original: du zhig 'dod pa dang ldan pa dag yin la don kyang 'dod pa dang ldan pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig 'dod pa dang ldan pa dag yin la don kyang 'dod pa dang ldan pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are associated with the realm of desire and have a meaning that is associated with the realm of desire?

original: smras pa / bzhi'o //
analyzed: smras pa / bzhi'o //
translated: Four.

original: dbang po gnyis ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang ldan pa dag yin la don ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa ngag yin no //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang ldan pa dag yin la don ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa ngag yin no //
translated: Two faculties are associated with the realm of desire and the form realm, and their meaning is associated with the realm of desire.

original: gsum ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang ldan pa dag yin la don yang 'dod pa dang gzugs dang ldan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gsum ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang ldan pa dag yin la don yang 'dod pa dang gzugs dang ldan pa dag yin no //
translated: Three are associated with the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality, and their object is also associated with the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality.

original: gnyis ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag yin la don ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag yin no //🔽bdun ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag yin la /
analyzed: gnyis ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag yin la don ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag yin no // bdun ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag yin la /
translated: Two are not associated with the realms of desire and fine-materiality, and their object is associated with the realms of desire, fine-materiality and immateriality, and is not associated with any realm.

original: don kyang de dag nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don kyang de dag nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Seven are associated with the realms of desire, fine-materiality and immateriality, and are not associated with any realm, and their object is also like this.

original: gcig ni gzugs dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa yin la don ni thams cad dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig ni gzugs dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa yin la don ni thams cad dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa yin no //
translated: One is associated with the realm of fine-materiality and is not associated with any realm, and its object is associated with all the realms and is not associated with any realm.

original: gnyis ni ldan pa ma yin pa dag yin la don ni thams cad dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ni ldan pa ma yin pa dag yin la don ni thams cad dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag yin no //
translated: Two are not associated with any realm, and their object is associated with all the realms and is not associated with any realm.

original: du zhig dge ba dag yin la don kyang dge ba dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig dge ba dag yin la don kyang dge ba dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are wholesome and have a wholesome object?

original: smras pa / brgyad ni dge ba dag yin la don ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / brgyad ni dge ba dag yin la don ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
translated: He says: Eight are virtuous, and their objects are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral.

original: lnga ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag yin la don kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: lnga ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag yin la don kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
translated: Five are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral, and their objects are also virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral.

original: gcig ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin la don ni dge ba dang mi @95b dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin la don ni dge ba dang mi @95b dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: One is virtuous and nonvirtuous, and its object is virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral.

original: lnga ni lung du ma bstan pa dag yin la don kyang lung du ma brtan pa dag yin la don ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: lnga ni lung du ma bstan pa dag yin la don kyang lung du ma brtan pa dag yin la don ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //
translated: Five are neutral, and their objects are also neutral, and their objects are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral.

original: du zhig slob pa dag yin la don kyang slob pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig slob pa dag yin la don kyang slob pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are learner minds and their objects are learner minds?

original: smras pa / dgu ni slob pa dang mi slob pa dang slob pa'ang ma yin mi slob pa'ang ma yin pa dag yin la don kyang rnam pa gsum car yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / dgu ni slob pa dang mi slob pa dang slob pa'ang ma yin mi slob pa'ang ma yin pa dag yin la don kyang rnam pa gsum car yin no //
translated: He says: Nine are learner minds, post learner minds, and neither learner nor post learner minds, and their objects are also of three types.

original: bdun ni slob pa'ang ma yin mi slob pa'ang ma yin pa dag yin la don kyang de dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdun ni slob pa'ang ma yin mi slob pa'ang ma yin pa dag yin la don kyang de dag nyid yin no //
translated: Seven are neither in training nor beyond training, and their object is also that.

original: gcig ni rnam pa gsum char yin la don ni slob pa'ang ma yin mi slob pa'ang ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig ni rnam pa gsum char yin la don ni slob pa'ang ma yin mi slob pa'ang ma yin pa yin no //
translated: One is of three kinds, and its object is also that.

original: gcig ni slob pa dang slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa'ang ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: gcig ni slob pa dang slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa'ang ma yin pa yin la /
translated: One is in training and also not in training,

original: don ni rnam pa gsum char yin no //
analyzed: don ni rnam pa gsum char yin no //
translated: and its object is of three kinds.

original: gnyis ni slob pa dag yin la /
analyzed: gnyis ni slob pa dag yin la /
translated: Two are in training,

original: don ni rnam pa gsum char yin no //
analyzed: don ni rnam pa gsum char yin no //
translated: and their object is of three kinds.

original: gcig ni mi slob pa yin la don ni rnam pa gsum char yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gcig ni mi slob pa yin la don ni rnam pa gsum char yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: One is beyond training, and its object is of three kinds.

original: du zhig mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin la don kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin la don kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are to be abandoned by seeing and their object also is to be abandoned by seeing?

original: smras pa / bcu bzhi'i phyogs gcig ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / bcu bzhi'i phyogs gcig ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: It is said: One part of fourteen is to be abandoned by seeing.

original: phyogs gcig ni bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gcig ni bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: One part is to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: bcu gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ni bsgoms pas spangs bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bcu gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ni bsgoms pas spangs bar bya ba yin no //
translated: One part of the twelfth is to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: phyogs gcig ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gcig ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yin no //
translated: One part is not to be abandoned.🔽Six of these fourteen are not to be abandoned, and six are to be abandoned by insight and cultivation.

original: bcu bzhi po de dag nyid las drug dang de dang de las gzhan pa drug dang / gzhan gnyis ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag yin no //
analyzed: bcu bzhi po de dag nyid las drug dang de dang de las gzhan pa drug dang / gzhan gnyis ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag yin no //
translated: The two others are not to be abandoned.

original: de la gzugs can rnams ni mthong ba dang bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i don yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs can rnams ni mthong ba dang bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i don yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Among these, the material ones should be understood as objects to be abandoned by insight and cultivation.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni don rnam pa gsum char te /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni don rnam pa gsum char te /
translated: The immaterial ones are of three kinds:

original: mthong ba dang / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i don dag yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i don dag yin no //
translated: objects to be abandoned by insight, objects to be abandoned by cultivation, and objects not to be abandoned.

original: dbang po du zhig don la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i btang snyoms kyis rab tu phye ba dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du zhig don la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i btang snyoms kyis rab tu phye ba dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are distinguished by the indifference of defilement?

original: smras pa / dge ba rnams ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / dge ba rnams ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: The answer is: Except for the wholesome ones.

original: dge ba rnams ni don la rnam par byad pa'i btang snyoms kyis rab tu phye ba dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba rnams ni don la rnam par byad pa'i btang snyoms kyis rab tu phye ba dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The wholesome ones should be understood as being distinguished by equanimity that is not turned away from the object.

original: du zhig ni don phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig ni don phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are turned away from the object?

original: smras pa / dge ba rnams dang dbang po drug ni @96a * //
analyzed: smras pa / dge ba rnams dang dbang po drug ni @96a * //
translated: The wholesome ones and the six faculties

original: don gyis dngos po gang dag yin pa ma gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: don gyis dngos po gang dag yin pa ma gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: are turned away from the object, except for those that are real entities.

original: du zhig phyin ci log gi gnas dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig phyin ci log gi gnas dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are the basis of error?

original: smras pa / gzugs can bdun no //
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs can bdun no //
translated: Seven are the basis of error.

original: du zhig phyin ci log gi ngo bo nyid dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig phyin ci log gi ngo bo nyid dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are the nature of error?

original: smras pa / drug gi phyogs so //
analyzed: smras pa / drug gi phyogs so //
translated: Six are the nature of error.

original: du zhig phyin ci log gi gnyen po dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig phyin ci log gi gnyen po dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are the antidote to error?

original: smras pa / brgyad yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / brgyad yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Eight should be seen as the antidote to error.

original: dbang po du dag gis don la skyon las nye bar rtog par byed ce na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag gis don la skyon las nye bar rtog par byed ce na /
translated: By how many faculties is the object investigated as a fault?

original: smras pa / brgyad dang lnga dang gcig gis so //
analyzed: smras pa / brgyad dang lnga dang gcig gis so //
translated: By eight, five, and one.

original: gang gi tshe 'du byed rnams yon tan bzhi dang ldan par dmigs pa de'i tshe ji ltar 'du byed rnams skyon las nye bar rtog par byed de /🔽gnas pa las ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'du byed rnams yon tan bzhi dang ldan par dmigs pa de'i tshe ji ltar 'du byed rnams skyon las nye bar rtog par byed de / gnas pa las ni 'di lta ste /
translated: When one sees that formations have four qualities, how can one conceive of them as a fault?

original: kha cig ni phung po rnams legs par bsnyen bkur byas na lo brgya'am de bas lhag par gnas pa'o //🔽mthu las ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni phung po rnams legs par bsnyen bkur byas na lo brgya'am de bas lhag par gnas pa'o // mthu las ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They are seen to have the quality of duration, because some formations last for a hundred years or more when the aggregates are well nourished.

original: bde ba skyed par byed pa dang / gtsang bar kun du snang ba'o //🔽dbang bsgyur ba las ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bde ba skyed par byed pa dang / gtsang bar kun du snang ba'o // dbang bsgyur ba las ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They are seen to have the quality of power, because they are capable of producing pleasure and appearing as pure.

original: sgrub pa dang srung ba dang longs spyod pa dang gtong ba la rang gis dbang sgyur par byed pa'o //🔽chags pa las ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang srung ba dang longs spyod pa dang gtong ba la rang gis dbang sgyur par byed pa'o // chags pa las ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They are seen to have the quality of mastery, because one has mastery over their establishment, protection, enjoyment, and abandonment.

original: de la brten pa'i chags pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la brten pa'i chags pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: They are seen to have the quality of attachment, because various kinds of attachment arise in relation to them.

original: de ni 'du byed rnams kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni 'du byed rnams kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi pa yin no zhe na /
translated: This is the fourth characteristic of formations, which is their possession of qualities.

original: smras pa / 'di ltar chos de dag ni 'jig rten pas yon tan du bzung mod kyi 'on kyang de dag thams cad ni skyon dang 'brel pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar chos de dag ni 'jig rten pas yon tan du bzung mod kyi 'on kyang de dag thams cad ni skyon dang 'brel pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: He replied, “Thus, although those phenomena are taken as virtues by the world, still, you should know that they are all connected with faults.

original: de la skyon rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la skyon rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the faults?

original: smras pa / gnas pa gtan du ma yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug pa 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir dang / 'chi ba mi rtag pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir 'du byed de dag yon tan dang po dang bral bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gnas pa gtan du ma yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug pa 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir dang / 'chi ba mi rtag pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir 'du byed de dag yon tan dang po dang bral bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: He replied, “You should see that those compositional activities are devoid of the first virtue because they are not permanent, because impermanence that is the transformation of what is attractive is directly perceived, and because death that is impermanence is directly perceived.

original: de bzhin du des byas pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir dang / mi gtsang ba mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir yon tan gnyis pa dang bral bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du des byas pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir dang / mi gtsang ba mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir yon tan gnyis pa dang bral bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, you should see that they are devoid of the second virtue because the arising of various kinds of suffering that are produced by them is directly perceived and because the impure is directly perceived.

original: de bzhin du rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa la 'dod dgur byar med pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir yon tan gsum dang bral bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa la 'dod dgur byar med pa mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir yon tan gsum dang bral bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should see that they are devoid of the three qualities because of directly perceiving old age, sickness, death, etc., which are not under one’s control.

original: de bzhin du srin bu dang khyi dang phag la @96b sogs pa ljan ljin mchog tu mi gtsang ba la chags pa dag mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir yon tan bzhi pa spangs par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du srin bu dang khyi dang phag la @96b sogs pa ljan ljin mchog tu mi gtsang ba la chags pa dag mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir yon tan bzhi pa spangs par blta bar bya ste /
translated: In the same way, one should see that they are devoid of the fourth quality because of directly perceiving worms, dogs, pigs, etc., who are attached to filth and impurities.

original: gang gi phyir yon tan thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'du byed rnams la rnam pa thams cad du skyon dang ldan pa de lta bu kho nar nye bar rtog par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yon tan thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'du byed rnams la rnam pa thams cad du skyon dang ldan pa de lta bu kho nar nye bar rtog par byed do //
translated: Because they are devoid of all qualities, one should thus understand that conditioned things are only endowed with faults.

original: mig gi dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
translated: What is the eye faculty for?

original: smras pa / gzugs la lta ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs la lta ba'i ched du'o //
translated: It is for seeing visible forms.

original: yid kyi dbang po'i bar du ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po'i bar du ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
translated: What is the mental faculty for?

original: smras pa / thams cad kyang rang rang gi yul 'dzin pa'i ched du yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad kyang rang rang gi yul 'dzin pa'i ched du yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is said: “All of them should be seen as being for the sake of apprehending their own objects.”

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
translated: What are the two organs of male and female for?

original: smras pa / 'khrig pa bsten pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'khrig pa bsten pa'i ched du'o //
translated: It is said: “They are for the sake of sexual union.”

original: srog gi dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na smras pa /
translated: What is the life faculty for? It is said:

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa snga rol gyi dus kyi srid pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa snga rol gyi dus kyi srid pa'i ched du'o //
translated: “It is for the sake of the prior existence prior to the death existence.”

original: tshor ba'i dbang po rnams ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang po rnams ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
translated: What are the faculties of feeling for?

original: smras pa / yul yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: smras pa / yul yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i ched du'o //
translated: It is said: “They are for the sake of attachment and aversion to pleasant and unpleasant objects.”

original: dad pa'i dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of faith for?

original: smras pa / dge ba la 'jug pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: smras pa / dge ba la 'jug pa'i ched du'o //
translated: It is said: “It is for the sake of engaging in virtue.”

original: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of effort for?

original: smras pa / zhugs pa dge ba'i chos bsgom pa rgyun du chud par bya ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: smras pa / zhugs pa dge ba'i chos bsgom pa rgyun du chud par bya ba'i ched du'o //
translated: It is said: “It is for the sake of continuously cultivating virtuous phenomena that have been engaged.”

original: dran pa'i dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /

original: smras pa / shes bzhin du spyad pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: smras pa / shes bzhin du spyad pa'i ched du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of the practice of self-possession.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of the faculty of concentration?

original: smras pa / ye shes dang mthong ba rnam par dag pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: smras pa / ye shes dang mthong ba rnam par dag pa'i ched du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of the purification of knowledge and insight.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of the faculty of wisdom?

original: smras pa / nyon mongs pa spong ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: smras pa / nyon mongs pa spong ba'i ched du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of the abandonment of the defilements.

original: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of the faculty of the knowledge of what has not been known?

original: smras pa / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa 'thob pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: smras pa / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa 'thob pa'i ched du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of the attainment of the first, second and third fruits of the religious life.

original: kun shes pa'i dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of the faculty of the knowledge?

original: smras pa / rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar dang mi slob pa'i dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'thob pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar dang mi slob pa'i dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'thob pa'i ched du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of the attainment of the fruit of the religious life of the unshakable ones and of the diamond-like concentration.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ci zhig gi ched du zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of possessing complete knowledge?

original: smras pa / bar chad med par nyon mongs pa spong ba mngon du bya ba dang / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa dang phung po 'gag pa'i ched du @97a * //
analyzed: smras pa / bar chad med par nyon mongs pa spong ba mngon du bya ba dang / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa dang phung po 'gag pa'i ched du @97a * //
translated: It is for the sake of manifesting the abandonment of the afflictions without interruption, for the sake of abiding in comfort in this life, and for the sake of the cessation of the aggregates.

original: du'o ; / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du lus ni gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba dang / ma dang pha'i mi gtsang ba nur nur po las byung ba /
analyzed: du'o ; / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du lus ni gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba dang / ma dang pha'i mi gtsang ba nur nur po las byung ba /
translated: The Bhagavān has said, “The body is coarse form that arises from the four great elements, and it arises from the impure substances of the mother and father.🔽It is nourished by rice and barley, and it must always be anointed, bathed, and massaged. It is subject to cutting, breaking, scattering, and destruction.”

original: 'bras chan dang zan dron gyis bskyed pa rtag tu bskon pa dang / bkru ba dang / mnye ba  bya dgos pa dang gcad pa dang gshegs pa dang rnam par 'thor ba dang rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can yin no zhes gsungs pa dbang po gang dag la brten nas she na /
analyzed: 'bras chan dang zan dron gyis bskyed pa rtag tu bskon pa dang / bkru ba dang / mnye ba  bya dgos pa dang gcad pa dang gshegs pa dang rnam par 'thor ba dang rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can yin no zhes gsungs pa dbang po gang dag la brten nas she na /
translated: On the basis of which faculties is this said?

original: smras pa / dbang po gzugs can bdun la brten te gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa / dbang po gzugs can bdun la brten te gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be based on the seven physical faculties.

original: gnyis pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The second indicates their specific characteristics.

original: gsum gyis rgyud de /
analyzed: gsum gyis rgyud de /

original: gnyis kyis ni skye ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni skye ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The first two indicate the cause of birth.

original: gcig gis ni skyes nas 'phel ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gcig gis ni skyes nas 'phel ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The third indicates the cause of growth after birth.

original: gsum gyis ni 'gyur ba ste grang ba las gyur pa dang / tsha pa las gyur pa dang yongs su ngal ba las gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gsum gyis ni 'gyur ba ste grang ba las gyur pa dang / tsha pa las gyur pa dang yongs su ngal ba las gyur ba'o //

original: bzhis ni yongs su 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bzhis ni yongs su 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The fourth indicates transformation.

original: gnyis kyis ni gson pa nyid na gnod pa byas ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni gson pa nyid na gnod pa byas ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: The first two indicate transformation due to harm while still alive.

analyzed: gnyis kyis ni shi ba la gzhan dang rang gi dang gis yongs su 'gyur bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The second two indicate transformation due to death, either by another or by oneself.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ring du song zhing gcig pu rgyu //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ring du song zhing gcig pu rgyu //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Going far away, alone,

original: smras pa / yid kyi dbang po la ste /
analyzed: smras pa / yid kyi dbang po la ste /

analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams nas thog ma med pa'i phyir dang shes bya mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir ring du song ba yin no //

analyzed: sems kyi rgyud re re nas 'jug pa'i phyir dang bdag po med pa'i phyir gcig tu rgyu ba yin no //

analyzed: gzugs med pa dang bstan du med pa dang thogs pa med pa'i phyir lus med pa yin no //

translated: The Bhagavat has said, “Faith in the Tathagata, which is firm, stable, and certain, cannot be taken away by any ascetic, brahmin, god, Mara, Brahma, or anyone else in the world, even after thorough investigation.”

original: pa dbang po gang la brten nas she na /
analyzed: pa dbang po gang la brten nas she na /

translated: It is said that it is in dependence upon the faculty of faith, and that faith is taught to be the essence of the Dharma by those who have interest in listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: su bstan to //
analyzed: su bstan to //

original: don gyi snying @98a * //
analyzed: don gyi snying @98a * //

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mos pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir rting tshugs pa yin no //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mthu dang ldan pa dang brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang spro ba dang ldan pa dang brtul ba dang brten pa dang brtson pa ma bor bar dge ba'i chos rnams la gnas so zhes gang gsungs pa dbang po gang la brten nas she na

translated: The Blessed One said: Endowed with power, endowed with effort, endowed with enthusiasm, not abandoning the armor, one abides in wholesome dharmas. On what faculties does one rely?

original: / smras pa /
analyzed: / smras pa /

analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po la ste mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga po dag gis rnam pa thams cad kyi brtson 'grus de yongs su bstan pa yin te /
translated: In brief, this effort is taught in all its aspects by means of five aspects:

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang mi zhum pa'i brtson 'grus dang mi 'khrul pa'i brtson 'grus dang chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus so //

translated: The Blessed One has taught mindfulness, recollection, remembrance, discrimination, non-forgetfulness, mental expression, non-loss, non-forgetting, and the quality of non-forgetfulness.

original: mi brjed pa'i chos nyid ces gsungs pa dbang po gang la brten nas she na /
analyzed: mi brjed pa'i chos nyid ces gsungs pa dbang po gang la brten nas she na /
translated: On the basis of which faculty is this taught?

analyzed: smras pa / dran pa'i dbang po la ste rnam grangs de dag gi don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said: On the basis of the faculty of mindfulness. The meaning of these synonyms is as follows:

original: rnam grangs bsdu ba las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs bsdu ba las rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood from the Compendium of Ascertainments.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems gnas pa dang yang dag par gnas pa dang bsdus te gnas pa dang nye bar gnas pa dang / dul ba dang zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang rgyud gcig tu gyur pa dang ting nge 'dzin du 'jog pa zhes gsungs pa dbang po gang la brten nas she na /

translated: The Bhagavān has said, “One discerns phenomena, fully discerns them, investigates them, and analyzes them.” On what faculty does it depend?

original: smras pa / shes rab kyi dbang po la @98b ste rnam grangs de dag gi don kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / shes rab kyi dbang po la @98b ste rnam grangs de dag gi don kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: He replied, “The faculty of wisdom. The meaning of these synonyms should be understood as follows:

original: nyan thos kyi sa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as they are explained in the Sravakabhumi.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dbang po dge ba rnams ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang pos bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir don gyi rnam grangs gzhan mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dbang po dge ba rnams ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang pos bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir don gyi rnam grangs gzhan mi dmigs so //
translated: Since the other virtuous faculties are included within the faculties of faith, etc., other synonyms are not mentioned.

original: dbang po du dag la brten nas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gdags par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag la brten nas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gdags par mdzad ce na /
translated: On the basis of how many faculties is the application of mindfulness to the body established?

original: smras pa / bdun la'o //
analyzed: smras pa / bdun la'o //
translated: He replied, “Seven.”

original: dbang po du dag la brten nas tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gdags par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag la brten nas tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gdags par mdzad ce na /
translated: On the basis of how many faculties is the application of mindfulness to feelings established?

original: smras pa / lnga la'o //
analyzed: smras pa / lnga la'o //
translated: He replied, “Five.”

original: dbang po du dag la brten nas sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gdags par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag la brten nas sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gdags par mdzad ce na /
translated: On the basis of how many faculties is the application of mindfulness to thought established?

original: smras pa ; gcig la'o //
analyzed: smras pa ; gcig la'o //
translated: He replied, “One.”

original: dbang po du dag la brten nas chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gdags par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag la brten nas chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gdags par mdzad ce na /
translated: On the basis of how many faculties is the application of mindfulness to factors established?

original: smras pa / tha ma brgyad dang srog gi dbang po la'o //
analyzed: smras pa / tha ma brgyad dang srog gi dbang po la'o //
translated: It is said: The last eight and the faculty of life force.

original: dbang po du zhig gtso cher sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i gnas dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du zhig gtso cher sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i gnas dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are the basis of the truth of suffering?

original: smras pa / dgu'o //
analyzed: smras pa / dgu'o //
translated: It is said: Nine.

original: dbang po du zhig gtso cher kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i gnas dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du zhig gtso cher kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i gnas dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are the basis of the truth of origin?

original: smras pa / lnga'o //
analyzed: smras pa / lnga'o //
translated: It is said: Five.

original: dbang po du zhig 'gog pa'i bden pa'i gnas dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du zhig 'gog pa'i bden pa'i gnas dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are the basis of the truth of cessation?

original: smras pa / thams cad do //
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad do //
translated: It is said: All.

original: dbang po du zhig lam gyi bden pa'i gnas dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du zhig lam gyi bden pa'i gnas dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are the basis of the truth of the path?

original: smras pa / tha ma brgyad do //
analyzed: smras pa / tha ma brgyad do //
translated: It is said: The last eight.

original: dbang po du dag la brten nas legs par bsam pa sems pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag la brten nas legs par bsam pa sems pa yin zhe na /
translated: On the basis of how many faculties is proper reflection of the mind?

original: smras pa / dgu la'o //
analyzed: smras pa / dgu la'o //
translated: It is said: Nine.

original: dbang po du dag la brten nas legs par smra ba brjod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag la brten nas legs par smra ba brjod pa yin zhe na /
translated: On the basis of how many faculties is proper speech spoken?

original: smras pa / bcu la'o //
analyzed: smras pa / bcu la'o //
translated: It is said: Ten.

original: dbang po du dag la brten nas legs par byas pa'i las byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag la brten nas legs par byas pa'i las byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: On the basis of how many faculties is proper action performed?

original: smras pa / bcu drug la'o //
analyzed: smras pa / bcu drug la'o //
translated: It is said: Sixteen.

original: nyes par bsam pa sems pa dang nyes par smra bar brjod pa dang nyes par bya ba'i las byed pa yang de bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyes par bsam pa sems pa dang nyes par smra bar brjod pa dang nyes par bya ba'i las byed pa yang de bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should understand the evil thoughts, the evil speech, and the evil actions in the same way.

original: dbang po du dag gtso cher nyon mongs par rnams dang las rnams la brten nas 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag gtso cher nyon mongs par rnams dang las rnams la brten nas 'byung zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are the basis for the arising of the defilements and actions?

original: smras pa // dgu'o //
analyzed: smras pa // dgu'o //
translated: Nine.

original: dbang po du dag la brten nas nyon mongs pa rnams dang las dag 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag la brten nas nyon mongs pa rnams dang las dag 'byung zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are the basis for the arising of the defilements and actions?

original: smras pa / lnga la'o //
analyzed: smras pa / lnga la'o //
translated: Five.

original: dbang po du dag la brten nas nyon mongs pa dang las dag spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag la brten nas nyon mongs pa dang las dag spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are the basis for the abandonment of the defilements and actions?

original: smras pa / tham brgyad la'o //🔽dbang po du dag gis 'jig rten pa @99a * //
analyzed: smras pa / tham brgyad la'o // dbang po du dag gis 'jig rten pa @99a * //
translated: Eight.

original: dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dpal nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dpal nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are the basis for the experience of worldly and transcendental glory?

original: smras pa / gnyis ma gtogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / gnyis ma gtogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The faculties, with the exception of the two.

original: dbang po du dag gis dpal nyams ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag gis dpal nyams ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are the basis for the experience of the loss of glory?

original: smras pa / bcu gcig gis so //
analyzed: smras pa / bcu gcig gis so //
translated: He said: By eleven.

original: dbang po du zhig dpal 'dren par byed pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du zhig dpal 'dren par byed pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are the splendor of a person?

original: smras pa / tha ma brgyad do //
analyzed: smras pa / tha ma brgyad do //
translated: He said: The last eight.🔽The Bhagavån has said: There are five qualities that make the splendor of a person who enjoys sense pleasures: patience, gentleness, not being deceitful, generosity, and heedfulness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi dpal byed pa'i chos ni lnga po 'di dag yin te bzod pa dang / des pa dang / mi yongs su brtag pa dang / gtong ba spyod pa dang / bag yod pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa de la bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi dpal byed pa'i chos ni lnga po 'di dag yin te bzod pa dang / des pa dang / mi yongs su brtag pa dang / gtong ba spyod pa dang / bag yod pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa de la bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is patience?

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste mi 'khrugs pa dang phyir gnod pa mi byed pa dang khon gyi bsam pa mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste mi 'khrugs pa dang phyir gnod pa mi byed pa dang khon gyi bsam pa mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Its characteristics are to be seen as threefold: not being disturbed, not returning harm, and not holding a grudge.

original: rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba las ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba las ni rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: From the point of view of its varieties, it is of ten kinds.
