original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rjes su srung ba'i ngang tshul can nyid yin te gzhan dag la bde ba dang yid bde ba kha na ma tho ba med pa ma skyes pa ni skyed par mi byed la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rjes su srung ba'i ngang tshul can nyid yin te gzhan dag la bde ba dang yid bde ba kha na ma tho ba med pa ma skyes pa ni skyed par mi byed la /
translated: He is one who protects others from harm by body, speech, and mind. He does not generate in others, or causes them to abandon, the non-offense of pleasure and mental pleasure that have arisen.

original: skyes pa ni rjes su srung bar byed pa dang / sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ma skyes pa ni mi skyed la skyes pa ni sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa ni rjes su srung bar byed pa dang / sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ma skyes pa ni mi skyed la skyes pa ni sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: He does not generate in others, or causes them to abandon, the offense of suffering and mental discomfort that have arisen.

original: de la bzod pas ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa bzod par byed do //
analyzed: de la bzod pas ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa bzod par byed do //
translated: By patience, he endures harm done by others.

original: des pas ni gzhan dag la gnod pa mi byed de de ltar na de gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yod de /
analyzed: des pas ni gzhan dag la gnod pa mi byed de de ltar na de gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yod de /
translated: By gentleness, he does not harm others. Thus, the difference between the two is that.

original: mi yongs su brtag pa ni dus @99b gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mi yongs su brtag pa ni dus @99b gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: The examination of men should be seen in two contexts:

original: bsnyen pa'i dus dang bsko ba'i dus su'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i dus dang bsko ba'i dus su'o //
translated: in the context of their appointment and in the context of their dismissal.

original: de la bsnyen pa'i dus su ni rnam pa lngas mi yongs su brtags nas bsnyen par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bsnyen pa'i dus su ni rnam pa lngas mi yongs su brtags nas bsnyen par bya ste /
translated: When one is serving, one should serve after examining the other in five ways:

original: gus pa dang nus pa dang shes pa dang / spyod pa dang / chog shes pas so //
analyzed: gus pa dang nus pa dang shes pa dang / spyod pa dang / chog shes pas so //
translated: with respect, with ability, with knowledge, with conduct, and with contentment.

original: gzhan rnam pa lngas ni mi yongs su brtags nas bsko bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan rnam pa lngas ni mi yongs su brtags nas bsko bar bya ste /
translated: One should appoint others after examining them in five ways:

original: las kyi mthar bsko bar 'os pa zhig na ni las kyi mtha' rnams su bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi mthar bsko bar 'os pa zhig na ni las kyi mtha' rnams su bsko bar bya'o //
translated: If he is fit to be appointed to the end of an action, he should be appointed to the end of an action.

original: bsam pa'i las su bsko bar 'os pa zhig na ni bsam pa'i las rnams su bsko'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i las su bsko bar 'os pa zhig na ni bsam pa'i las rnams su bsko'o //
translated: If he is fit to be appointed to a mental action, he should be appointed to a mental action.

original: g-yul ngo'i las su bsko bar 'os pa zhig na ni g-yul ngo'i las rnams su bsko'o ;
analyzed: g-yul ngo'i las su bsko bar 'os pa zhig na ni g-yul ngo'i las rnams su bsko'o ;
translated: If he is fit to be appointed to a military action, he should be appointed to a military action.

original: / bdag dang nor bsrung bar 'os pa zhig na ni bdag nyid dang nor bsrung ba'i las rnams su bsko'o //
analyzed: / bdag dang nor bsrung bar 'os pa zhig na ni bdag nyid dang nor bsrung ba'i las rnams su bsko'o //
translated: If he is fit to be appointed to the protection of himself and his wealth, he should be appointed to the protection of himself and his wealth.

original: chos kyi las su bsko bar 'os pa zhig na ni chos kyi las rnams su bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi las su bsko bar 'os pa zhig na ni chos kyi las rnams su bsko bar bya'o //
translated: If he is fit to be appointed to a religious action, he should be appointed to a religious action.

original: gtong ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gtong ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: Giving should be seen as being of five types in brief:

original: sa gzhi gtong ba dang longs spyod gtong ba dang rkyen du 'bab pa gtong ba dang snyoms par gtong ba dang khyad par du 'phags pa gtong ba ste /
analyzed: sa gzhi gtong ba dang longs spyod gtong ba dang rkyen du 'bab pa gtong ba dang snyoms par gtong ba dang khyad par du 'phags pa gtong ba ste /
translated: Giving the ground, giving wealth, giving what is suitable, giving equanimity and giving the sublime.

original: de'ang mtshan nyid las ni gang gis sbyin par byed pa de gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de'ang mtshan nyid las ni gang gis sbyin par byed pa de gtong ba'o //
translated: Moreover, from the point of view of their characteristics, they are giving because they cause one to give.

original: spyod pa ni gzhan dag la mi 'khu ba dang mi slu ba'i ngang tshul nyid de /
analyzed: spyod pa ni gzhan dag la mi 'khu ba dang mi slu ba'i ngang tshul nyid de /
translated: From the point of view of their practice, they are giving because they cause one to give to others without deception or harm.

original: mi 'khu ba de'ang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mi 'khu ba de'ang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: And that absence of harm is fivefold:

original: dmas pa na mi 'khu ba dang yid brtan pa la mi 'khu ba dang nye bar spyod pas mi 'khu ba dang dam bcas pa las mi 'khu ba dang gzhan la tshol zhing mi 'khu ba'o //
analyzed: dmas pa na mi 'khu ba dang yid brtan pa la mi 'khu ba dang nye bar spyod pas mi 'khu ba dang dam bcas pa las mi 'khu ba dang gzhan la tshol zhing mi 'khu ba'o //
translated: absence of harm through weakness, absence of harm through lack of confidence, absence of harm through enjoyment, absence of harm through a promise and absence of harm through seeking elsewhere.

original: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa dang mi dge ba las sems srung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa dang mi dge ba las sems srung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Carefulness is the cultivation of virtuous natures and the guarding of the mind from nonvirtue.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa las de gnyi ga 'ang mtshan nyid du rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa las de gnyi ga 'ang mtshan nyid du rung ngo //
translated: Both of these are suitable as characteristics from the point of view of their relationship as cause and effect.

original: de'ang rnam pa lnga kho nar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'ang rnam pa lnga kho nar blta bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, they should be regarded as being of five types.

original: longs spyod sgrub pa la bag yod pa dang longs spyod srung ba la bag yod pa dang bdag nyid bsrung ba la bag yod pa dang / grags pa bsrung ba la bag yod pa dang chos spyod pa la bag yod pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod sgrub pa la bag yod pa dang longs spyod srung ba la bag yod pa dang bdag nyid bsrung ba la bag yod pa dang / grags pa bsrung ba la bag yod pa dang chos spyod pa la bag yod pa'o //
translated: He is heedful in acquiring wealth, in protecting it, in protecting himself, in protecting his reputation, and in practicing the Dharma.

original: de dag thams cad bsdus na dpal sgrub par byed pa'i stobs lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad bsdus na dpal sgrub par byed pa'i stobs lngar 'gyur te /
translated: All of these are included in the five powers that bring about glory.

original: ngang tshul bzang po'i stobs dang grogs dang mdza' bshes bzang po'i stobs dang / mi zhan pa'i stobs dang / yid gcugs pa'i stobs dang / chos kyi stobs so //🔽dpal @100a * //
analyzed: ngang tshul bzang po'i stobs dang grogs dang mdza' bshes bzang po'i stobs dang / mi zhan pa'i stobs dang / yid gcugs pa'i stobs dang / chos kyi stobs so // dpal @100a * //
translated: They are the power of good character, the power of good friends and relatives, the power of not being weak, the power of confidence, and the power of the Dharma.

original: yang rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: Glory should be understood as fivefold:

original: skye dgu rjes su dga' ba dang / dbang phyug gi bdag po dang / dgra thul ba dang / brten pa la phan pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'o //🔽de la stobs dang po bzhi bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: skye dgu rjes su dga' ba dang / dbang phyug gi bdag po dang / dgra thul ba dang / brten pa la phan pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'o // de la stobs dang po bzhi bsdus pa ni /
translated: being loved by the people, being a lord, being a conqueror, being helpful to those who are dependent, and going to a good rebirth.

original: dpal rnam pa bzhi sgrub par byed pa yin par blta bar bya'o ;
analyzed: dpal rnam pa bzhi sgrub par byed pa yin par blta bar bya'o ;
translated: The first four powers are to be seen as bringing about the four kinds of glory.

original: / stobs lnga pa ni dpal lnga pa sgrub par byed pa yin no /🔽// / bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: / stobs lnga pa ni dpal lnga pa sgrub par byed pa yin no / // / bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: The fifth power is the one that accomplishes the five splendors.

original: dbang po du zhig sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang las kyi 'phen pa las dmigs pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du zhig sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang las kyi 'phen pa las dmigs pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are observed due to the projection of former afflictions and karma?

original: smras pa / brgyad do //
analyzed: smras pa / brgyad do //
translated: It is said: eight.

original: du zhig ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen las kyang dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen las kyang dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many are observed due to the condition of name-and-form?

original: smras pa / gcig go //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go //
translated: It is said: one.

original: du zhig reg pa'i rkyen las kyang dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig reg pa'i rkyen las kyang dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many are observed due to the condition of contact?

original: smras pa / lnga'o //
analyzed: smras pa / lnga'o //
translated: It is said: five.

original: du zhig 'bad pa'i rkyen las kyang dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig 'bad pa'i rkyen las kyang dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many are observed due to the condition of striving?

original: smras pa / brgyad do //
analyzed: smras pa / brgyad do //
translated: It is said: eight.

original: dbang po du zhig bsdam par bya ba dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po du zhig bsdam par bya ba dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many faculties are to be restrained?

original: smras pa / brgyad do ;
analyzed: smras pa / brgyad do ;
translated: It is said: eight.

original: / du zhig yang dag par zhi bar bya ba dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: / du zhig yang dag par zhi bar bya ba dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are to be completely pacified?

original: smras pa / gcig go //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig go //
translated: It is said: one.

original: du zhig nye bar zhi bar bya ba dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig nye bar zhi bar bya ba dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many are to be thoroughly pacified?

original: smras pa / lnga'o //
analyzed: smras pa / lnga'o //
translated: It is said: five.

original: du zhig ngo bo nyid kyis dul ba dang zhib dang nye bar zhi ba yin la dul ba dang zhi ba dang nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa dag kyang yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig ngo bo nyid kyis dul ba dang zhib dang nye bar zhi ba yin la dul ba dang zhi ba dang nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa dag kyang yin zhe na /
translated: How many are naturally disciplined, peaceful, and calm, and also are engaged in being disciplined, peaceful, and calm?

original: smras pa / brgyad do //
analyzed: smras pa / brgyad do //
translated: It is said: eight.

original: dbang po rnams kyi nyams pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi nyams pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the degeneration of the faculties?

original: smras pa / khams mthun pa'i sa pa dag 'gags shing de las gzhan pa 'grub pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / khams mthun pa'i sa pa dag 'gags shing de las gzhan pa 'grub pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: It is said: the cessation of those of the same realm and the arising of those of another.

original: rnam par nyams pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the deterioration of the faculties?

original: smras pa / khams mi mthun pa'i sa pa dag 'gags shing de las gzhan pa 'grub pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / khams mi mthun pa'i sa pa dag 'gags shing de las gzhan pa 'grub pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: It is said: the cessation of those of a different realm and the arising of those of another.

original: rab tu nyams pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu nyams pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the complete deterioration of the faculties?

original: smras pa / de dang 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba dag gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / de dang 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba dag gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is said: the abandonment of the defilements associated with them.

original: dbang po rnams kyi yongs su nyams pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi yongs su nyams pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the regression of the faculties?

original: smras pa / 'jig rten pa'i 'byor pa dag snyoms par 'jug pa dang ; skye pa las nyams pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten pa'i 'byor pa dag snyoms par 'jug pa dang ; skye pa las nyams pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: He said: Those that are the mundane excellences, which are lost through meditative attainment and birth.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po rnams la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po rnams la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the faculties of the śrāvaka, pratyekabuddha, and bodhisattva?

original: smras pa / mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngas bye brag tu gyur par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngas bye brag tu gyur par blta bar bya ste /
translated: He said: In brief, it should be seen as being different in five ways.

original: rim pa'i bye brag dang / nye bar ston pa'i bye brag dang @100b 'ching ba'i bye brag dang / sgrub pa'i bye brag dang / yang dag par 'grub pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: rim pa'i bye brag dang / nye bar ston pa'i bye brag dang @100b 'ching ba'i bye brag dang / sgrub pa'i bye brag dang / yang dag par 'grub pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: By the difference in stages, the difference in teaching, the difference in bondage, the difference in practice, and the difference in perfect accomplishment.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni rang bzhin gyis che ba dag yin la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni chung ngu dang 'bring dag yin no //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni rang bzhin gyis che ba dag yin la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni chung ngu dang 'bring dag yin no //
translated: Among them, the faculties of the bodhisattvas are naturally great, while those of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are small and middling.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pas nye bar brtan pa dag yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pas nye bar brtan pa dag yin la /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ faculties are well-established through their expertise in all the sciences.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni rig pa'i gnas la mkhas pa phyogs gcig gis nye bar brtan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni rig pa'i gnas la mkhas pa phyogs gcig gis nye bar brtan pa dag yin no //
translated: The śrāvakas’ and pratyekabuddhas’ faculties are well-established through their expertise in one part of the sciences.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni snying rje'i zhags pas bcings pa dag yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni snying rje'i zhags pas bcings pa dag yin la /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ faculties are bound by the noose of compassion.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni de lta bu dag ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni de lta bu dag ma yin no //
translated: The śrāvakas’ and pratyekabuddhas’ faculties are not like that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa dag yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa dag yin la /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ faculties are present for the benefit of self and others.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni bdag la phan pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni bdag la phan pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa dag yin no //
translated: The śrāvakas’ and pratyekabuddhas’ faculties are present for the benefit of self.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni bla na med pa'i byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub ba dag yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po ni bla na med pa'i byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu yang dag par 'grub ba dag yin la /
translated: The faculties of the bodhisattvas are the perfect accomplishment of the effect of great, unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni byang chub dman pa dang 'bring yang dag par 'grub pa dag yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni byang chub dman pa dang 'bring yang dag par 'grub pa dag yin no //
translated: The faculties of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas are the perfect accomplishment of the lesser and middling enlightenment.

original: gang zag mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa de 'bras bu yang thob bar byed cing bsam gtan dang po las yid bde ba'i dbang po yang mngon du byed dam zhe na /🔽smras pa / de dag la la ni byed do //
analyzed: gang zag mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa de 'bras bu yang thob bar byed cing bsam gtan dang po las yid bde ba'i dbang po yang mngon du byed dam zhe na / smras pa / de dag la la ni byed do //
translated: When a person who has entered the stage of the first concentration in order to realize the truths obtains the fruit, does he also manifest the faculty of mental satisfaction of the first concentration?🔽Some do,

original: de dag la la ni mi byed do //
analyzed: de dag la la ni mi byed do //
translated: some do not.

original: dbang po rno ba dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po sna tshogs kyis nye bar brtan pa gang yin pa de ni byed do //
analyzed: dbang po rno ba dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po sna tshogs kyis nye bar brtan pa gang yin pa de ni byed do //
translated: Those who are sharp-facultied and who are well-established in various roots of virtue do so.

original: gzhan ni mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan ni mi byed do //
translated: Others do not.

original: dbang po du dag gis bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug ce na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag gis bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug ce na /
translated: By how many faculties is one absorbed in the first concentration?

original: smras pa / brgyad kyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / brgyad kyis so //
translated: He says: By eight.

original: la la ni tha ma gsum gyis so //
analyzed: la la ni tha ma gsum gyis so //
translated: Some by the last three.

original: la la ni ma yin no /
analyzed: la la ni ma yin no /
translated: Some do not.

original: bsam gtan dang po la ji lta ba de bzhin du gnyis pa la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la ji lta ba de bzhin du gnyis pa la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as in the first absorption, so it is in the second absorption.

original: gsum pa la ni brgyad kho na ste //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni brgyad kho na ste //
translated: In the third absorption, there are only eight.

original: de dag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Those are not.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ni bdun gyis so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ni bdun gyis so //
translated: In the fourth absorption and the formless absorptions, there are seven.

original: la la ni tha ma gsum gyis snyoms par @101a * //
analyzed: la la ni tha ma gsum gyis snyoms par @101a * //
translated: Some enter by the last three.

original: 'jug go // la la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug go // la la ni ma yin no //
translated: Some do not.

original: dbang po du dag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob ce na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob ce na /
translated: By how many faculties is the fruit of stream-entry attained?

original: smras pa / gcig gam brgyad kyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig gam brgyad kyis so //
translated: He says: By one or eight.

original: gnyis sam dgus ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis sam dgus ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par blta bar bya'o //
translated: By two or nine, the fruit of once-returner is attained.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ni lam gyi rten yin yang lam gyis bsdus pa ma yin pa'i phyir de ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ni lam gyi rten yin yang lam gyis bsdus pa ma yin pa'i phyir de ni ma gtogs so //
translated: The faculty of mental pain is the basis of the path, but since it is not included in the path, it is excluded.

original: yid bde ba'i dbang po yang brtan pa ma yin pa'i phyir de yang ma gtogs so //
analyzed: yid bde ba'i dbang po yang brtan pa ma yin pa'i phyir de yang ma gtogs so //
translated: The faculty of mental pleasure is not included because it is unstable.

original: ji ste gtogs na ni de lhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ste gtogs na ni de lhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: If it were included, it would have to be mentioned separately.

original: dbang po du dag gis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob ce na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag gis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob ce na /
translated: By how many faculties is the fruit of non-returning attained?

original: smras pa / bcu gcig gam gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: smras pa / bcu gcig gam gnyis kyis so //
translated: It is said: by eleven or by two.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The faculty of mental sorrow should be understood in the same way.

original: dbang po du dag gis dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob ce na /
analyzed: dbang po du dag gis dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob ce na /
translated: By how many faculties is the fruit of arhatship attained?

original: smras pa / gcig gam bcus so //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig gam bcus so //
translated: It is said: by one or by ten.

original: rnam par thar pa gong ma la 'dod pa dang don du gnyer ba dang yongs su yi 'chad pa dang / yid mi bde ba zhes gang gsungs pa de la 'dod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gong ma la 'dod pa dang don du gnyer ba dang yongs su yi 'chad pa dang / yid mi bde ba zhes gang gsungs pa de la 'dod pa gang zhe na /
translated: As for what was said above about the higher liberations, desire, striving, regret, and mental sorrow, what is desire?

original: smras pa / gang gi phyir rnal 'byor pa de 'di snyam du sems te 'phags pa rnams kyis gnas gang bsgrubs te gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi phyir rnal 'byor pa de 'di snyam du sems te 'phags pa rnams kyis gnas gang bsgrubs te gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said: because the yogi thinks in this way: “The noble ones say that one should abide in a state that is attained.”

original: don du gnyer ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: don du gnyer ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is striving?

original: smras pa / gang gi phyir de 'di snyam du sems te gnas de bdag gis kyang bsgrubs te gnas par bya'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi phyir de 'di snyam du sems te gnas de bdag gis kyang bsgrubs te gnas par bya'o zhes bya'o //
translated: He replied: Because he thinks like this: “I must also accomplish that state and abide in it.”

original: yongs su yi 'chad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su yi 'chad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is discouragement?

original: smras pa / dman pas chog par mi 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / dman pas chog par mi 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: He replied: It is not being satisfied with what is inferior.

original: yid mi bde ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is mental dissatisfaction?

original: smras pa / gang na med pa la 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang na med pa la 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: He replied: It is the desire for what is not present.

original: de la rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba gnyis la ni rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yid mi bde ba'i dbang po rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba gnyis la ni rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yid mi bde ba'i dbang po rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Among those, the faculty of mental dissatisfaction is posited for both the stream-enterer and once-returner because all aspects are complete.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba la ni rnam pa dang po gnyis ni yod la gzhan gnyis ni med pa'i phyir yid mi bde ba'i dbang po rnam par mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba la ni rnam pa dang po gnyis ni yod la gzhan gnyis ni med pa'i phyir yid mi bde ba'i dbang po rnam par mi gzhag ste /
translated: For the non-returner, the first two aspects exist, but the other two do not exist, so the faculty of mental dissatisfaction is not posited.

original: dge ba la 'dun pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: dge ba la 'dun pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It is merely the aspiration for virtue.

original: yid bde ba'i dbang po la brten nas yid bde ba'i dbang po dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po spong ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: yid bde ba'i dbang po la brten nas yid bde ba'i dbang po dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po spong ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there abandonment of the faculty of mental pleasure, the faculty of mental pain, and the faculty of equanimity, based on the faculty of mental pleasure?

original: smras pa / mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa'i yid bde ba'i dbang po la brten nas zhen pa la brten pa gsum spong ba yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa'i yid bde ba'i dbang po la brten nas zhen pa la brten pa gsum spong ba yod do //
translated: It is said: There is abandonment of the three based on attachment, based on the faculty of mental pleasure that is based on going forth.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po la brten nas yid mi bde ba'i dbang po @101b spong ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po la brten nas yid mi bde ba'i dbang po @101b spong ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there abandonment of the faculty of mental pain, based on the faculty of mental pain?

original: smras pa / mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa nyid la brten nas zhen pa la brten pa spong ba yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa nyid la brten nas zhen pa la brten pa spong ba yod do //
translated: It is said: There is abandonment of that based on attachment, based on going forth itself.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang po la brten nas btang snyoms kyi dbang po spong ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po la brten nas btang snyoms kyi dbang po spong ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there abandonment of the faculty of equanimity, based on the faculty of equanimity?

original: smras pa / gcig pu nyid la brten pa'i btang snyoms la brten nas /
analyzed: smras pa / gcig pu nyid la brten pa'i btang snyoms la brten nas /
translated: It is said: There is abandonment of equanimity based on solitude.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid la brtan pa spong ba dang / mi brten pa'i btang snyoms la brten nas gcig pu nyid la brten pa'i btang snyoms spong ba yod do //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid la brtan pa spong ba dang / mi brten pa'i btang snyoms la brten nas gcig pu nyid la brten pa'i btang snyoms spong ba yod do //
translated: The equanimity of nondependence is the remedy for the equanimity of dependence on multiplicity.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par byed pa'i mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni 'gog pa las spong bar byed cing mi skye ba las rnam par spong bar byed kyi rab tu spong bar yang mi byed yongs su spong bar yang mi
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par byed pa'i mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni 'gog pa las spong bar byed cing mi skye ba las rnam par spong bar byed kyi rab tu spong bar yang mi byed yongs su spong bar yang mi
translated: The faculty of understanding what has not been understood that produces the result of stream-enterer abandons through cessation and eliminates through nonarising, but does not completely abandon or thoroughly eliminate.

original: byed do // dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob par byed pa'i kun shes pa'i dbang po'i tshul yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byed do // dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob par byed pa'i kun shes pa'i dbang po'i tshul yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The faculty of understanding that produces the result of arhatship should be understood in the same way.

original: gang zag du zhig dbang po rnams gsal bar byed pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag du zhig dbang po rnams gsal bar byed pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many persons manifest the faculties?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / slob pa thams cad dang mi slob pa ni lnga ste /
analyzed: smras pa / slob pa thams cad dang mi slob pa ni lnga ste /
translated: All trainees and five non-trainees.

original: yongs su nyams pa dang / 'chi bar sems pa dang / rjes su srung ba'i chos can dang gnas pa las mi g-yo ba dang rab tu rtogs pa'i skal ba can rnams so //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa dang / 'chi bar sems pa dang / rjes su srung ba'i chos can dang gnas pa las mi g-yo ba dang rab tu rtogs pa'i skal ba can rnams so //
translated: those who retrogress, those who are resolved on death, those who guard the path, those who are unshakable, and those who are capable of penetrating.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyang ma yin byang chub sems dpa' yang ma yin te rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyang ma yin byang chub sems dpa' yang ma yin te rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not pratyekabuddhas, nor bodhisattvas, because their faculties are sharp by nature.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i dbang po gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dbang po rnams kyang gsal bar byed la lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang 'thob par byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i dbang po gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dbang po rnams kyang gsal bar byed la lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang 'thob par byed dam zhe na /
translated: In order to clarify the faculties of the stream-enterer, he also clarifies the faculties and obtains the fruit of once-returner.

original: smras pa / thob par byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / thob par byed do //
translated: He says: He obtains it.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob par byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob par byed dam zhe na /
translated: Does he obtain the fruit of non-returner?

original: smras pa / 'thob par mi byed de gnyen po stobs chung ba dang thob par bya ba'i don rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / 'thob par mi byed de gnyen po stobs chung ba dang thob par bya ba'i don rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He says: He does not obtain it, because the antidote is weak and the object to be obtained is vast.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i dbang po gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dbang po rnams kyang gsal bar byed la /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i dbang po gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dbang po rnams kyang gsal bar byed la /
translated: In order to clarify the faculties of a non-returner, one who has entered to clarify the faculties also clarifies the faculties.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba gzhan yang sgrub par byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba gzhan yang sgrub par byed dam zhe na /
translated: If one who is free from attachment also accomplishes another,

original: smras pa / sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / sgrub par byed do //
translated: it is said that he accomplishes it.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed do zhe na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed do zhe na /
translated: If one actualizes the state of an arhat,

original: smras pa / de rgyu snga ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / de rgyu snga ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: it is said that it is due to the previous cause.

original: dbang po legs par spyad pa ni thams cad kyang byed do //
analyzed: dbang po legs par spyad pa ni thams cad kyang byed do //
translated: One who has practiced the faculties well does everything.

original: ci'i phyir dbang po rnams legs par spyod par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbang po rnams legs par spyod par byed ce na /
translated: Why does one practice the faculties well?

original: smras pa / khyad par chung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par bsgrub pas stobs bskyed pa dang mang du thos @102a * //
analyzed: smras pa / khyad par chung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par bsgrub pas stobs bskyed pa dang mang du thos @102a * //
translated: It is said that one does not hold even a small distinction to be sufficient, one generates the power of accomplishment through the distinction of samadhi, and one is endowed with much hearing.

original: pas stobs bskyed pa dang / 'brel pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la dbab pas stobs bskyed pa dang / chos zab mo la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pas stobs bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /🔽smras pa / mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni dang po rnam par gzhag go //🔽de las gzhan pa lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i sa dag la ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: pas stobs bskyed pa dang / 'brel pa'i gtam rnam par gtan la dbab pas stobs bskyed pa dang / chos zab mo la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pas stobs bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na / smras pa / mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni dang po rnam par gzhag go // de las gzhan pa lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i sa dag la ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: because of the power of the development of the faculties of faith, etc., because of the power of the development of the faculty of coming to know the as yet unknown, etc., because of the power of the development of the faculty of perfect knowledge, and because of the power of the development of the faculty of the possessor of perfect knowledge.🔽How are the three faculties of the bodhisattvas, the faculty of the as yet unlearned learner, etc., established?🔽It is said: The first is established on the stage of action in faith.🔽The second is on the other stages, the stage of superior resolve, etc.🔽

original: smras pa / gsum gyis te dbang po yongs su rdzogs pas ni dbang po rnon po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gsum gyis te dbang po yongs su rdzogs pas ni dbang po rnon po gang yin pa'o //
translated: By three: by the perfection of faculties, those of sharp faculties;

original: snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs pas ni rnam par thar pa brgyad las bsam gtan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs pas ni rnam par thar pa brgyad las bsam gtan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: by the perfection of meditative concentration, those who are absorbed in the eight liberations;

original: 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pas ni phyir mi 'ong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pas ni phyir mi 'ong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: and by the perfection of fruit, those who are non-returners.

original: mi slob pa la ni yongs su rdzogs pa rnam pa gnyis dmigs te /
analyzed: mi slob pa la ni yongs su rdzogs pa rnam pa gnyis dmigs te /
translated: In the case of the non-learner, two kinds of perfection are observed:

original: dbang po yongs su rdzogs pa ni mi g-yo ba'i chos nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su rdzogs pa ni mi g-yo ba'i chos nyid kyis so //
translated: the perfection of faculties, by the nature of immovability;

original: snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: and the perfection of meditative concentration, as before.

original: mi slob pa thams cad ni 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pas yongs su rdzogs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa thams cad ni 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pas yongs su rdzogs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: All non-learners should be seen as perfected by the perfection of fruit.

original: dbang po rnams ma dul ba dang ma sbas pa dang ma bsrungs pa dang ma bsdams pa dang ma bsgoms pa zhes gang gsungs pa'i rnam grangs de dag gi don gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ma dul ba dang ma sbas pa dang ma bsrungs pa dang ma bsdams pa dang ma bsgoms pa zhes gang gsungs pa'i rnam grangs de dag gi don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the categories mentioned in the statement: “The faculties are not disciplined, not guarded, not protected, not restrained, not cultivated”?

original: smras pa / mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhis dbang po rnams dul ba nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: smras pa / mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhis dbang po rnams dul ba nyid du bstan te /
translated: He said: In brief, the faculties are taught to be disciplined by four aspects.

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs la brten nas ni dbang po rnams yul gang la gtad par mi bya ba de la ni mngon par 'du bya bas gtad par mi bya ba dang / gang la gtad par bya ba de la ni mngon par 'du bya ba kho nas nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bar bsrungs shing gtod par byed do //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs la brten nas ni dbang po rnams yul gang la gtad par mi bya ba de la ni mngon par 'du bya bas gtad par mi bya ba dang / gang la gtad par bya ba de la ni mngon par 'du bya ba kho nas nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bar bsrungs shing gtod par byed do //
translated: Based on the power of discernment, the faculties are not directed to any object by way of manifest activity, and they are directed to that which is to be directed to by way of manifest activity alone, and they are guarded against the arising of afflictions.

original: spong ba gnyen po'i stobs la brten pas ni ji skad bstan pa'i yul de nyid la rang bzhin gyis rnam par mi rgyug pa dang rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa kun du mi 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: spong ba gnyen po'i stobs la brten pas ni ji skad bstan pa'i yul de nyid la rang bzhin gyis rnam par mi rgyug pa dang rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa kun du mi 'byung bar byed do //
translated: Based on the power of abandonment and antidote, they naturally do not engage the objects as they were taught and they naturally prevent the arising of afflictions.

original: @102b gang la dbang po'i dul ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag med pa de'i dbang po rnams ni ma dul ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: @102b gang la dbang po'i dul ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag med pa de'i dbang po rnams ni ma dul ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Those who lack these four aspects of disciplined faculties should be seen as having undisciplined faculties.

original: ma sbas pa'i phyir dang ma bsrungs pa'i phyir dang ma bsdams pa'i phyir dang ma bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma sbas pa'i phyir dang ma bsrungs pa'i phyir dang ma bsdams pa'i phyir dang ma bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not concealed, not guarded, not restrained, and not cultivated.

original: gang la dbang po dul ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag yod pa de'i ni shin tu dul ba dang shin tu bsgoms pa'i bar dag de las bzlog pa las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang la dbang po dul ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag yod pa de'i ni shin tu dul ba dang shin tu bsgoms pa'i bar dag de las bzlog pa las blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those who have the four kinds of controlled faculties have the opposite of those, i.e., they are very controlled, etc.

original: ji ltar na ma dul ba dag sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma dul ba dag sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How do uncontrolled faculties produce suffering?

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal rnam pa drug skyed par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal rnam pa drug skyed par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said that they produce six kinds of suffering:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa las skyes pa dang / gzhan las nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gzhan las smad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'gyod pa las skyes pa dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba las skyes pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa las skyes pa dang / gzhan las nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gzhan las smad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'gyod pa las skyes pa dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba las skyes pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: the suffering born from abiding in the afflicted life-cycle, the suffering born from falling from higher to lower realms, the suffering born from being despised by others, the suffering born from remorse, the suffering born from going to miserable realms, and the suffering born from birth, etc.

original: shin tu dul ba dag ni de las bzlog pas sdug bsngal rnam pa drug spong ba'i phyir bde ba skyed par byed pa dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu dul ba dag ni de las bzlog pas sdug bsngal rnam pa drug spong ba'i phyir bde ba skyed par byed pa dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The opposite of the former is the latter, which is the cause of the six kinds of pleasure, because it eliminates the six kinds of suffering.

original: dbang po bcu bzhi dang sems can gyi tshogs gsum po dag ci bcu bzhis gsum bsdus sam 'on te gsum gyis bcu bzhi bsdus she na /
analyzed: dbang po bcu bzhi dang sems can gyi tshogs gsum po dag ci bcu bzhis gsum bsdus sam 'on te gsum gyis bcu bzhi bsdus she na /
translated: Are the three groups of sentient beings included in the fourteen or are the fourteen included in the three?

original: smras pa / gsum gyis bcu bzhi bsdus kyi bcu bzhis ni gsum ma bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / gsum gyis bcu bzhi bsdus kyi bcu bzhis ni gsum ma bsdus so //
translated: It is said: the three include the fourteen, but the fourteen do not include the three.

original: gang dag ma bsdus she na /
analyzed: gang dag ma bsdus she na /
translated: What are not included?

original: phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams kyi phyogs so //
translated: The external sense-spheres.

original: sems can gyi tshogs gsum ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs gsum ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The three groups of sentient beings are those who experience the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: dbang po lnga dang tshor ba gsum po dag ci lngas gsum bsdus sam 'on te gsum gyis lnga bsdus she na /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang tshor ba gsum po dag ci lngas gsum bsdus sam 'on te gsum gyis lnga bsdus she na /
translated: Are the three feelings included in the five or are the five included in the three?

original: smras pa / gcig gis gcig bsdus par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gcig gis gcig bsdus par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is said: each includes the other.

original: dbang po lnga dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag ni lngas sum cu rtsa bdun bsdus sam 'on te sum cu rtsa bdun gyis lnga bsdus she na /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag ni lngas sum cu rtsa bdun bsdus sam 'on te sum cu rtsa bdun gyis lnga bsdus she na /
translated: Are the five faculties and the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment included in the five, or are the five included in the thirty-seven?

original: smras pa / sum cu rtsa bdun gyis lnga bsdus kyi lngas ni sum cu rtsa bdun ma bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / sum cu rtsa bdun gyis lnga bsdus kyi lngas ni sum cu rtsa bdun ma bsdus so //
translated: It is said: The five are included in the thirty-seven, but the thirty-seven are not included in the five.

original: gang dag ma bsdus she na /
analyzed: gang dag ma bsdus she na /
translated: What are not included?

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang btang snyoms te /🔽de ltar drug po de dang gam /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang btang snyoms te / de ltar drug po de dang gam /
translated: Right speech, right action, right livelihood, right joy, right effort, and right samādhi.

original: chos bzhis ma bsdus so //🔽dbang po @103a * //
analyzed: chos bzhis ma bsdus so // dbang po @103a * //
translated: Thus, those six are not included in the four.

original: gzhan lnga dang dbang po gsum po dag ci lngas gsum bsdus sam 'on te gsum gyis lnga bsdus she na /
analyzed: gzhan lnga dang dbang po gsum po dag ci lngas gsum bsdus sam 'on te gsum gyis lnga bsdus she na /
translated: The five faculties and the three faculties are included in the five, but are the five included in the three?

original: smras pa / gsum gyis lnga bsdus kyi lngas ni gsum ma bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / gsum gyis lnga bsdus kyi lngas ni gsum ma bsdus so //
translated: It is said: The five are included in the three, but the three are not included in the five.

original: gang dag ma bsdus she na /
analyzed: gang dag ma bsdus she na /
translated: What are not included?

original: yid kyi dbang po dang bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams ma bsdus so //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po dang bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams ma bsdus so //
translated: The mental faculty, the faculty of pleasure, the faculty of mental happiness and the faculty of equanimity are not included.

original: yongs su shes pa dgu po dag dbang po du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dgu po dag dbang po du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: By how many faculties are the nine kinds of complete knowledge included?

original: smras pa / yongs su shes pa rnams ni spong ba yongs su shes pas bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po gang gis kyang ma bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / yongs su shes pa rnams ni spong ba yongs su shes pas bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po gang gis kyang ma bsdus so //
translated: It is said: Since the complete knowledges are included in the complete knowledge of abandonment, they are not included by any faculty.

original: de la yongs su shes pa dgu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su shes pa dgu gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the nine kinds of complete knowledge?

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa dang po'o //
translated: The first complete knowledge is the abandonment of the objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin in the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i de dag nyid spangs pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i de dag nyid spangs pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the abandonment of those same objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin in the form and formless realms.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the abandonment of the objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation in the desire realm.

original: sa gong ma pa'i de dag nyid spangs pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sa gong ma pa'i de dag nyid spangs pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the abandonment of those same objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation in the higher realms.

original: sa 'og ma pa dang gong ma pa dag gi lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa lnga pa dang drug pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa dang gong ma pa dag gi lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa lnga pa dang drug pa'o //
translated: The fifth and sixth perfect knowledges are the abandonment of the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing of the lower and higher stages.

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i spangs pa ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i spangs pa ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the abandonment of the factors associated with the lower realms.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pas ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pas ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the exhaustion of attachment to the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags zad pas ni yongs su shes pa dgu pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags zad pas ni yongs su shes pa dgu pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The ninth is the perfect knowledge of the exhaustion of all attachment.

original: de la mdor bsdu na rgyu gnyis kyis yongs su shes pa rnams rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na rgyu gnyis kyis yongs su shes pa rnams rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya ste /
translated: In brief, the perfect knowledges should be understood as being established by two causes:

original: bden pa rtogs pas spong ba dang khams las yang dag par 'da' bas spang ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa rtogs pas spong ba dang khams las yang dag par 'da' bas spang ba'o //
translated: abandonment through realizing the truths and abandonment through transcending the realms.

original: de la mtshan nyid 'dra ba dang / khams mi 'dra ba dang / 'dra bas ni dang po gnyis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid 'dra ba dang / khams mi 'dra ba dang / 'dra bas ni dang po gnyis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The first two are established by similarity of characteristics and similarity of realm.

original: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang khams mi 'dra ba dang 'dra bas ni gzhan bzhi rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang khams mi 'dra ba dang 'dra bas ni gzhan bzhi rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The other four are established by dissimilarity of characteristics and dissimilarity of realm.

original: khams dman pa las yang dag par 'das pa ni gzhan gcig rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: khams dman pa las yang dag par 'das pa ni gzhan gcig rnam par gzhag go //
translated: One who has completely transcended the inferior realms is posited as another.🔽

original: khams bar ma las yang dag par 'das pa dang // khams bzang po las yang dag par 'das pas ni yongs su shes pa gzhan gnyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: khams bar ma las yang dag par 'das pa dang // khams bzang po las yang dag par 'das pas ni yongs su shes pa gzhan gnyis rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the other two perfect knowledges are established by passing beyond the middling element and by passing beyond the excellent element.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs @103b pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang dag yin pa de dag dbang po du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs @103b pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang dag yin pa de dag dbang po du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: By how many faculties are the thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, etc., the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha included?

original: smras pa / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams ni lce'i dbang po dang dbang po bzhi pa lus kyi dbang po dang pho'i dbang po dang mig gi dbang po dang lce'i dbang po'i gnas rnams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams ni lce'i dbang po dang dbang po bzhi pa lus kyi dbang po dang pho'i dbang po dang mig gi dbang po dang lce'i dbang po'i gnas rnams kyis bsdus so //
translated: The thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks are included in the four faculties, namely, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, the male faculty, and the eye faculty, etc.

original: stobs bcu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi rgyud la mda' ba'i shes rab kyi dbang po dang kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang pos bsdus so //
analyzed: stobs bcu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi rgyud la mda' ba'i shes rab kyi dbang po dang kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang pos bsdus so //
translated: The ten powers are included in the faculty of perfect knowledge and the faculty of final and complete knowledge, which are present in the mind of the Tathagata.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi ni lnga dang gcig pu de nyid kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi ni lnga dang gcig pu de nyid kyis bsdus so //
translated: The four forms of fearlessness are included in the same five faculties, as well as in the faculty of perfect knowledge.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams ji lta ba bzhin du bsrung ba med pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams ji lta ba bzhin du bsrung ba med pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The four forms of fearlessness and the four forms of unobstructed knowledge are included in the same five faculties.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dbang po du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dbang po du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: By how many faculties are the three closely placed mindfulnesses included?

original: smras pa / dbang po gang dag gis kyang ma bsdus mod kyi 'on kyang dbang po drug gis yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i chags pa med pa dang zhe sdang med pas bsdus so //
analyzed: smras pa / dbang po gang dag gis kyang ma bsdus mod kyi 'on kyang dbang po drug gis yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i chags pa med pa dang zhe sdang med pas bsdus so //
translated: It is said: although they are not included in any faculties, they are included in the absence of attachment and the absence of hatred, which are accomplished by the six faculties.

original: thugs rje chen po yang dbang po gang dag gis kyang ma bsdus te /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po yang dbang po gang dag gis kyang ma bsdus te /
translated: Great compassion is also not included in any faculties.

original: de dag gis yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: de dag gis yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dag gis bsdus so //
translated: It is included in the absence of hatred and the absence of delusion, which are accomplished by them.

original: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ni stobs bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ni stobs bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The reality of non-forgetfulness should be understood as like the powers.

original: rnam pa thams cad dang mchog mkhyen pa yang stobs bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad dang mchog mkhyen pa yang stobs bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of the most supreme should be understood as like the powers.

original: bag chags yang dag par bcom pa ni dbang po gang gis kyang ma bsdus mod kyi /
analyzed: bag chags yang dag par bcom pa ni dbang po gang gis kyang ma bsdus mod kyi /
translated: The complete destruction of the propensities is not included in any of the faculties.

original: 'on kyang dbang po drug gis yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas bsdus so //
analyzed: 'on kyang dbang po drug gis yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas bsdus so //
translated: Nevertheless, it is included in the abandonment of the afflictions that is accomplished by the six faculties.

original: gang gi tshe dgra bcom pas nyon mongs pa'i tshogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len ma lus par spangs pa'i tshe dgra bcom pas gang ma spangs pa'i gnas ngan len gyi phyogs de gang zhig yod na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dgra bcom pas nyon mongs pa'i tshogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len ma lus par spangs pa'i tshe dgra bcom pas gang ma spangs pa'i gnas ngan len gyi phyogs de gang zhig yod na /
translated: When an arhat has completely abandoned all the negative tendencies that are concordant with the collection of afflictions, what is the aspect of negative tendencies that the arhats have not abandoned

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de spangs pas bag chags yang dag par bcom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de spangs pas bag chags yang dag par bcom pa yin zhe na /
translated: that the Tathāgata has abandoned and thus completely destroyed the propensities?

original: smras pa / dgra bcom pas ni rnam par smin pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa de ma spangs la de bzhin gshegs pas ni spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / dgra bcom pas ni rnam par smin pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa de ma spangs la de bzhin gshegs pas ni spangs pa yin no //
translated: He replied: “The Arhats have not abandoned the side that is the maturation of the four sustenances, but the Tathāgatas have abandoned it.

original: zas bzhi po 'di dag ni dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po 'phel ba'i phyir 'jug pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa de la zas bzhi ni gang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po gang dag rgyas pa'i phyir ni 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: zas bzhi po 'di dag ni dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po 'phel ba'i phyir 'jug pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa de la zas bzhi ni gang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po gang dag rgyas pa'i phyir ni 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “The four sustenances are engaged in order to increase the faculties and the great elements.” What are the four sustenances?

original: smras pa / @104a * //
analyzed: smras pa / @104a * //
translated: He replied:

original: zas bzhi ni kham dang reg pa dang yid la sems pa dang rnam par shes pa'i zas so //
analyzed: zas bzhi ni kham dang reg pa dang yid la sems pa dang rnam par shes pa'i zas so //
translated: The four sustenances are sustenances that are eaten, contact, mental intention, and consciousness.

original: dbang po ni dbang po gzugs can lnga dang yid kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni dbang po gzugs can lnga dang yid kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculties are the five physical faculties and the mental faculty.

original: 'byung ba chen po ni dbang po'i rten gyi 'byung ba chen po rnams so //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po ni dbang po'i rten gyi 'byung ba chen po rnams so //
translated: The great elements are the great elements that are the basis of the faculties.

original: de la kham gyi kha zas gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kham gyi kha zas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sustenance that is eaten?

original: smras pa ; dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par bya ba'i phyir nye bar spyad pa gang yin pa ste zas ma yin pa ni de las bzlog pa las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa ; dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par bya ba'i phyir nye bar spyad pa gang yin pa ste zas ma yin pa ni de las bzlog pa las blta bar bya'o //
translated: He says: It is that which is used to nourish the faculties and the great elements. Food that is not food should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: kham gyi zas ji lta ba bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang zas dang zas ma yin par de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kham gyi zas ji lta ba bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang zas dang zas ma yin par de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining foods should be understood as food and not food in the same way that oral food is.

original: kham gyi zas kyis ji ltar zas kyi bya ba byed /
analyzed: kham gyi zas kyis ji ltar zas kyi bya ba byed /
translated: How does oral food function as food?

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i zas kyi bar gyis kyang ji ltar zas kyi bya ba byed ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i zas kyi bar gyis kyang ji ltar zas kyi bya ba byed ce na /
translated: How do the remaining foods up to and including consciousness function as food?🔽He says: It functions as food by nourishing consciousness through the power of the great elements that are the basis of the faculties.

original: smras pa / stobs kyis rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed cing stobs dang ldan pas kyang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po de dag rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / stobs kyis rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed cing stobs dang ldan pas kyang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po de dag rgyas par byed do //
translated: It functions as food by nourishing consciousness through the power of the great elements that are the basis of the faculties.

original: reg pas ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang de la la la btang snyoms kyis phan 'dogs pas rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed la /
analyzed: reg pas ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang de la la la btang snyoms kyis phan 'dogs pas rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed la /
translated: Contact functions as food by nourishing consciousness through the experience of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: phan btags pa des kyang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed do //🔽yid la sems pas ni yul 'dod pas 'thob pa'i rgyu yang dag pa'i thabs nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa la brten nas /
analyzed: phan btags pa des kyang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed do // yid la sems pas ni yul 'dod pas 'thob pa'i rgyu yang dag pa'i thabs nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa la brten nas /
translated: and the faculties and the great elements are nourished by that benefit.🔽Mental intention is the cause of obtaining a desired object. It is the cause of the nourishment of consciousness, which is the basis of afflicted and unafflicted means of obtaining a desired object.

original: re ba'i yid bde ba ma 'ongs pa'i yul la dmigs pas rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed de de las kyang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: re ba'i yid bde ba ma 'ongs pa'i yul la dmigs pas rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed de de las kyang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed do //
translated: The nourishment of consciousness is the cause of the nourishment of the faculties and the great elements.

original: de ltar zas gsum po rnams kyi de ltar dang ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pas /
analyzed: de ltar zas gsum po rnams kyi de ltar dang ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pas /
translated: Thus, the three nutriments are established on the basis of the past, present, and future.

original: rnam par shes pa la stobs dang ldan pa nyid bskyed pa'i phyir dang rnam par shes pas kyang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa'i phyir zas bzhi po rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la stobs dang ldan pa nyid bskyed pa'i phyir dang rnam par shes pas kyang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa'i phyir zas bzhi po rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The four nutriments should be understood as being established in order to generate the powerful state of consciousness that arises from the three nutriments and in order to nourish the faculties and the great elements through consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ji ltar na yid kyi dbang po'i zas yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ji ltar na yid kyi dbang po'i zas yin zhe na /
translated: How is consciousness the nutriment of the faculty of mind?

original: de ltar nye bar rton pa rnam pa gsum gyis nye bar brtan pa de gong nas gong du ches brtas pa dang ches stobs dang ldan par skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar nye bar rton pa rnam pa gsum gyis nye bar brtan pa de gong nas gong du ches brtas pa dang ches stobs dang ldan par skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the three types of reliance are causes for the stability of the faculties and the great elements, which increases and strengthens them.

original: 'o na gnyid dang tshangs par spyod pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gnyid dang tshangs par spyod pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa yin na /
translated: If sleep, celibacy, and meditative attainment increase the faculties and the great elements,

original: ci'i phyir zas yin par rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zas yin par rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
translated: why are they not posited as nutriment?

original: smras pa / rgyas @104b pa ni gnyis po 'di dag yin te don gzhan la phan 'dogs pas rgyas pa dang gnod pa mi byed pas rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyas @104b pa ni gnyis po 'di dag yin te don gzhan la phan 'dogs pas rgyas pa dang gnod pa mi byed pas rgyas pa'o //
translated: It is said: There are two types of increase: increase that benefits other things and increase that does not harm.

original: de la gnyid la sogs pa ni rgyas pa phyi ma shos kyis rgyas par byed pa yin gyi snga ma shos kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gnyid la sogs pa ni rgyas pa phyi ma shos kyis rgyas par byed pa yin gyi snga ma shos kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: Sleep and so on are increase that does not harm, but they are not increase that benefits other things.

original: de'i phyir de dag zas yin par rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag zas yin par rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: Therefore they are not posited as nutriment.

original: ci'i phyir lus gnas par byed pa'i srog gi dbang po zas yin par rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lus gnas par byed pa'i srog gi dbang po zas yin par rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
translated: Why is the faculty of life force that maintains the body not posited as nutriment?

original: smras pa / de ni zas med na rgyas par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / de ni zas med na rgyas par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Answer: Because it does not nourish when there is no food.

original: kham gyi zas rags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kham gyi zas rags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is coarse material food?

original: smras pa / lhar gyur pa rnams kyi ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / lhar gyur pa rnams kyi ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Answer: That which is not for the gods.

original: cha phra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: cha phra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is subtle?

original: smras pa / lhar gyur pa rnams kyi gang yin pa ste /🔽'di ltar de dag gi zas ni zos ma thag kho nar lus de nyid la 'ju bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / lhar gyur pa rnams kyi gang yin pa ste / 'di ltar de dag gi zas ni zos ma thag kho nar lus de nyid la 'ju bar 'gyur te /
translated: Answer: That which is for the gods.

original: rim gyis ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim gyis ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because as soon as they eat it, it is digested in their bodies and not gradually.

original: reg pa dang yid la sems pa dang rnam par shes pa'i zas rags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa dang yid la sems pa dang rnam par shes pa'i zas rags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is coarse contact, volition, and consciousness?

original: smras pa / 'dod pa na spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa na spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Answer: That which is in the realm of desire.

original: cha phra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: cha phra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is subtle?

original: smras pa / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Answer: That which is in the realms of form and of the formless.

original: sems can 'byung ba rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems can 'byung ba rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are beings who have appeared?

original: da ltar skyes shing grub pa gang dag yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: da ltar skyes shing grub pa gang dag yin pa rnams so //
translated: Those who have been born and have come into existence.

original: 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are beings who are to appear?

original: smras pa / ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa 'byung bar 'dod pa gang dag yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: smras pa / ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa 'byung bar 'dod pa gang dag yin pa rnams so //
translated: He replied, “Those that are held to be the origin of future existence.

original: gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: ” What is duration?

original: smras pa / gnod pa med pas rgyas pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gnod pa med pas rgyas pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: He replied, “Those that are extended by the absence of harm.

original: 'tsho ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'tsho ba gang zhe na /
translated: ” What is life?

original: smras pa / phan 'dogs pas rgyas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / phan 'dogs pas rgyas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: He replied, “Those that are extended by benefit.

original: sems can 'byung ba rnams gnas pa dang / 'tsho bar 'gyur ba'i zas de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems can 'byung ba rnams gnas pa dang / 'tsho bar 'gyur ba'i zas de dag gang zhe na /
translated: ” What are the foods that cause the duration and life of beings who have come into existence?

original: smras pa / ji skad brjod pa'i byed pas so //
analyzed: smras pa / ji skad brjod pa'i byed pas so //
translated: He replied, “As has been stated, by their function.

original: ji ltar na 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams la phan 'dogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams la phan 'dogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: ” How do they benefit those who are held to be the origin of future existence?

original: smras pa / sgo gsum gyis rnam par shes pa la nyon mongs pa dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyas pa dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyas pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / sgo gsum gyis rnam par shes pa la nyon mongs pa dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyas pa dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyas pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: He replied, “There are two kinds of extension of afflictions: extension of afflictions by the afflictions of moral defilement and by the afflictions of karma through the three doors.

original: sgo gsum gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa bstsags pa'i rnam par shes pa de yang 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams kyi skye ba de'i mjug thogs su de las gzhan pa 'byung ba la phan 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: sgo gsum gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa bstsags pa'i rnam par shes pa de yang 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams kyi skye ba de'i mjug thogs su de las gzhan pa 'byung ba la phan 'dogs par byed do //
translated: The consciousness that is the accumulation of the afflictions of the three doors also assists the arising of another consciousness after the end of that birth for those who desire rebirth.

original: kham gyi zas dus gang gi tshe zas nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: kham gyi zas dus gang gi tshe zas nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: When is material food posited as food?

original: smras pa / @105a * //🔽'ju ba'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: smras pa / @105a * // 'ju ba'i tshe na'o //
translated: It is said:🔽When it is being digested.

original: yongs su longs spyod pa'i tshe na ni reg pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa'i tshe na ni reg pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: When it is being enjoyed, it is posited as contact,

original: des byas pa'i phan 'dogs pa brtas par byed pa gang yin pa'o //🔽de'i phyir zas ni skye mched gsum gyis bsdas  pa yin par rnam par gzhag gi kha dog gis ni ma yin te 'di ltar dri dang ro dang reg bya dag gis de dag gi ro dang mthu dang rnam par smin pa la sogs pa yongs su 'ju
analyzed: des byas pa'i phan 'dogs pa brtas par byed pa gang yin pa'o // de'i phyir zas ni skye mched gsum gyis bsdas  pa yin par rnam par gzhag gi kha dog gis ni ma yin te 'di ltar dri dang ro dang reg bya dag gis de dag gi ro dang mthu dang rnam par smin pa la sogs pa yongs su 'ju
translated: because it increases the benefit produced by it.🔽Therefore food is posited as being included in the three bases, but not by color, because smell, taste, and tactility increase the potency of that food and its karmic maturation.

original: bas phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bas phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They benefit or harm through smell, taste, and tactility.

original: kham gyi zas gang yongs su longs spyod pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: kham gyi zas gang yongs su longs spyod pa'i tshe na /
translated: When one experiences the enjoyment of gross or subtle food,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: kha ba dang tsha ba la sogs pas gnod pa byed la 'ju ba'i tshe na phan 'dogs pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: kha ba dang tsha ba la sogs pas gnod pa byed la 'ju ba'i tshe na phan 'dogs pa'ang yod do //
translated: Sometimes, it is harmful when one experiences the enjoyment of food, such as when it is too hot or too cold, but it is beneficial when it is digested.

original: yongs su longs spyod pa'i tshe na phan 'dogs la 'ju ba'i tshe na gnod pa byed pa 'di lta ste zhim la mi 'phrod pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa'i tshe na phan 'dogs la 'ju ba'i tshe na gnod pa byed pa 'di lta ste zhim la mi 'phrod pa'ang yod de /
translated: Sometimes, it is beneficial when one experiences the enjoyment of food, but it is harmful when it is digested, such as when it is delicious but indigestible.

original: de'i phyir 'ju ba'i tshe kho na zas yin par rnam par gzhag gi yongs su longs spyod pa'i tshe na ni ma yin no //🔽gang gi tshe de dag las gzhan pa 'du byed rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyu mang po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'ju ba'i tshe kho na zas yin par rnam par gzhag gi yongs su longs spyod pa'i tshe na ni ma yin no // gang gi tshe de dag las gzhan pa 'du byed rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyu mang po 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, food is established as that which is beneficial when it is digested, not when it is experienced.

original: skye ba dang / sngon gyi las dang rdzu 'phrul rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang bar chad spangs pa dag kyang dmigs pa'i tshe ci'i phyir zas kho na gsungs she na /
analyzed: skye ba dang / sngon gyi las dang rdzu 'phrul rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang bar chad spangs pa dag kyang dmigs pa'i tshe ci'i phyir zas kho na gsungs she na /
translated: When many causes of the duration of other formations are observed, such as birth, past karma, the cause of supernatural power, the assembly of conditions, and the abandonment of obstacles, why is only food taught?

original: smras pa / zas rnams ni mang po'i phyir dang / brda phrad sla ba'i phyir dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la 'jug par sla ba'i phyir dang / nyin gcig bzhin du bde ba rgyas par byed pa'i phyir de dag kho na bstan to //
analyzed: smras pa / zas rnams ni mang po'i phyir dang / brda phrad sla ba'i phyir dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag la 'jug par sla ba'i phyir dang / nyin gcig bzhin du bde ba rgyas par byed pa'i phyir de dag kho na bstan to //
translated: He said: Because the foods are many, because they are easy to understand, because the establishments of mindfulness are easy to enter, and because they increase happiness every day, they are taught.

original: sems can dmyal ba rnams na ni kham gyi zas med do //🔽mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ba'i lha rnams la yang med de sems can dmyal ba pa rnams ni phal cher sngon gyi las kyi stobs bskyed pas gnas te de'i phyir dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po la gnod par byed pa'i rgyu chen po dag gis kyang 'chi
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba rnams na ni kham gyi zas med do // mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ba'i lha rnams la yang med de sems can dmyal ba pa rnams ni phal cher sngon gyi las kyi stobs bskyed pas gnas te de'i phyir dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po la gnod par byed pa'i rgyu chen po dag gis kyang 'chi
translated: There is no oral food in the hells.

original: bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It also does not exist among the gods of the realm of meditative development, because the beings in the hells are mostly sustained by the power of previous karma, and therefore they do not die even when their faculties and the great elements are harmed by great causes of harm.

original: de dag la rlung cha phra mo rjes su zhugs pa'i zas tha snyad gdags pa ma gtogs pa yod do //
analyzed: de dag la rlung cha phra mo rjes su zhugs pa'i zas tha snyad gdags pa ma gtogs pa yod do //
translated: But they do have food that consists of subtle wind particles, except for the beings in Avīci.

original: dbang po gang dag lus las gzhan pa de la brten te 'byung ba de dag yul las kyang yin pa gang dag yul la brten te 'byung ba de dag lus las kyang yin nam zhe na /🔽smras pa / re zhig gang dag yul la brten te 'byung ba de dag ni lu las kyang yin no //
analyzed: dbang po gang dag lus las gzhan pa de la brten te 'byung ba de dag yul las kyang yin pa gang dag yul la brten te 'byung ba de dag lus las kyang yin nam zhe na / smras pa / re zhig gang dag yul la brten te 'byung ba de dag ni lu las kyang yin no //
translated: Are those faculties that arise in dependence on the body and those faculties that arise in dependence on the object also faculties that arise in dependence on the object?🔽Those faculties that arise in dependence on the object are also faculties that arise in dependence on the body.

original: lus la brten te 'byung la yul las ma yin pa'ang yod de dbang po @105b gzugs can de dag dang mtshungs pa gang dag yin pa rnams te de dag ni 'byung ba chen po la brten pa yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa la brten pa dag ces

analyzed: tshul ma yin pa'i gnas ni ma yin no //
