analyzed: de la phung po la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni mdor bsdu na rgyu drug gis rig par bya ste /
translated: The presentation of the aggregates and so on should be understood in brief through six causes:

original: lus rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa dang / lus can rnam par gzhag pa @106b dang ; de'i 'jug pa'i thabs rnam par gzhag pa dang / de nyid kyi 'jug pa la nyams pa dang khyad par du 'gyur ba'i thabs rnam par gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: lus rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa dang / lus can rnam par gzhag pa @106b dang ; de'i 'jug pa'i thabs rnam par gzhag pa dang / de nyid kyi 'jug pa la nyams pa dang khyad par du 'gyur ba'i thabs rnam par gzhag pa dang /
translated: the presentation of the body, the presentation of its cause, the presentation of the embodied being, the presentation of the means of engaging in that body, the presentation of the means of degeneration and enhancement with regard to that engagement, and the presentation of the classification of the body.

original: de la longs spyod pa'i bdag po rnam par gzhag pa dang / mdor bsdu na mkhas pa drug po de dag gis legs par zin pa ma yin pa drug po dag lus legs par zin pa ma yin pa dang / rang bzhin dang dbang phyug la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i rgyu legs par zin pa ma yin pa dang /

original: lus de la gnas pa'i bdag po legs par zin pa ma yin pa dang / de'i 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i 'jig pa legs par zin pa ma yin pa dang / de'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba la 'bad pa legs par zin pa ma yin pa dang /🔽de'i yul 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i bdag po legs par zin pa ma yin pa rnam par bstsal ba yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lus de la gnas pa'i bdag po legs par zin pa ma yin pa dang / de'i 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i 'jig pa legs par zin pa ma yin pa dang / de'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba la 'bad pa legs par zin pa ma yin pa dang /🔽de'i yul 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i bdag po legs par zin pa ma yin pa rnam par bstsal ba yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: The six who do not enjoy it are the six who do not enjoy the body, the six who do not enjoy the cause, the six who do not enjoy the self-abiding, the six who do not enjoy the destruction of death and birth, the six who do not enjoy the effort of virtue and non-virtue, and the six who do not enjoy the enjoyment of the desired and undesired objects.

analyzed: mdor bsdu na phan yon rnam pa bcu ste /

translated: The remaining texts of the determination of these two levels are not available.🔽The determination of the three levels of investigation with investigation and analysis, etc.

original: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sa gsum gyi rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni ci'i phyir gshin rje la chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sa gsum gyi rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni ci'i phyir gshin rje la chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya /
translated: Why is Yama called the king of Dharma?

original: ci sems can rnams la gnod pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ram 'on te phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir yin /
analyzed: ci sems can rnams la gnod pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ram 'on te phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir yin /
translated: Is it because he inflicts harm on sentient beings or because he benefits them?

original: gal te gnod pa nye bar sgrub na ni des na chos kyi rgyal po zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te gnod pa nye bar sgrub na ni des na chos kyi rgyal po zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If he inflicts harm, then it is not suitable to call him the king of Dharma.

original: gal te phan pa nye bar sgrub na ni des na ji ltar sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa brjod dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phan pa nye bar sgrub na ni des na ji ltar sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa brjod dgos so zhe na /
translated: If he benefits, then it must be explained how he benefits sentient beings.

original: smras pa / phan pa nye bar sgrub pa yin gyi gnod pa nye bar sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / phan pa nye bar sgrub pa yin gyi gnod pa nye bar sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: He said: They benefit them and do not harm them.

original: 'di ltar de ni de dang nye bar gyur pa'i sems can de dag la de 'dra ba'i lus dag gis khyed cag ni rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes dran pa nye bar gnas par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni de dang nye bar gyur pa'i sems can de dag la de 'dra ba'i lus dag gis khyed cag ni rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes dran pa nye bar gnas par byed de /
translated: Thus, they cause those sentient beings who are close to them to be mindful of the fact that they experience the effects of their own actions through bodies that are like that.

original: des na rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu bdag nyid kyis myong ba kun du shes pa'i sems can de dag gshin rje'i mi sems can gyi las kyi dbang gis grub pa sprul pa lta bu sems can 'byung po ma yin pa de dag la kun nas
analyzed: des na rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu bdag nyid kyis myong ba kun du shes pa'i sems can de dag gshin rje'i mi sems can gyi las kyi dbang gis grub pa sprul pa lta bu sems can 'byung po ma yin pa de dag la kun nas
translated: Therefore, those sentient beings who are aware that they experience the effects of their own actions do not become angry toward the henchmen of Yama, who are not sentient beings but are like magical apparitions that are created by the power of the karma of those sentient beings.

original: mnar sems kyi sems med pa dang khong khro ba'i sems med pa dang khon du 'dzin pa'i bsam @107b pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mnar sems kyi sems med pa dang khong khro ba'i sems med pa dang khon du 'dzin pa'i bsam @107b pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: They do not have a hostile mind, an angry mind, or a vindictive thought.

original: de'i 'og tu sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i las sar pa dag sogs par mi byed cing sngon gyi las zad par byas nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i las sar pa dag sogs par mi byed cing sngon gyi las zad par byas nas /
translated: After that, he does not accumulate new karma that would lead to rebirth in the hells, and he exhausts his previous karma.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba dag nas yongs su thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba dag nas yongs su thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: He is completely liberated from the destiny of the hells.

original: de lta bas na gshin rje ni sems can dmyal ba pa rnams la phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gshin rje ni sems can dmyal ba pa rnams la phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Yama is called the “king of Dharma” because he benefits hell beings by bringing about their welfare.

original: de la sems can gang dag sems can dmyal ba rnams su skyes pa skyes ma thag tu skye ba rjes su dran par 'gyur ba dag la ni chos kyi rgyal po gshin rje rjes su ston par mi byed do //
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag sems can dmyal ba rnams su skyes pa skyes ma thag tu skye ba rjes su dran par 'gyur ba dag la ni chos kyi rgyal po gshin rje rjes su ston par mi byed do //
translated: Those sentient beings who are born in the hells and who remember their birth are not instructed by Yama, the king of Dharma.

original: gang dag skye ba rjes su mi dran pa rnams la ni rjes su ston par byed do //
analyzed: gang dag skye ba rjes su mi dran pa rnams la ni rjes su ston par byed do //
translated: But those who do not remember their birth are instructed.

original: gang dag der skyes pa skye ba rjes su mi dran pa'i gang zag ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag der skyes pa skye ba rjes su mi dran pa'i gang zag ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Those persons who are born there and do not remember their birth should be understood, in brief, as being of three types.

original: shin tu rmongs pa 'di lta ste dper na yul mtha' 'khob rnams su skyes pa rnam par mi dpyod cing yongs su mi dpyod par sdig pa la zhugs pa lta bu rnams dang / shin tu bag med pa 'di lta ste dper na 'dod pa la longs spyod pa 'dod pa chen po dag la lhag par chags pa rnam par mi dpyod cing yongs su mi dpyod par sdig pa la zhugs pa lta bu rnams dang /
analyzed: shin tu rmongs pa 'di lta ste dper na yul mtha' 'khob rnams su skyes pa rnam par mi dpyod cing yongs su mi dpyod par sdig pa la zhugs pa lta bu rnams dang / shin tu bag med pa 'di lta ste dper na 'dod pa la longs spyod pa 'dod pa chen po dag la lhag par chags pa rnam par mi dpyod cing yongs su mi dpyod par sdig pa la zhugs pa lta bu rnams dang /
translated: They are extremely confused, like those born in barbarian borderlands who engage in nonvirtue without analysis or investigation. They are extremely careless, like those who are attached to the enjoyment of sense objects and who engage in nonvirtue without analysis or investigation.

original: shin tu log par lta ba 'di lta ste dper na thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba dang ldan pa rnam par mi dpyod cing yongs su mi dpyod par sdig pa la zhugs pa lta bu rnams te de dag ni rang gis rjes su
analyzed: shin tu log par lta ba 'di lta ste dper na thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba dang ldan pa rnam par mi dpyod cing yongs su mi dpyod par sdig pa la zhugs pa lta bu rnams te de dag ni rang gis rjes su
translated: They have extremely wrong views, like those who have wrong views that deny everything and who engage in nonvirtue without analysis or investigation.

original: dran par byed mi nus pa de'i phyir de dag la rjes su dran par byed do //
analyzed: dran par byed mi nus pa de'i phyir de dag la rjes su dran par byed do //
translated: They are unable to recollect this on their own, so they recollect it through others.

original: rgya mtsho chen po dag gi chu rnams ni rgyu gnyis kyis na lan tshva'i ro dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po dag gi chu rnams ni rgyu gnyis kyis na lan tshva'i ro dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
translated: The waters of the great ocean have the taste of salt because of two causes.

original: der skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsod nams kyi dbang po dang / skam la gnas pa'i sems can de dag kha cig gi bsod na mas ma yin pa'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: der skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsod nams kyi dbang po dang / skam la gnas pa'i sems can de dag kha cig gi bsod na mas ma yin pa'i dbang gis te /
translated: They have the power of the merit of the sentient beings born there, and they have the power of the merit of some sentient beings living on land.

original: 'di ltar lan tshva'i ro de nyid la brten nas srog chags phra mo gang dag rgya mtshor skyes pa rnams mi rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pas de dag la de rnams kyis gnod par byar med pa dang / rgya mtsho chen po na rin po che'i khyad par sna tshogs gang dag yod pa de dag kyang lan tshva'i ro de nyid la brten nas skam la gnas pa'i sems can dag kha cig gis rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lan tshva'i ro de nyid la brten nas srog chags phra mo gang dag rgya mtshor skyes pa rnams mi rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pas de dag la de rnams kyis gnod par byar med pa dang / rgya mtsho chen po na rin po che'i khyad par sna tshogs gang dag yod pa de dag kyang lan tshva'i ro de nyid la brten nas skam la gnas pa'i sems can dag kha cig gis rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In fact, the small animals born in the ocean, which are not in the domain of humans, are not harmed by them, because they depend on the taste of salt. And the various jewels of the great ocean are difficult to obtain by some sentient beings living on land, because they depend on the taste of salt.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu @108a * //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu @108a * //
translated: Here, the defilement of defilement is the most important.

original: dbye ba ni rnam pa lngas pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dbye ba ni rnam pa lngas pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of the defilements is established by means of five categories.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are these five?

original: ngo bo nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / spong ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / gnyen po'i rab tu dbye bas so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / spong ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / gnyen po'i rab tu dbye bas so //
translated: They are: the essential nature, the classification according to their essential nature, the classification according to their defilement, the classification according to their abandonment and the classification according to their counteractives.

original: de la ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the essential nature?

original: mdor bsdu na ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, the essential nature is twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / lta ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / lta ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The defilements are of the nature of views and of the nature of that which is not views.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification according to their essential nature?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcur blta bar bya ste /
translated: In brief, it is tenfold:

original: lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa lnga dang lta ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa lnga dang lta ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: the classification of the defilements which are of the nature of views is fivefold; the classification of the defilements which are not of the nature of views is fivefold.

original: de dag bsdus nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bcur 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /🔽'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang the tshom mo //🔽de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag bsdus nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bcur 'gyur te / 'di lta ste / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang the tshom mo // de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: 1. the view of the transitory composite, 2. the extreme views, 3. false views, 4. the esteeming of views, 5. the esteeming of morality and asceticism, 6. desire, 7. hatred, 8. conceit, 9. ignorance, and 10. scepticism.🔽What is the view of the transitory composite?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la bdag gam bdag gir lta ba dang / mngon par zhen pa dang sems la 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya'o ;🔽/ de'ang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /🔽lhan cig skyes pa dang kun brtags pa'o //

analyzed: de la lhan cig skyes pa ni byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang tha na ri dvags dang bya rnams kyi yang yin no //
translated: The innate view of the transitory collection is that of all ordinary beings, even animals and birds.

original: kun brtags pa ni gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyi yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyi yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The imagined view of the transitory collection should be understood as that of other non-Buddhist philosophers.

analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba gang zhe na ; nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bdag rtag to zhe'am bdag chad do zhes lta ba dang mngon par zhen pa dang sems la 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba zhes bya'o //

original: sngon gyi mthar rtog pa rtag par smra ba rnams dang / la la rtag par smra ba rnams dang / phyi ma'i mthar rtog pa 'du shes can du smra ba rnams dang / 'du shes med par smra ba rnams dang / 'du shes yod pa'ang ma @108b yin 'du shes med pa'ang ma yin par smra ba rnams kyi yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mthar rtog pa rtag par smra ba rnams dang / la la rtag par smra ba rnams dang / phyi ma'i mthar rtog pa 'du shes can du smra ba rnams dang / 'du shes med par smra ba rnams dang / 'du shes yod pa'ang ma @108b yin 'du shes med pa'ang ma yin par smra ba rnams kyi yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The view of the beginning should be regarded as the view of those who propound eternalism, the view of those who propound the world is permanent, and the view of the end should be regarded as the view of those who propound the existence of consciousness, the view of those who propound the non-existence of consciousness, and the view of those who propound neither the existence nor non-existence of consciousness.

original: chad par lta bas bsdus pa'i mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni dngos po bdun gyis chad par lta ba'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams kyi yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chad par lta bas bsdus pa'i mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni dngos po bdun gyis chad par lta ba'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams kyi yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The view of annihilationism should be regarded as the view of those ascetics and brahmins who are nihilists in regard to the seven things.

original: de dag gi mthar 'dzin par lta ba de ni kun brtags pa kho na yin gyi lhan cig skyes pa ni mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de dag gi mthar 'dzin par lta ba de ni kun brtags pa kho na yin gyi lhan cig skyes pa ni mi dmigs te /
translated: That view of holding to an extreme is only imagined, not innate.

original: de ni tshe rabs gzhan du rjes su 'brel par 'byung ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshe rabs gzhan du rjes su 'brel par 'byung ba kho na yin no //
translated: It is only subsequently imagined in other lives.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa de dag ni /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa de dag ni /
translated: Those views of holding to an extreme, etc.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: are as follows.

original: sa'i dngos gzhir kun brtags pa dang kun brtags pa ma yin pa'i dbye bas bstan pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir kun brtags pa dang kun brtags pa ma yin pa'i dbye bas bstan pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as it is taught in the Abhidharma in terms of the distinction between the imagined and the non-imagined.

original: de la log par lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la log par lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is wrong view?

original: phyin ci log tu lta ba thams cad de shes bya'i dngos po la phyin ci log tu zhugs pa ni log par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu lta ba thams cad de shes bya'i dngos po la phyin ci log tu zhugs pa ni log par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is all views that are erroneous. It is called wrong view because it is a perversion with regard to the nature of what is to be known.

original: de 'ang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de 'ang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as twofold:

original: sgro 'dogs par byed pa dang skur pa 'debs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs par byed pa dang skur pa 'debs par byed pa'o //
translated: that which exaggerates and that which deprecates.

original: de la lta ba bzhi po 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa thams cad ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i log par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la lta ba bzhi po 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa thams cad ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i log par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, all four views, i.e., the view of individuality, the extreme view, the view holding to an extreme, and the esteeming of views, are called wrong views that exaggerate.

original: skur pa 'debs par byed pa'i log par lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs par byed pa'i log par lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is wrong view that deprecates?

original: rgyu'am bya ba'am 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'am yod pa'i dngos po 'jig par byed pa'i lta ba dang mngon par zhen pa dang sems la 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba zhes bya'o //🔽de la sbyin pa med do //🔽mchod sbyin med do //
analyzed: rgyu'am bya ba'am 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'am yod pa'i dngos po 'jig par byed pa'i lta ba dang mngon par zhen pa dang sems la 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba zhes bya'o // de la sbyin pa med do // mchod sbyin med do //
translated: The view, adherence, and placement of the mind that denies cause, effect, or action, or that denies existent things, is called the wrong view of denial.

original: sbyin sreg med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa yin no //🔽legs par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin sreg med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa yin no // legs par spyad pa med do //
translated: Among them, There is no giving, There is no sacrifice, There is no burnt offering is the denial of cause.

original: nyes par spyad pa med do zhes bya ba ni bya ba la skur pa 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa med do zhes bya ba ni bya ba la skur pa 'debs pa yin no //

original: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa yin no //🔽pha med do //🔽ma med do //

original: lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis po de dag re re la mchog tu gtso bo dang khyad par du 'phags pa dang dam par nan gyis mchog tu 'dzin cing mngon par zhen par byed la 'di kho na bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa yin te lta
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis po de dag re re la mchog tu gtso bo dang khyad par du 'phags pa dang dam par nan gyis mchog tu 'dzin cing mngon par zhen par byed la 'di kho na bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa yin te lta
translated: Each of these sixty-two views is held to be the highest, the most excellent, the most superior, and one adheres to them and is attached to them, thinking, “This alone is the truth, any other is false.”

original: ba 'dis ni dag par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: ba 'dis ni dag par 'gyur ro ;
translated: One makes a living by this view.

original: /'dis ni grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'dis ni grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One is liberated by this view.🔽One goes beyond suffering by this view.”

original: 'dis ni nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “holding a view as paramount.”

original: de la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is “holding ethics and modes of conduct as paramount?”

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i 'khor dang de dang mthun pa'i chos tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs yang dag par blangs nas tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs yang dag par blangs pa de nyid la mchog dang dam pa'i bar du nan gyis mchog tu 'dzin cing mngon par zhen
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i 'khor dang de dang mthun pa'i chos tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs yang dag par blangs nas tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs yang dag par blangs pa de nyid la mchog dang dam pa'i bar du nan gyis mchog tu 'dzin cing mngon par zhen
translated: 1. The view of holding to an extreme and that which is in conformity with it;🔽2. The retinue of the view of holding to an extreme and the doctrine of that which is in conformity with it;🔽3. The grasping of morality and certain types of conduct as paramount and the grasping of that which is in conformity with it;🔽4. The grasping of morality and certain types of conduct as paramount and the grasping of that which is in conformity with it.

original: par byed la 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa yin te /
analyzed: par byed la 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa yin te /
translated: The grasping of morality and certain types of conduct as paramount is the tenacious adherence to and the mental fixation upon the supremacy of the very morality and certain types of conduct that have been adopted, and the adherence to the view that this is the truth and that all else is false.🔽It is the pronouncement: Through this, one becomes pure. Through this, one becomes liberated.

original: lta ba 'dis ni dag par 'gyur ro 'dis ni grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba 'dis ni dag par 'gyur ro 'dis ni grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through this, one becomes released.

original: 'dis ni nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the grasping of morality and certain types of conduct as paramount.

original: de la 'dod chags gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags gang zhe na /
translated: What is desire?

original: sems kyi lhag pa par chags pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi lhag pa par chags pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the excessive attachment of the mind.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is of four types:

original: lta ba rnams dang 'dod pa rnams dang gzugs rnams dang / gzugs med pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: lta ba rnams dang 'dod pa rnams dang gzugs rnams dang / gzugs med pa rnams la'o //
translated: in regard to views, desires, forms, and the formless.

original: khong khro ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: khong khro ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is hostility?

original: sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a mental malevolence.

original: de'ang rnam pa bzhir ba lta @109b bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'ang rnam pa bzhir ba lta @109b bar bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being of four types:

original: sems can gzhan rnams las gzhan du lta ba rnams dang / gnod pa byed pa rnams dang / sdug pa la gnod pa byed pa rnams dang / mi sdug pa la phan 'dogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan rnams las gzhan du lta ba rnams dang / gnod pa byed pa rnams dang / sdug pa la gnod pa byed pa rnams dang / mi sdug pa la phan 'dogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: in regard to sentient beings who are different, who are harmful, who are helpful, and who are neither helpful nor harmful.

original: nga rgyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: nga rgyal gang zhe na /
translated: What is pride?

original: gang sems kyi khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang sems kyi khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is an elevation of the mind.

original: de'ang rnam pa bzhir ba lta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'ang rnam pa bzhir ba lta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being of four types:

original: lta ba rnams dang / sems can la brten pa dang / 'dod pa la longs spyod pa la brten pa dang / yang srid pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba rnams dang / sems can la brten pa dang / 'dod pa la longs spyod pa la brten pa dang / yang srid pa la brten pa'o //
translated: in regard to views, in regard to a particular sentient being, in regard to enjoyments, and in regard to existence.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam par 'khrul pa'i nga rgyal dang / rnam par 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam par 'khrul pa'i nga rgyal dang / rnam par 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Moreover, it is twofold: pride that is a perversion and pride that is not a perversion.

original: de la sems can la brten pa'i nga rgyal ni nga rgyal rnam pa gsum ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de la sems can la brten pa'i nga rgyal ni nga rgyal rnam pa gsum ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Pride based on sentient beings is the three types of pride as above.

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa la brten pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa la brten pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Pride based on enjoyment is as follows:

original: longs spyod chen po dang rtsa 'dzing chen po dang 'khor mang po dang ldan par gyur pa de la brten nas sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po dang rtsa 'dzing chen po dang 'khor mang po dang ldan par gyur pa de la brten nas sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Based on having great wealth, great power, and a large retinue, there is the inflation of the mind.

original: yang srid pa la brten pa ni 'di lta ste 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'du shes yod pa'ang ma yin 'du shes med pa'ang ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du g-yo ba dang rlom pa dang spros pa dang mngon par 'du byas pa'i sred pa'i rnam pa dag dang
analyzed: yang srid pa la brten pa ni 'di lta ste 'byung bar 'gyur ro // 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'du shes yod pa'ang ma yin 'du shes med pa'ang ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du g-yo ba dang rlom pa dang spros pa dang mngon par 'du byas pa'i sred pa'i rnam pa dag dang
translated: Pride based on existence is as follows:

original: ldan par gyur pa'i sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: ldan par gyur pa'i sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: Based on the movement, conceit, proliferation, and the aspects of craving that are conditioned by the thought “I will exist in the future,” “I will not exist in the future,” and so on, up to “I will be neither percipient nor nonpercipient in the future,” there is the inflation of the mind.

original: / de la rnam par 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i nga rgyal ni chung babs bdag che'o snyam pa dang mtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam du rlom pa'o //
analyzed: / de la rnam par 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i nga rgyal ni chung babs bdag che'o snyam pa dang mtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam du rlom pa'o //
translated: The pride that is not a mistake is like the thought, “I am great,” or the thought, “I am equal.”

original: rnam par 'khrul pa'i nga rgyal ni de las gzhan pa'i nga rgyal lnga po dag la'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'khrul pa'i nga rgyal ni de las gzhan pa'i nga rgyal lnga po dag la'o //
translated: The pride that is a mistake is the other five kinds of pride.

original: gzhan yang longs spyod ngan pa dag gis bdag ni bde ba yin no snyam du rlom par byed pa de'ang rnam par 'khrul pa'i nga rgyal yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang longs spyod ngan pa dag gis bdag ni bde ba yin no snyam du rlom par byed pa de'ang rnam par 'khrul pa'i nga rgyal yin la /
translated: Moreover, the thought, “I am happy,” when one has few possessions, is also pride that is a mistake.

original: longs spyod rgya chen po dag gis bdag ni bde ba yin no snyam du rlom pa de ni rnam par 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i nga rgyal yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rgya chen po dag gis bdag ni bde ba yin no snyam du rlom pa de ni rnam par 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i nga rgyal yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: But the thought, “I am happy,” when one has great possessions, is pride that is not a mistake.

original: log par sgrub pa yang srid pa'i phyir rlom pa gang yin pa de'ang rnam par 'khrul pa'i nga rgyal yin la /
analyzed: log par sgrub pa yang srid pa'i phyir rlom pa gang yin pa de'ang rnam par 'khrul pa'i nga rgyal yin la /
translated: And the thought, “I am happy,” when one is practicing wrongly, is also pride that is a mistake.

original: yang dag pa'i sgrub pas yang srid pa'i phyir rlom par byed pa de ni rnam par 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i nga rgyal yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sgrub pas yang srid pa'i phyir rlom par byed pa de ni rnam par 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i nga rgyal yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The pride that is not a mistake is the pride of one who is not conceited about future existence through right practice.

original: de la ma rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance?

original: shes bya'i de kho na rtogs par bya ba la sems la 'gebs par byed pa nyid dang sgrib par @110a * //🔽byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes bya'i de kho na rtogs par bya ba la sems la 'gebs par byed pa nyid dang sgrib par @110a * // byed pa nyid do //
translated: It is the covering over of the mind and the obscuring of the knowledge of the truth of the knowable.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /🔽ma rtogs pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang / bag med pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi kun tu rmongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste / ma rtogs pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang / bag med pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi kun tu rmongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: It should be understood as being of four kinds:🔽ignorance of non-apprehension, ignorance of negligence, ignorance of defilement, and ignorance of the unafflicted.

original: shes bya'i don ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang bye brag ma phyed pa dang / rnam par ma shes pa dag mi shes pa ni ma rtogs pa'i kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i don ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang bye brag ma phyed pa dang / rnam par ma shes pa dag mi shes pa ni ma rtogs pa'i kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of the meaning of the knowable, the non-seeing, the non-hearing, the non-discrimination, and the non-understanding of what is not known is called ignorance of non-apprehension.

original: mthong ba dang thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang rnam par shes pa dag la rnam par g-yeng ba dang brjed ngas pas mi shes pa ni bag med pa'i kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pa dang bye brag phyed pa dang rnam par shes pa dag la rnam par g-yeng ba dang brjed ngas pas mi shes pa ni bag med pa'i kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The confusion of heedlessness is the ignorance of one who is distracted and forgetful with regard to what he has seen, heard, distinguished, and known.

original: sems phyin ci log tu gyur pas mi shes pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems phyin ci log tu gyur pas mi shes pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The confusion of defilement is the ignorance of one whose mind is perverted.

original: sems phyin ci log tu ma gyur pas mi shes pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems phyin ci log tu ma gyur pas mi shes pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The confusion of non-defilement is the ignorance of one whose mind is not perverted.

original: ma rig pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus na mdor rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus na mdor rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: All these ignorances are summarized as two: that associated with defilement and that not so associated.

original: rmongs par ma gyur pa la ni nyon mongs pa 'ga' 'ang mi 'byung bas de'i phyir gang la 'dod chags la sogs pa de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa de la ni ma rig pa'ang yod pas de ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: rmongs par ma gyur pa la ni nyon mongs pa 'ga' 'ang mi 'byung bas de'i phyir gang la 'dod chags la sogs pa de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa de la ni ma rig pa'ang yod pas de ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: Since no defilements arise for one who is not deluded, therefore, since desire, etc. exist for one who has other defilements, ignorance also exists for him. Thus it is associated with defilements.

original: skyes bu gang zag shes rab rtul ba de las gzhan pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas ma dkris pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag shes rab rtul ba de las gzhan pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas ma dkris pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du
translated: For a person who is not confused, but is other than that, who is not entangled by the defilements of desire, etc., there is the non-appearance of the truth of suffering, etc., just as it is, due to incorrect mental activity.

original: kun tu mi snang ba nyid dang ; sems la 'gebs par byed pa nyid dang / sgrib par byed pa nyid dang / kun nas dkris pa nyid dang / mun par gyur pa nyid gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun tu mi snang ba nyid dang ; sems la 'gebs par byed pa nyid dang / sgrib par byed pa nyid dang / kun nas dkris pa nyid dang / mun par gyur pa nyid gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the non-appearance of the truth of suffering, etc., just as it is, due to incorrect mental activity, and the concealment of the mind, the obscuration, the entanglement, the darkness of the mind, that is called unmixed ignorance.

original: de la the tshom gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la the tshom gang zhe na /
translated: What is doubt?

original: sems kyi yid gnyis dang gnyis kyi dngos po dang ma nges pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi yid gnyis dang gnyis kyi dngos po dang ma nges pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Doubt is indecision about the mind, about things, or about both.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Its classification is as follows: in brief, it is established as fivefold,

original: 'jig rten pha rol dang bya ba dang de'i 'bras bu dang bden pa rnams dang dkon mchog rnams la sems kyi yid gnyis za bas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol dang bya ba dang de'i 'bras bu dang bden pa rnams dang dkon mchog rnams la sems kyi yid gnyis za bas so //
translated: because of doubt about the mind, about things, about both, about the next world, about karma, and about the results of karma.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa bcu po ji skad bstan pa de dag ni dngos po la dmigs pa las kyang 'byung @110b la nyon mongs pa dmigs pa las kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa bcu po ji skad bstan pa de dag ni dngos po la dmigs pa las kyang 'byung @110b la nyon mongs pa dmigs pa las kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, these ten defilements, as they have been explained, arise from the objective ālambana and from the mental upādāna.🔽All ten defilements arise from the objective ālambana and from the mental upādāna.

original: nyon mongs pa bcu po thams cad las rang gi sa pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa gcig la gcig dmigs pa dang / rang gi sa pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bcu po thams cad las rang gi sa pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa gcig la gcig dmigs pa dang / rang gi sa pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: All the defilements of a certain stage arise from the mental upādāna of the defilements of that stage, and from the mental upādāna of all the impure things of that stage.

original: sa 'og ma pa rnams ni sa gong ma pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa rnams ni sa gong ma pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The defilements of a lower stage arise from the mental upādāna of the things of a higher stage.

original: sa gong ma pa rnams ni sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sa gong ma pa rnams ni sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Those of higher levels do not focus on the things of lower levels.

original: ji ltar de dag gcig la gcig dmigs pa dang / sa 'og ma pa rnams sa gong ma pa la dmigs pa'i skabs 'di rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /🔽// / bam po bcu gnyis pa /🔽de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa de ni lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag gcig la gcig dmigs pa dang / sa 'og ma pa rnams sa gong ma pa la dmigs pa'i skabs 'di rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo / // / bam po bcu gnyis pa / de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa de ni lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: The remaining topics of ascertainment are not evident in this section on how they focus on each other and on the levels.

original: yang dang yang kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir dang / bdag dang gzhan la shin tu gnod pa'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dang yang kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir dang / bdag dang gzhan la shin tu gnod pa'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The innate afflicted view of the self that exists in the desire realm is neutral because it does not frequently occur and it is not a basis for greatly harming oneself or others.

original: rtog pas mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: rtog pas mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni mi dge ba yin no //
translated: The afflicted view of the self that is derived from rational thought is nonvirtuous.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i ni zhi gnas kyis nye bar bstan pa'i phyir dang / dkar po'i chos mang pos yongs su zin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i ni zhi gnas kyis nye bar bstan pa'i phyir dang / dkar po'i chos mang pos yongs su zin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The neutral ones of the lower stages are so called because they are indicated by serenity and because they are embraced by many bright factors.

original: sgrib pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis nyon mongs pa can dang skyon chags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis nyon mongs pa can dang skyon chags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Obscuration is so called because it is naturally defiled and defective.

original: lhag ma rnams ni 'di'i tshul bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni 'di'i tshul bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining ones should be understood in accordance with this method.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyes par spyod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir mi dge ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyes par spyod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir mi dge ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The passions that occur in the realm of desire should be regarded as unwholesome because they are the basis for the foundation of evil conduct.

original: de dag kyang rgyu gsum gyis na mi dge ba'ang yin la ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'ang yin gyi gzhan du na ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: de dag kyang rgyu gsum gyis na mi dge ba'ang yin la ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'ang yin gyi gzhan du na ni nges pa med do //
translated: They are unwholesome and lead to evil destinies for three reasons.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: gus par byed pa dang rtag tu byed pas shas cher kun tu sten par byed cing yon tan gyi blos de dag la skyon du lta ba dang nyes dmigs su lta ba skyed par mi byed pa 'di ni rgyu dang po yin no //
analyzed: gus par byed pa dang rtag tu byed pas shas cher kun tu sten par byed cing yon tan gyi blos de dag la skyon du lta ba dang nyes dmigs su lta ba skyed par mi byed pa 'di ni rgyu dang po yin no //
translated: The first cause is that they are cultivated with respect and constantly, with the idea that they are good qualities, and without seeing their faults or their disadvantages.

original: yang nyon mongs pa de dag la brten cing gnas nas lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod par byas shing bsags pa 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa de dag la brten cing gnas nas lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod par byas shing bsags pa 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second cause is that, on the basis of these defilements, one commits and accumulates evil actions of body, speech and mind.

original: yang des gzhan dag dge ba'i phyogs las 'dun pa bzlog cing mi dge ba'i phyogs yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa 'di ni rgyu gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: yang des gzhan dag dge ba'i phyogs las 'dun pa bzlog cing mi dge ba'i phyogs yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa 'di ni rgyu gsum pa yin te /
translated: The third cause is that one causes others to turn away from the wholesome and to take up the unwholesome.

original: de'i ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las @111a * //
analyzed: de'i ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las @111a * //
translated: This is the cause of the ripening of the action in the unfortunate planes of existence,

original: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba sngon byas pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba sngon byas pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: except for the action whose result is to be experienced in the next birth.

original: nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag las nyon mongs pa bdun ni yid kyi sa pa dag yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag las nyon mongs pa bdun ni yid kyi sa pa dag yin no //
translated: Among these ten defilements, seven are of the stage of mental consciousness.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang ma rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sa pa yang yin no ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang ma rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i sa pa yang yin no ;
translated: Attachment, anger, and ignorance are associated with the five collections of consciousness.

original: /'dod pa'i khams la lta ba bzhi dang nga rgyal ni yid bde ba dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: /'dod pa'i khams la lta ba bzhi dang nga rgyal ni yid bde ba dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: The four views and pride in the desire realm are associated with mental satisfaction and equanimity.

original: 'dod chags ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms rnams dang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms rnams dang ngo //
translated: Attachment is associated with pleasure, mental satisfaction, and equanimity.

original: khong khro ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang ngo //
analyzed: khong khro ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang ngo //
translated: Anger is associated with pain and mental dissatisfaction.

original: log par lta ba ni yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba nyid dang ngo //
analyzed: log par lta ba ni yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba nyid dang ngo //
translated: Wrong view is associated with mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction.

original: the tshom ni yid mi bde ba kho na dang ngo //
analyzed: the tshom ni yid mi bde ba kho na dang ngo //
translated: Doubt is associated with mental dissatisfaction alone.

original: ma rig pa ni dbang po lnga po thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni dbang po lnga po thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Ignorance is associated with all five faculties.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshul 'di ni che long du bstan pa yin te zhib tu ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshul 'di ni che long du bstan pa yin te zhib tu ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: This mode of association is taught in a general way. It will be explained in detail below.

original: gong ma na ni gang na dbang po gang srid pa de dang de'i sa ba'i nyon mongs pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma na ni gang na dbang po gang srid pa de dang de'i sa ba'i nyon mongs pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the higher realms, the ten defilements are associated with the defilements of the stage to which they belong, wherever the faculties are possible.

original: nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag las mthong bas spang bar bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni gzhi med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag las mthong bas spang bar bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni gzhi med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Among these ten defilements, those which are to be abandoned by insight are without a basis.

original: de dag gis dmigs pa'i gzhi de bzhin du yongs su grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis dmigs pa'i gzhi de bzhin du yongs su grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are so called because the basis which they have for their object is not real in the same way as they are.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gzhi dang bcas pa dang gzhi med pa dag yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gzhi dang bcas pa dang gzhi med pa dag yin te /
translated: The others, i.e. those to be abandoned by cultivation, have a basis and are without a basis.

original: de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dod chags dang nga rgyal ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzhi'i phyogs yid du 'ong ba gcig la dmigs nas skye'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro // 'dod chags dang nga rgyal ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzhi'i phyogs yid du 'ong ba gcig la dmigs nas skye'o //
translated: They are so called because they are the opposite of the former.🔽Desire and pride arise by taking as their object a single aspect of a thing which is favorable.

original: khong khro ba ni phyogs yid du mi 'ong ba gcig la dmigs nas skye ste /
analyzed: khong khro ba ni phyogs yid du mi 'ong ba gcig la dmigs nas skye ste /
translated: Anger arises by taking as its object a single aspect of a thing which is unfavorable.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa gsum po de dag ni phyogs gcig las skye ba dang phyogs gcig 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa gsum po de dag ni phyogs gcig las skye ba dang phyogs gcig 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, these three afflictions are called “arising from one side” and “grasping one side.”

original: lhag ma rnams ni nang dang phyi rol dang bcas pa'i gzhi zag pa dang bcas pa sdug pa'am mi sdug pa'am gnyi ga las bzlog pa las dmigs te skye bas /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni nang dang phyi rol dang bcas pa'i gzhi zag pa dang bcas pa sdug pa'am mi sdug pa'am gnyi ga las bzlog pa las dmigs te skye bas /
translated: The remaining ones arise from the internal, external, and both internal and external bases, in relation to the defiled, the beautiful, the ugly, and the opposite of both.

original: de'i phyir thams cad du 'gro ba dang gzhi mtha' dag 'dzin pa rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad du 'gro ba dang gzhi mtha' dag 'dzin pa rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, they are called “pervading” and “grasping the entire basis.”

original: de ltar na de dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams yin no //
translated: Thus, these are the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig rgyu ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang ma thun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig rgyu ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang ma thun pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The secondary afflictions are concordant with the afflictions, occur together with the afflictions, and are the minor afflictions that are not included in the category of the afflictions.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams @111b gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams @111b gang zhe na /
translated: What are the secondary afflictions?

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of the secondary afflictions is established in brief in four ways:

original: mi dge ba'i sems thams cad las skye ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems thams cad las skye ba dang mi dge ba'i sems so so las skye ba dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems las skye ba thams cad du ma yin zhing dus thams cad du ma yin pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems thams cad las skye ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems thams cad las skye ba dang mi dge ba'i sems so so las skye ba dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems las skye ba thams cad du ma yin zhing dus thams cad du ma yin pa rnams kyis so //
translated: They arise from all nonvirtuous minds, from all afflicted minds, from each nonvirtuous mind, and not from all virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate minds, nor at all times.

original: de la ngo tsha ba med pa dang khrel med pa ni mi dge ba'i sems thams cad las skye ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ngo tsha ba med pa dang khrel med pa ni mi dge ba'i sems thams cad las skye ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, shamelessness and lack of conscience are called the secondary afflictions that arise from all nonvirtuous minds.

original: bag med pa dang rgod pa dang rmugs pa dang ma dad pa dang ; le lo dang log par 'dun pa dang log par mos pa dang log par dran pa dang rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems thams cad las skye ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bag med pa dang rgod pa dang rmugs pa dang ma dad pa dang ; le lo dang log par 'dun pa dang log par mos pa dang log par dran pa dang rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems thams cad las skye ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The ten secondary afflictions are shamelessness, immodesty, sleep, regret, anger, malice, hypocrisy, envy, avarice, and deceit.

original: khams gsum pa thams cad na'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa thams cad na'o //
translated: They are found in all three realms.🔽The ten secondary afflictions are anger, enmity, dissimulation, hostility, envy, avarice, deceit, vanity, harmfulness, and concealment.

original: khro ba dang 'khon du 'dzin pa dang 'chab pa dang 'tshig pa dang phrag dog dang ser sna dang / sgyu dang g-yo dang rgyags pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag ni mi dge ba'i sems so so las skye ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: khro ba dang 'khon du 'dzin pa dang 'chab pa dang 'tshig pa dang phrag dog dang ser sna dang / sgyu dang g-yo dang rgyags pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag ni mi dge ba'i sems so so las skye ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: They should be understood as arising in all nonvirtuous minds.

original: gang du gcig 'byung ba der gnyis pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang du gcig 'byung ba der gnyis pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Where one occurs, the other does not.

original: de dag las sgyu dang g-yo dang rgyags pa ma gtogs pa rnams ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag las sgyu dang g-yo dang rgyags pa ma gtogs pa rnams ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Except for deceit, guile, and arrogance, the others are associated with desire.

original: sgyu dang g-yo ni bsam gtan dang po man chad na yod do //
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo ni bsam gtan dang po man chad na yod do //
translated: Guile and deceit exist in the first absorption and below.

original: rgyags pa ni khams gsum pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyags pa ni khams gsum pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Arrogance should be understood as existing in the three realms.

original: de dag kyang gong ma pa'i sa pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //🔽de la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang 'gyod pa dang gnyid dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po de dag ni dge ba'i sems dang mi dge ba'i sems dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems la yang 'byung ste thams cad du dang dus thams cad du ni
analyzed: de dag kyang gong ma pa'i sa pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no // de la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang 'gyod pa dang gnyid dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po de dag ni dge ba'i sems dang mi dge ba'i sems dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems la yang 'byung ste thams cad du dang dus thams cad du ni
translated: The higher realms are neutral.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: Among them, investigation, analysis, regret, sleep, and the four secondary afflictions occur in virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral minds, but not always and not in all states.

original: 'di ltar yang dang yang du dang yun ring du rjes su rtog pa dang / rjes su dpyod par byed pa'i lus ngal ba dang / brjed pa dang sems nyams par 'gyur bas de'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dang yang du dang yun ring du rjes su rtog pa dang / rjes su dpyod par byed pa'i lus ngal ba dang / brjed pa dang sems nyams par 'gyur bas de'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, because the body becomes tired, forgetful, and the mind becomes weak, from repeatedly and for a long time reflecting and investigating, therefore, reflection and investigation are also called secondary defilements.

original: de gnyis kyang bsam gtan dang po man chad na yod do //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang bsam gtan dang po man chad na yod do //
translated: Also, those two exist in the first dhyāna and below.

original: 'gyod pa dang gnyid ni 'dod pa na spyod @112a * //🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang gnyid ni 'dod pa na spyod @112a * // pa yin no //
translated: Regret and sleep are experienced in the desire realm.

original: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among those, the secondary defilements of the stage of equipoise are as follows:

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang sgyu dang / g-yo dang / rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang rgyags pa dang bag med pa dang le lo rnams te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang sgyu dang / g-yo dang / rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang rgyags pa dang bag med pa dang le lo rnams te /
translated: reflection, investigation, deceit, guile, lethargy, excitation, arrogance, carelessness, and laziness.

original: de la dang po bzhi ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po bzhi ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dag yin no //
translated: Among those, the first four are on the level of the first dhyāna.

original: lhag ma rnams ni sa thams cad dang dus thams cad pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni sa thams cad dang dus thams cad pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as being on all levels and in all times.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhi phran tshegs las nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa'i bar du rgyas par bstan pa gang dag yin pa rnams dang / gzhi bsdu ba las rnam par dbye ba byas pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis ci rigs par bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhi phran tshegs las nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa'i bar du rgyas par bstan pa gang dag yin pa rnams dang / gzhi bsdu ba las rnam par dbye ba byas pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis ci rigs par bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One has extensively taught in the Kṣudraka Collection that the secondary afflictions are sorrow, lamentation, suffering, mental unhappiness, and disturbance, and he has analyzed them in the Kṣudraka Compendium. All of them should be understood as included in these four types of secondary afflictions, as appropriate.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag kyang 'dod pa'i khams na ni mdor bsdu na gnas bcu gnyis la brten nas 'jug par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag kyang 'dod pa'i khams na ni mdor bsdu na gnas bcu gnyis la brten nas 'jug par rig par bya ste /
translated: Those secondary afflictions, in brief, operate in the desire realm based on twelve abodes.

original: gnas bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twelve abodes?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: nyes par spyod pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / 'thab mo dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / tshul khrims nyams pa dang / skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i chos yang dag par blangs te 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / 'thab mo dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / tshul khrims nyams pa dang / skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i chos yang dag par blangs te 'dug pa dang /
translated: It is to be attached to negative actions, to quarrel, to find fault, to argue, to fight, to have corrupt discipline, to take up the ways of nonvirtuous people,

original: log par 'tsho ba dang / 'dod pa la log par zhen pa dang / ji skad bstan pa'i chos kyi don la sems shing nges par rtog pa dang / sems ting nge 'dzin du bya ba'i phyir bsam pa'i don la nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa dang /
analyzed: log par 'tsho ba dang / 'dod pa la log par zhen pa dang / ji skad bstan pa'i chos kyi don la sems shing nges par rtog pa dang / sems ting nge 'dzin du bya ba'i phyir bsam pa'i don la nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa dang /
translated: to have wrong livelihood, to be attached to objects of desire, to contemplate and ascertain the meaning of the teachings as they are taught, to have an inner mental tranquility that is in accord with the meaning of the contemplations in order to bring the mind to meditative concentration,

original: gcig la gcig zang zing gi longs spyod stobs pa dang / gcig la gcig chos kyi longs spyod stobs pa dang / ma 'dres par gnas shing bas mtha'i gnas mal du gnas pa dang / rab tu dbye ba na gnas pas sdug bsngal nye bar gyur pa ste ;
analyzed: gcig la gcig zang zing gi longs spyod stobs pa dang / gcig la gcig chos kyi longs spyod stobs pa dang / ma 'dres par gnas shing bas mtha'i gnas mal du gnas pa dang / rab tu dbye ba na gnas pas sdug bsngal nye bar gyur pa ste ;
translated: to give each other material enjoyments, to give each other the enjoyments of the Dharma, to live in solitude and in the wilderness, and to live in a place that is secluded and free from suffering.

original: gnas bcu gnyis po de dag la brten nas chags pa la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa rnams kyi 'jug pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas bcu gnyis po de dag la brten nas chags pa la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa rnams kyi 'jug pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The engagement of the proximate factors of instability, such as attachment, etc., as they have been presented, should be understood as being based upon these twelve bases, up to the end of the instability of error.

original: de la chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug ni gnas dang po la'o//
analyzed: de la chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug ni gnas dang po la'o//
translated: Among them, attachment, aversion, and delusion are based upon the first base.

original: @112b khro ba la sogs pa g-yo ba mthar thug pa'i bar dag ni gnas gnyis pa la'o //
analyzed: @112b khro ba la sogs pa g-yo ba mthar thug pa'i bar dag ni gnas gnyis pa la'o //
translated: Agitation, etc., up to the end of instability are based upon the second base.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni gnas gsum pa la'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni gnas gsum pa la'o //
translated: Shamelessness and lack of abashment are based upon the third base.

original: nga rgyal la sogs pa nyes rtsom gyi mthar thug pa'i bar dag ni gnas bzhi pa la'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal la sogs pa nyes rtsom gyi mthar thug pa'i bar dag ni gnas bzhi pa la'o //
translated: Arrogance, etc., up to the end of faulty practice are based upon the fourth base.

original: tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa sdig pa'i grogs po'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag ni gnas lnga pa la'o //
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa sdig pa'i grogs po'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag ni gnas lnga pa la'o //
translated: Pretense, etc., up to the end of evil companions are based upon the fifth base.

original: mi bzod pa dang zhen pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa la chags pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag ni gnas drug pa la'o //
analyzed: mi bzod pa dang zhen pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa la chags pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag ni gnas drug pa la'o //
translated: Impatience, attachment, etc., up to the end of attachment to what is disagreeable are based upon the sixth base.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / 'byung bar lta ba dang 'jig par lta ba ni gnas bdun pa la'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / 'byung bar lta ba dang 'jig par lta ba ni gnas bdun pa la'o //
translated: The view of the perishable as a self, the view of the perishable as a reality, and the view of the perishable as a non-reality are in the seventh stage.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa yid la mi byed pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag ni gnas brgyad pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa yid la mi byed pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag ni gnas brgyad pa la'o //
translated: Desire for sensual pleasures, etc., up to the absence of attention are in the eighth stage.

original: ru gdug dang 'phya smod ni gnas dgu pa la'o //
analyzed: ru gdug dang 'phya smod ni gnas dgu pa la'o //
translated: Malice and slander are in the ninth stage.

original: mi mnams pa dang mi mnyen pa dang ris mthun pa'i rjes su mi 'jug pa ni gnas bcu pa la'o //
analyzed: mi mnams pa dang mi mnyen pa dang ris mthun pa'i rjes su mi 'jug pa ni gnas bcu pa la'o //
translated: Lack of respect, lack of modesty, and lack of conformity with the group are in the tenth stage.

original: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa khyim gyi 'byor pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag ni gnas bcu gcig pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa khyim gyi 'byor pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag ni gnas bcu gcig pa la'o //
translated: Sensual thoughts, etc., up to thoughts associated with the enjoyments of householders are in the eleventh stage.

original: mya ngan la sogs pa ni gnas bcu gnyis pa la brten te 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan la sogs pa ni gnas bcu gnyis pa la brten te 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: Sorrow, etc., are in the twelfth stage.

original: lta ba lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par mi byed do //
analyzed: lta ba lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par mi byed do //
translated: The five views are not mutually associated because they are by nature wisdom.

original: ngo bo nyid dang ngo bo nyid mtshungs par ldan par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang ngo bo nyid mtshungs par ldan par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for something to be concomitant with itself.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang the tshom rnams ni phan tshun mi mthun pa'i phyir phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang the tshom rnams ni phan tshun mi mthun pa'i phyir phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par mi byed do //
translated: Attachment, anger, pride, and doubt are not mutually concomitant, because they are mutually incompatible.

original: chags par gyur pa'i sems ni 'dud par 'gyur la rlom par gyur pa'i sems ni khengs par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: chags par gyur pa'i sems ni 'dud par 'gyur la rlom par gyur pa'i sems ni khengs par 'gyur bas /
translated: A mind that is attached is humble, and a mind that is proud is arrogant.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang nga rgyal yang phan tshun mi mthun pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang nga rgyal yang phan tshun mi mthun pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, attachment and pride should be understood as mutually incompatible.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yin pa kho nar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yin pa kho nar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The secondary mental afflictions should be seen as only being in the category of the mental afflictions.

original: de la re zhig bag med pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig bag med pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Among them, carelessness should be seen as being in the category of all the mental afflictions.

original: 'di ltar chags par gyur na yang bag med par 'gyur la the tshom zos pa'i bar du gyur na'ang bag med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chags par gyur na yang bag med par 'gyur la the tshom zos pa'i bar du gyur na'ang bag med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, even when one is attached, one is careless, and even when one is in doubt, one is careless.

original: chags pa dang / ser sna dang / rgyags pa dang / rgod pa ni @113a * //
analyzed: chags pa dang / ser sna dang / rgyags pa dang / rgod pa ni @113a * //
translated: Attachment, avarice, conceit, and excitement

original: 'dod chags kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa dag yin no //
translated: are favorable to attachment and are the natural outcome of attachment.🔽Anger, resentment, dissimulation, malice, jealousy, and violence

original: khro ba dang kho na du 'dzin pa dang / yongs su gdung ba dang / phrag dog dang / rnam par 'tshe ba ni khong khro ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / khong khro ba'i rgyu mthun pa dag yin no//
analyzed: khro ba dang kho na du 'dzin pa dang / yongs su gdung ba dang / phrag dog dang / rnam par 'tshe ba ni khong khro ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / khong khro ba'i rgyu mthun pa dag yin no//
translated: are favorable to anger and are the natural outcome of anger.🔽Deceit and treachery

original: sgyu dang g-yo ni log par lta ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / log par lta ba'i rgyu mthun pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo ni log par lta ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / log par lta ba'i rgyu mthun pa dag yin no //
translated: are favorable to false views and are the natural outcome of false views.

original: 'chab pa ni g-yo'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu mthun pa kho na yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'chab pa ni g-yo'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu mthun pa kho na yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Concealment should be regarded as favorable to treachery and as its natural outcome.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lhag ma rnams ni gti mug gi phyogs dang mthun pa dang / gti mug gi rgyu mthun pa dag yin no //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lhag ma rnams ni gti mug gi phyogs dang mthun pa dang / gti mug gi rgyu mthun pa dag yin no //
translated: The other subsidiary defilements are in the category of delusion and are the outflow of delusion.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis ni ma gtogs te /
translated: Except for initial inquiry and investigation.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis ni shes rab dang sems pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par blta bar bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis ni shes rab dang sems pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par blta bar bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Initial inquiry and investigation should be regarded as having the nature of discernment and volition.🔽For example,

original: dper na lta ba rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lta ba rnams bzhin no //
translated: like the views.

original: shes rab gang yid la brjod pa la brten pa dmigs pa la mi mthun par rgyu zhing 'jug pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin yang rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab gang yid la brjod pa la brten pa dmigs pa la mi mthun par rgyu zhing 'jug pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin yang rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The discernment that is based on mental expression and that operates in a manner contrary to the object is that nature, but it is called “with initial inquiry and with investigation.🔽”

original: de la dmigs pa gzhan la mi mthun par rgyu zhing yid la brjod pa la brten pa'i shes rab ches rags pa ni rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa gzhan la mi mthun par rgyu zhing yid la brjod pa la brten pa'i shes rab ches rags pa ni rtog pa yin no //
translated: The discernment that is based on mental expression and that operates in a manner contrary to the object is initial inquiry, which is very gross.

original: de nyid la mi mthun pa ma yin par rgyu zhing ches cha phra ba ni dpyod pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid la mi mthun pa ma yin par rgyu zhing ches cha phra ba ni dpyod pa yin te /
translated: That same discernment, when it operates in a manner not contrary to the object and is very subtle, is investigation.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the presentation of the classification of the essential nature of the defilement of passion.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the classification of the defilement of passion?

original: mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa rnams kyis ni rgyu gnyis kyis sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs par byed de /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa rnams kyis ni rgyu gnyis kyis sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs par byed de /
translated: In brief, the passions and secondary passions, as they have been explained, defile sentient beings in two ways:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: kun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal gyis so //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal gyis so //
translated: by means of the envelopment and by means of the latent tendencies.

original: de la nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba mngon du gyur pa ni kun nas dkris ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba mngon du gyur pa ni kun nas dkris ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The actual occurrence of the passions is called the envelopment.

original: de nyid kyi sa bon ma spangs shing yang dag par ma bcom pa ni bag la nyal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi sa bon ma spangs shing yang dag par ma bcom pa ni bag la nyal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The non-abandonment and non-destruction of the seeds of the passions is called the latent tendency.

original: gnas ngan len kyang de yin no //
analyzed: gnas ngan len kyang de yin no //
translated: This is also called the negative reflex.

original: ma sad pa'i phyir ni bag la nyal ba yin la sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi phyir ni kun nas dkris pa yin no //
analyzed: ma sad pa'i phyir ni bag la nyal ba yin la sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi phyir ni kun nas dkris pa yin no //
translated: Latent tendencies are dormant, while entanglements are active.

original: de la 'ching ba ni mtha' dag dang ldan pa'i gang zag 'dod pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba ni khams gsum na @113b spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi bag la nyal dang ldan no //
analyzed: de la 'ching ba ni mtha' dag dang ldan pa'i gang zag 'dod pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba ni khams gsum na @113b spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi bag la nyal dang ldan no //
translated: A person who is bound by all the bonds and is born in the desire realm possesses the latent tendencies of the afflictions that occur in the three realms.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes shing byung ba'i so so'i skye bo ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi bag la nyal zhi gnas kyi gnod pas nyams par byas pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes shing byung ba'i so so'i skye bo ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi bag la nyal zhi gnas kyi gnod pas nyams par byas pa dang ldan la /
translated: An ordinary person who is born in the form realm possesses the latent tendencies of the afflictions of the desire realm that are damaged by the harm of meditative serenity.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi ni ma nyams pa kho na dang ldan no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi ni ma nyams pa kho na dang ldan no //
translated: He possesses the latent tendencies of the afflictions of the form and formless realms that are not damaged.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba'i so so'i skye bo ni 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi bag la nyal zhi gnas kyi gnod pas nyams par byas pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes shing byung ba'i so so'i skye bo ni 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi bag la nyal zhi gnas kyi gnod pas nyams par byas pa dang ldan la /
translated: Ordinary beings born in the formless realm possess the dormant states of the afflictions of the desire and form realms, which are damaged by the harm of meditative serenity.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi ni ma nyams pa kho na dang ldan no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi ni ma nyams pa kho na dang ldan no //
translated: They possess the dormant states of the afflictions of the formless realm that are not damaged.

original: khams las ji lta ba bzhin du sa las kyang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: khams las ji lta ba bzhin du sa las kyang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The same principle should be understood for the levels as it is for the realms.

original: kun nas dkris pa rang gi sa pa ni rang gi sa pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang ldan te /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa rang gi sa pa ni rang gi sa pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang ldan te /
