translated: The entanglements of one’s own level are possessed by those who are not free from attachment to one’s own level.

original: bral ba dang ni mi ldan no //
analyzed: bral ba dang ni mi ldan no //
translated: Those who are free from attachment do not possess them.

original: sa 'og ma la gnas pa ni sa gong ma pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang ldan la sa gong ma la gnas pa ni sa 'og ma pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang nam yang mi ldan par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma la gnas pa ni sa gong ma pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang ldan la sa gong ma la gnas pa ni sa 'og ma pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang nam yang mi ldan par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Those who abide on a lower level possess the entanglements of a higher level. Those who abide on a higher level never possess the entanglements of a lower level.

original: de la 'ching ba mtha' dag dang lan pa'i gang zag gis nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa bskyed nas 'gog par byed cing spong bar ni mi byed pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: de la 'ching ba mtha' dag dang lan pa'i gang zag gis nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa bskyed nas 'gog par byed cing spong bar ni mi byed pa'i tshe na /
translated: When a person who is bound by all the bonds generates the entanglements of the defilements but does not abandon them,

original: nyon mongs pa de 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa'am da ltar byung ba'i dngos po gang dag dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa'am da ltar byung ba'i dngos po gang dag dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: with what past, future or present things is he associated with the defilements?

original: 'das pa dang ni ldan par gyur zin pas ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ni ldan par gyur zin pas ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: He is not associated with past things, because he has already been associated with them.

original: da ltar byung ba dang ni de'i rigs kyi nyon mangs pa'i bag la nyal dang ldan pa yin te gal te nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur na ni kun nas dkris pa dang yang ldan no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ni de'i rigs kyi nyon mangs pa'i bag la nyal dang ldan pa yin te gal te nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur na ni kun nas dkris pa dang yang ldan no //
translated: He is associated with future and present things through the possession of the latent tendencies of the defilements of that class. If the defilement is manifest, he is also associated with the entanglements.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang ni bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa dang yang ldan par 'gyur te ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang ni bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa dang yang ldan par 'gyur te ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He is associated with future and present things through the possession of the latent tendencies and the entanglements, but not through possession.

original: de'i rigs dang ji lta ba bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rigs dang ji lta ba bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang yang de bzhin no //
translated: As with that class, so it is with all other defilements.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'ching ba ma tshang ba dang ldan pa'ang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'ching ba ma tshang ba dang ldan pa'ang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is for one who is bound by all the bonds, so it is for one who is bound by incomplete bonds.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de de ni nyon mongs pa lhag ma rnams dang ldan par brjod par bya'o //🔽gang gi tshe rnal 'byor ba nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon par byed pa'i tshe ji ltar rnam par @114a * //
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de de ni nyon mongs pa lhag ma rnams dang ldan par brjod par bya'o // gang gi tshe rnal 'byor ba nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon par byed pa'i tshe ji ltar rnam par @114a * //
translated: But there is this difference: the latter is said to be bound by the remaining afflictions.

original: gnon par byed ce na /
analyzed: gnon par byed ce na /
translated: When the yogi suppresses the afflictions, how does he suppress them?

original: gang de bsgom zhing nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: gang de bsgom zhing nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon pa'i gnyen po ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The antidote that suppresses the afflictions and the entanglements of the afflictions is of three kinds:

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa dang de'i gnyen po la dmigs pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa dang / sems kyi rgyud la dge ba'i phyogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa dang de'i gnyen po la dmigs pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa dang / sems kyi rgyud la dge ba'i phyogs bsags pa'o //
translated: The nature of the defilements, the recognition of their faults, the mental attention to the characteristics of their antidotes, and the accumulation of the factors of virtue in the mind-stream.

original: yang dag par 'joms pa la ni yang dag pa'i lta ba mngon du btang ba'i lam yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'joms pa la ni yang dag pa'i lta ba mngon du btang ba'i lam yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The correct conquest should be regarded as the path in which the correct view is brought to the fore.

original: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'i tshe na ci kun nas dkris pa las spong bar byed dam 'on te bag la nyal las spong bar byed gang las spangs na spangs pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'i tshe na ci kun nas dkris pa las spong bar byed dam 'on te bag la nyal las spong bar byed gang las spangs na spangs pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: When the yogin abandons the defilements, does he abandon them from the envelopment or from the latent tendency? From which should they be said to be abandoned?

original: ba ga la nyal las spong bar byed de kun nas dkris pa ni dang po nyid nas spangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba ga la nyal las spong bar byed de kun nas dkris pa ni dang po nyid nas spangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He abandons them from the latent tendency, because the envelopment has already been abandoned from the very beginning.

original: bag la nyal las spangs nas spangs pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal las spangs nas spangs pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: When they are abandoned from the latent tendency, they are said to be abandoned.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kun nas dkris pa las spangs la bag la nyal las ma spangs na ni yang dang yang du kun nas dkris pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa las spangs la bag la nyal las ma spangs na ni yang dang yang du kun nas dkris pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one has abandoned the envelopment but not the latent tendency, then the envelopment will arise again and again.

original: bag la nyal las spangs na ni bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa gnyi ga las gtan 'byung bar mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag la nyal las spangs na ni bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa gnyi ga las gtan 'byung bar mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if one has abandoned the latent tendency, then the envelopment and the latent tendency will not arise again.

original: ci 'das pa spong par byed dam 'on te ma 'ongs pa'am da ltar byung ba spong bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci 'das pa spong par byed dam 'on te ma 'ongs pa'am da ltar byung ba spong bar byed ce na /
translated: Does one abandon the past, or the future, or the present?

original: 'das pa'ang mi spong ma 'ongs pa'ang mi spong da ltar byung ba'ang mi spong mod kyi /
analyzed: 'das pa'ang mi spong ma 'ongs pa'ang mi spong da ltar byung ba'ang mi spong mod kyi /
translated: One does not abandon the past, nor the future, nor the present.

original: 'on kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba spong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba spong bar byed do //
translated: Nevertheless, one abandons the past, the future, and the present.

original: de la re zhig bag chags dang bcas pa 'das pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi ngang nyid kyis 'gags pa'i phyir spangs zin pa yin pas de la ni ci'ang spang du med do //
analyzed: de la re zhig bag chags dang bcas pa 'das pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi ngang nyid kyis 'gags pa'i phyir spangs zin pa yin pas de la ni ci'ang spang du med do //
translated: First, that which is past together with its traces is already abandoned, because it has ceased by its intrinsic nature. Therefore, there is nothing to be abandoned in it.

original: ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ni ma byung ba dang lus med pa yin pas /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ni ma byung ba dang lus med pa yin pas /
translated: That which is future is nonarisen and does not exist,

original: de la yang ci yang spang du med do //
analyzed: de la yang ci yang spang du med do //
translated: so there is nothing to abandon in it.

original: bag la nyal dang bcas pa da ltar byung ba gang yin pa de ni skad cig las lhag par mi gnas te bag la nyal dang bcas pa dang bag la nyal med pa'i sems gnyis 'grogs pa ni med pas de'i phyir da ltar byung ba'ang mi spong ngo
analyzed: bag la nyal dang bcas pa da ltar byung ba gang yin pa de ni skad cig las lhag par mi gnas te bag la nyal dang bcas pa dang bag la nyal med pa'i sems gnyis 'grogs pa ni med pas de'i phyir da ltar byung ba'ang mi spong ngo
translated: That which is present with latent states does not endure beyond a moment, because the two minds with and without latent states do not accompany each other. Therefore, the present is also not abandoned.

original: // 'on kyang gzhan gyi sgra dang bdag nyid kyi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las nyon mongs pa'i gnyen @114b po'i sems yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni skye la de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i sems ni 'gags te
analyzed: // 'on kyang gzhan gyi sgra dang bdag nyid kyi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las nyon mongs pa'i gnyen @114b po'i sems yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni skye la de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i sems ni 'gags te
translated: However, the afflicted mind that is the antidote to affliction arises from another’s words and from one’s own proper mental attention, which is concomitant with correct view. The mind with latent states that is incompatible with that is stopped.

original: / de ltar na de skye ba'i dus gang yin pa de nyid de 'gag pa'i dus yin pas de nyid kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa ni mgo mnyam du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / de ltar na de skye ba'i dus gang yin pa de nyid de 'gag pa'i dus yin pas de nyid kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa ni mgo mnyam du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, since the time of its arising is the very time of its cessation, its arising and cessation should be understood to be simultaneous.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i sems yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa de ni da ltar byung ba bag la nyal med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i sems yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa de ni da ltar byung ba bag la nyal med pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, the mind that is the antidote to the mental afflictions and is conjoined with correct view is present and free of latent propensities.

original: skad cig de las thal ba ni 'das pa bag la nyal med pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig de las thal ba ni 'das pa bag la nyal med pa yin no //
translated: The mind that is subsequent to that very moment is past and free of latent propensities.

original: ma 'ongs pa'ang bag la nyal med pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'ang bag la nyal med pa yin no //
translated: The future is also free of latent propensities.

original: de ltar gnas gyur te bag la nyal gyi rgyun yang dag par chad na de'i rjes su 'jig rten pa'i dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems de'i 'og tu phyis 'byung ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba gang yin pa de'ang
analyzed: de ltar gnas gyur te bag la nyal gyi rgyun yang dag par chad na de'i rjes su 'jig rten pa'i dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems de'i 'og tu phyis 'byung ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba gang yin pa de'ang
translated: Thus, when the continuum of latent propensities is completely severed, the virtuous and neutral minds that occur subsequently, whether they are past, future, or present,

original: bag la nyal med pas /
analyzed: bag la nyal med pas /
translated: are free of latent propensities.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa'ang spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa'ang spangs pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the past is also abandoned.

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa yang spangs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa yang spangs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The present and future are also called abandoned.

original: de ltar na de ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam par byang ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam par byang ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the classification of purification from the affliction of affliction.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i log par bsgrub pa dang spang bar bya ba'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i log par bsgrub pa dang spang bar bya ba'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of the perversion and abandonment of the affliction of affliction?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bco lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bco lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be seen as fifteenfold.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa rnams dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams la lnga po ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs dang ldan pa rnams dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa rnams dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams la lnga po ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs dang ldan pa rnams dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The defilements to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, and by cultivation, in the realms of desire, form, and formlessness, are fifteen.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la ni nyon mongs pa bcu po thams cad log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la ni nyon mongs pa bcu po thams cad log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: In the realm of desire, all ten afflictions are wrongly engaged in the truth of suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba la ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ma gtogs pa nyon mongs pa brgyad log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ma gtogs pa nyon mongs pa brgyad log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: In the truth of origin, eight afflictions are wrongly engaged, excluding the afflicted view of the self and the extreme.

original: kun 'byung ba la ji lta ba bzhin du 'gog pa dang lam la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la ji lta ba bzhin du 'gog pa dang lam la yang de bzhin no //
translated: In the truth of cessation and the truth of the path, the ten afflictions are wrongly engaged, just as in the truth of suffering.

original: gong ma la ni bden pa thams cad la khong khro ba ma gtogs pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams ni ji lta ba bzhin du log par 'jug pa go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma la ni bden pa thams cad la khong khro ba ma gtogs pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams ni ji lta ba bzhin du log par 'jug pa go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: In the higher realms, all are wrongly engaged, except for anger, just as in the realm of desire.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la bag la nyal bcu log par zhugs pa yin @115a * //
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la bag la nyal bcu log par zhugs pa yin @115a * //
translated: How are the ten dormant afflictions wrongly engaged in the truth of suffering?

original: zhe na ; mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes brjod pa la byis pa rnams ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag nyid la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mu nyi shu las mu lngas bdag tu lta bar byed la /
analyzed: zhe na ; mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes brjod pa la byis pa rnams ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag nyid la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mu nyi shu las mu lngas bdag tu lta bar byed la /
translated: The five views of the self among the twenty views of the transitory collection are views of the self in relation to the five appropriative aggregates.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni bdag gir lta bar byed de /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni bdag gir lta bar byed de /
translated: The remaining views are views of mine in relation to the five appropriative aggregates.

original: de ltar na 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la log par zhugs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la log par zhugs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the view of the transitory collection should be regarded as a misapprehension of the truth of suffering.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid la brten nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag nyid la rtag pa'am chad pa yang dag par rjes su lta bas /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid la brten nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag nyid la rtag pa'am chad pa yang dag par rjes su lta bas /
translated: On the basis of that view of the transitory collection, one views the five appropriative aggregates as eternal or subject to annihilation.

original: de'i phyir mthar phyin par lta ba yang sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthar phyin par lta ba yang sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the view of the extremes is also a misapprehension of the truth of suffering.

original: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du log par lta ba gang yin pa de dang pha med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du log par lta ba gang yin pa de dang pha med do //
translated: The view that there is no father,

original: ma med do //
analyzed: ma med do //
translated: no mother,🔽and no sentient beings who are supernaturally born is a wrong view that is also a distorted view of the truth of suffering.

original: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes log par lta ba gang yin pa de'i phyogs gcig kyang sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes log par lta ba gang yin pa de'i phyogs gcig kyang sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The view that there is no father,

original: phyogs gcig ni kun 'byung ba la'o //🔽gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba dge sbyong goo ta mas nyan thos rnams la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gdags par byas pa gang yin pa de ni med do zhes zer ba gang yin pa
analyzed: phyogs gcig ni kun 'byung ba la'o // gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba dge sbyong goo ta mas nyan thos rnams la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gdags par byas pa gang yin pa de ni med do zhes zer ba gang yin pa
translated: no mother,🔽and no sentient beings who are supernaturally born is a wrong view that is also a distorted view of the truth of suffering.🔽The view that the truth of suffering that is imputed by the ascetic Gautama to his disciples does not exist is a wrong view that is also a distorted view of the truth of suffering.

original: de'ang sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'ang sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The view that the truth of suffering that is imputed by the ascetic Gautama to his disciples does not exist is a wrong view that is also a distorted view of the truth of suffering.

original: dbang phyug dang skye dgu'i bdag po dang brgya byin dang tshangs pa zhes bya ba dang gang de lta bu dang mthun pa gzhan la yang rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug go zhes lta ba gang yin pa log par lta ba de ni sdug bsngal la🔽log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang skye dgu'i bdag po dang brgya byin dang tshangs pa zhes bya ba dang gang de lta bu dang mthun pa gzhan la yang rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug go zhes lta ba gang yin pa log par lta ba de ni sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The view that the self and the world are created by God, by the Lord, by Visnu, by Isvara, by the creator, by time, by nature, by chance, or by some other such creator, is a wrong view that misconceive the truth of suffering.🔽The view that the self and the world are finite or infinite is a wrong view that misconceive the truth of suffering.🔽The view that the self and the world are both finite and infinite, or neither finite nor infinite, is a wrong view that misconceive the truth of suffering.

original: mtha' dang mtha' med par smra ba rnams kyi log par lta ba gang yin pa de yang sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin no //🔽dge sbyong dang bram ze lha mi spong bar smra ba rnams kyi log par lta ba gang yin pa de'i phyogs gcig kyang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtha' dang mtha' med par smra ba rnams kyi log par lta ba gang yin pa de yang sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin no // dge sbyong dang bram ze lha mi spong bar smra ba rnams kyi log par lta ba gang yin pa de'i phyogs gcig kyang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The view that the self and the world are eternal is a wrong view that misconceive the truth of suffering.🔽The view that the self and the world are not eternal is a wrong view that misconceive the truth of suffering.🔽The view that the self and the world are both eternal and not eternal is a wrong view that misconceive the truth of suffering.🔽The view that the self and the world are neither eternal nor not eternal is a wrong view that misconceive the truth of suffering.🔽The view that the self and the world are created by ascetics and brahmins is a wrong view that misconceive the truth of suffering.🔽The view that the self and the world are not created by ascetics and brahmins is a wrong view that misconceive the truth of suffering.🔽The view that the self and the world are created by both ascetics and brahmins and not created by both ascetics and brahmins is a wrong view that misconceive the truth of suffering.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa gang gis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la log par zhugs pa'i lta ba de dag la dam par mchog tu 'dzin cing /
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa gang gis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la log par zhugs pa'i lta ba de dag la dam par mchog tu 'dzin cing /
translated: The view that the self and the world are created by neither ascetics and brahmins nor not created by neither ascetics and brahmins is a wrong view that misconceive the truth of suffering.🔽The view that the self and the world are created by God, by the Lord, by Visnu, by Isvara, by the creator, by time, by nature, by chance, or by some other such creator is a wrong view that misconceive the truth of suffering.

original: des dag pa dang grol ba dang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa de'ang sdug bsngal gyi @115b bden pa la log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: des dag pa dang grol ba dang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa de'ang sdug bsngal gyi @115b bden pa la log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: That which is the overesteeming of that view is also a misapprehension of the truth of suffering.

original: lta ba de dang rjes su mthun pa dang de dang mthun pa'i chos tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs yang dag par blangs pa la dam par mchog tu 'dzin cing /
analyzed: lta ba de dang rjes su mthun pa dang de dang mthun pa'i chos tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs yang dag par blangs pa la dam par mchog tu 'dzin cing /
translated: That which is the overesteeming of morality and asceticism in the form of taking up morality and asceticism that is in accordance with that view and the dharmas that are in accordance with that view as the highest and taking them to be

original: des dag pa dang grol ba dang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa de 'ang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: des dag pa dang grol ba dang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa de 'ang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: purification, liberation, and definite release is also a misapprehension of the truth of suffering.

translated: Some non-Buddhist Forders are not definitely convinced that those views are the aspects of the four truths, and they do not definitely deny that the designation of the truth of suffering is made.🔽However, they are uncertain, thinking, “Is it suffering or is it not suffering?” The ignorance that is concomitant with that uncertainty is also a misapprehension of suffering.

analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa gzhan gyi lta ba dag la kun nas mnar sems pa'i khong khro ba de'ang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Also, the anger that is the complete affliction of other views that are not in accordance with those is the misapprehension of the truth of suffering.

translated: Also, the pride that is inflated by those views is the misapprehension of the truth of suffering.

original: lta ba de dag dang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa dang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi shes pa ma 'dres pa 'ba' zhig pa gang yin pa de'ang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa🔽la log par zhugs pa yin te /

translated: Also, the ignorance that is concomitant with those views and the afflictions such as attachment and the ignorance that is unmixed with those afflictions in the truth of suffering is the misapprehension of the truth of suffering.

original: de ltar na nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la log par zhugs pa dang / sdug bsngal mthong pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la log par zhugs pa dang / sdug bsngal mthong pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: Thus, these ten afflictions are the misapprehension of the truth of suffering and are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: ji ltar na kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la bag la nyal brgyad po log par zhugs pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la bag la nyal brgyad po log par zhugs pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How are the eight latent afflictions mistaken with regard to the truth of origin?🔽The first is the mistaken view of those ascetics and brahmins who advocate causelessness.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze rgyu med par smra ba rnams kyi log par lta ba gang yin pa de dang dge sbyong dang bram ze mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba rnams kyi dbang phyug la sogs pa /

translated: The second is the mistaken view of those ascetics and brahmins who advocate a creator as a cause, such as God, and so on.

original: dngos po rnams kyi byin pa @116a * //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi byin pa @116a * //
translated: They say that God is the creator,🔽the transformer, and the agent of all things.

analyzed: po dang sprul pa po dang byed pa po yin no zhes log par lta ba gang yin pa de dang / sbyin pa med do // mchod sbyin med do //
translated: The third is the mistaken view that there is no giving,🔽no sacrifice,

original: sbyin sreg med do //
analyzed: sbyin sreg med do //
translated: no burnt offerings,

original: legs par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa med do //

translated: Just as the defilements such as attachment are wrongly engaged with regard to the truth of the path, so too are the eight latent tendencies wrongly engaged with regard to the truth of the path and are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.

analyzed: ; de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa rnams zhes bya'o //

analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa rnams gang zhe na / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i khong khro ba dang // khams gsum na spyod pa gsum ste /
translated: What are the contaminants to be abandoned by cultivation?🔽They are the three of anger, attachment and conceit that occur in the desire realm,

original: 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'o //
translated: and the three of attachment, conceit and ignorance that occur in the two higher realms.

analyzed: de dag kyang lam mchog tu goms pas spong bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are abandoned by repeated practice of the supreme path, they are called contaminants to be abandoned by cultivation.

translated: The small path would engage to abandon great contaminants,

original: lam 'bring ni zag pa 'bring rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: lam 'bring ni zag pa 'bring rnams kyi'o //
translated: the medium path would engage to abandon medium contaminants,

original: lam chen po ni zag pa chung ngu rnams spong ba'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam chen po ni zag pa chung ngu rnams spong ba'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the great path would engage to abandon small contaminants.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa de dag kyang rang gi ngang kho nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po la zhugs pa dang yun ring po nas ye yod pa yin pas /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa de dag kyang rang gi ngang kho nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po la zhugs pa dang yun ring po nas ye yod pa yin pas /
translated: Those contaminants to be abandoned by the path of meditation are contaminants associated with their own objects and have existed for a long time, since beginningless time.

original: de'i phyir dbral dka' ba yin pas rang gi dngos po la log par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbral dka' ba yin pas rang gi dngos po la log par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, since they are difficult to remove, they are wrongly engaged with their own objects.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i log par 'jug pa dang spang bar bya ba'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i log par 'jug pa dang spang bar bya ba'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the establishment of the differentiation of the perversions of the defilement of passion and of what is to be abandoned.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa ji skad bstan pa de dag gi dmigs pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa ji skad bstan pa de dag gi dmigs pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The objects of the contaminations which are to be abandoned by insight and by cultivation, as they have been explained, should be understood in brief as fivefold:

original: log par rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / lta ba la dmigs pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la dmigs pa dang / rang gis rnam par brtags pa'i ming la dmigs pa dang / rang gi ngang gis ye yod pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: log par rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / lta ba la dmigs pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la dmigs pa dang / rang gis rnam par brtags pa'i ming la dmigs pa dang / rang gi ngang gis ye yod pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'o //
translated: the object of the perversion of false imagination, the object of the view, the object of morality and vows, the object of the name imagined by oneself, and the object of the entity which exists by its own nature.

original: de la gang dag sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la dmigs pa de dag ni log par rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang dag sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la dmigs pa de dag ni log par rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Among these, those which have the truths of suffering and of the origin as their objects are called the objects of the perversion of false imagination.

original: the tshom ma gtogs pa lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang ; 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni lta ba la mchog tu dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom ma gtogs pa lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang ; 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni lta ba la mchog tu dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Except for doubt, the views and attachment, etc. that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing are called “the views that take the view as supreme.”

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The overesteeming of morality and asceticism is called “the view that takes morality and asceticism as supreme.”

original: 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa dang khams mi 'dra ba dag la dmigs pa dag ni rang gis rnam par brtags pa'i ming la dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa dang khams mi 'dra ba dag la dmigs pa dag ni rang gis rnam par brtags pa'i ming la dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The views that focus on cessation and the path and that focus on different realms are called “the views that take names as supreme.”

original: nyon mongs pa ni nam yang 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs par ma gyur dmigs par mi byed dmigs par mi 'gyur la khams mi 'dra ba la yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni nam yang 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs par ma gyur dmigs par mi byed dmigs par mi 'gyur la khams mi 'dra ba la yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the afflictions never focus on cessation and the path, do not focus on them, and will not focus on them, and because they do not focus on different realms.

original: gang dag bsgom pas spang bar bya ba de dag ni rang gi ngang gis ye yod pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag bsgom pas spang bar bya ba de dag ni rang gi ngang gis ye yod pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation are called “the views that take things that naturally exist as supreme.”

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of the counteractives to the defilement of the defilements?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as being of four kinds:

original: rgyud yongs su smin par byed @118a * //
analyzed: rgyud yongs su smin par byed @118a * //
translated: the counteractive which matures the stream,🔽the counteractive which eliminates the proximate factors of instability,🔽the counteractive which eliminates a part ,

original: pa'i gnyen po dang / nye bar spong ba'i gnyen po dang / phyogs gcig spong ba'i gnyen po dang / mtha' dag spong ba'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: pa'i gnyen po dang / nye bar spong ba'i gnyen po dang / phyogs gcig spong ba'i gnyen po dang / mtha' dag spong ba'i gnyen po'o //
translated: and the counteractive which eliminates completely.

original: de la tshogs kyi lam rnam pa bcu gsum po nyan thos kyi sar ji skad bstan pa thams cad ni rgyu yongs su smin par byed pa'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshogs kyi lam rnam pa bcu gsum po nyan thos kyi sar ji skad bstan pa thams cad ni rgyu yongs su smin par byed pa'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The counteractive which matures the stream is the thirteen stages of the path of preparation as they are described in the Sravakabhumi.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog nyan thos kyi sa nyid du ji skad bstan pa rnams ni nye bar spong ba'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog nyan thos kyi sa nyid du ji skad bstan pa rnams ni nye bar spong ba'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The counteractive which eliminates the proximate factors of instability is the wholesome roots which are conducive to the penetration, namely, the stage of heat, the stage of summits, the stage of patience and the supreme mundane factors. They are described in the Sravakabhumi.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam ni phyogs gcig spong ba'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam ni phyogs gcig spong ba'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The path of insight is the antidote that eliminates a part.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni mtha' dag spong ba'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni mtha' dag spong ba'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The path of cultivation is the antidote that eliminates everything.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam la yang dag par zhugs pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag gi shes par spyod pa ni ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam la yang dag par zhugs pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag gi shes par spyod pa ni ji lta bu yin /
translated: What is the activity of the knowledge of the noble person who has entered the path of insight?

original: sems du zhig gis ni mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ;
analyzed: sems du zhig gis ni mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ;
translated: By how many thoughts is the path of insight completed?

original: ci mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni cig car ram rim gyis sam ji ltar spong bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni cig car ram rim gyis sam ji ltar spong bar byed ce na /
translated: How does one eliminate the defilements that are to be eliminated by insight, all at once or gradually?

original: mthong ba'i lam la yang dag par zhugs pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag gis shes pa'i spyod pa ni mtshan ma med pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la yang dag par zhugs pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag gis shes pa'i spyod pa ni mtshan ma med pa yin te /
translated: The activity of the knowledge of the noble person who has entered the path of insight is signless.

original: de ni shes pas sdug bsngal la dmigs par byed mod kyi de de'i tshe na sdug bsngal gyi dngos po de la sdug bsngal lo snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'am mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni mi 'byung ngo //🔽sdug bsngal ji lta ba bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam rnams la yang de bzhin te de de'i tshe na sngon kun rdzob kyi shes pas rnam par dpyad pa'i bden pa dag la sngon 'du shes dang mtshan ma las rnam par grol bas rnam
analyzed: de ni shes pas sdug bsngal la dmigs par byed mod kyi de de'i tshe na sdug bsngal gyi dngos po de la sdug bsngal lo snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'am mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni mi 'byung ngo // sdug bsngal ji lta ba bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam rnams la yang de bzhin te de de'i tshe na sngon kun rdzob kyi shes pas rnam par dpyad pa'i bden pa dag la sngon 'du shes dang mtshan ma las rnam par grol bas rnam
translated: Although that knowledge focuses on suffering, at that time, the conceptualization or apprehension of signs of that thing that is suffering does not occur, thinking, “This is suffering.”

original: par grol ba'i shes pa spros pa med pa don tsam 'ba' zhig shes pa'i de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa mtshan ma med pa 'ba' zhig 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: par grol ba'i shes pa spros pa med pa don tsam 'ba' zhig shes pa'i de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa mtshan ma med pa 'ba' zhig 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as with suffering, so it is with the origin, cessation, and path. At that time, due to being liberated from the prior conceptualization and signs of the truths that were previously analyzed by conventional knowledge, the knowledge of liberation engages only in signlessness, which is the object of observation of the suchness of the mere object of knowledge that is the mere object, the unelaborated knowledge of liberation.

original: de'i tshe na de'i shes pa'i spyod pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe na de'i shes pa'i spyod pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: At that time, the activity of that knowledge is like that.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The path of seeing is presented in two ways:

original: bstan pa gnas pa'i rgyas pa rnam par gzhag pa spros pa dang bcas pa dang / don dam pa rnam par gzhag pa so so rang gi rig pa spros pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa gnas pa'i rgyas pa rnam par gzhag pa spros pa dang bcas pa dang / don dam pa rnam par gzhag pa so so rang gi rig pa spros pa med pa'o //
translated: the extensive presentation of the teaching's duration and the ultimate presentation of the individual's intuitive knowledge, which is unextended.

original: de la rnam par gzhag pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun @118b pa'i sems bzhi dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems bzhi dang / dus ji srid du sems brgyad po de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus de srid du de'i mjug thogs su yongs su bsgoms pa'i sems zhi gnas 'ba' zhig la zhugs pa gcig kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rnam par gzhag pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun @118b pa'i sems bzhi dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems bzhi dang / dus ji srid du sems brgyad po de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus de srid du de'i mjug thogs su yongs su bsgoms pa'i sems zhi gnas 'ba' zhig la zhugs pa gcig kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the first presentation, there are four kinds of mind associated with the knowledge of phenomena, four kinds of mind associated with the knowledge of subsequent realization, and one kind of mind that is the meditative state of calm abiding, which is the conclusion of those eight kinds of mind.

original: de dag bsdus na sems dgur 'gyur bas de dag gis mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag bsdus na sems dgur 'gyur bas de dag gis mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: These nine kinds of mind constitute the path of seeing.

original: dus ji srid kyis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ji ltar btags pa'i rnam par rig pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ni sems gcig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dus ji srid kyis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ji ltar btags pa'i rnam par rig pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ni sems gcig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: For as long as the truth of suffering is fully understood by the cognition of the way things really are, that is called one moment of mind.

original: rnam par gzhag pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas de bzhin nyid shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa gcig kho nas sems kyi rang bzhin las brtsams te mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas de bzhin nyid shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa gcig kho nas sems kyi rang bzhin las brtsams te mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In terms of the second presentation, the path of seeing is fully completed by just one moment of cognition that is concomitant with the cognition of the way things really are, beginning with the nature of mind.

original: 'dir zhi gnas kyi lam ni snga ma kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhi gnas kyi lam ni snga ma kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the path of calm abiding should be understood just as before.

original: de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ni cha gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ni cha gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: The latent states of the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing are presented in two parts:

original: dang ba'i gzugs dang rjes su 'brel pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba dang rjes su 'brel pa las so //
analyzed: dang ba'i gzugs dang rjes su 'brel pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba dang rjes su 'brel pa las so //
translated: those that are related to the form of clarity and those that are related to mind and mental factors.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam ni zhig nas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos ni zhi gnas kyis spang bar bya ba dang lhag mthong gis spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal rnam pa gnyi ga cig car spong bar
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam ni zhig nas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos ni zhi gnas kyis spang bar bya ba dang lhag mthong gis spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal rnam pa gnyi ga cig car spong bar
translated: Therefore, noble listeners simultaneously abandon both types of latent states that are to be abandoned by the path of serenity and insight.

original: byed do // de la dang po ni lhag mthong gis spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byed do // de la dang po ni lhag mthong gis spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The first are to be abandoned by insight.

original: gnyis pa ni zhi gnas kyis spang bar bya ba yin te de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni zhi gnas kyis spang bar bya ba yin te de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The second are to be abandoned by serenity. Therefore, it should be stated that the path of seeing is complete.

original: gal te lhag mthong gi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes pa de dag mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal dang 'brel par 'byung zhing /
analyzed: gal te lhag mthong gi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes pa de dag mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal dang 'brel par 'byung zhing /
translated: If the consciousnesses that are included in the category of insight arise in a manner that is related to the latent states that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing,

original: gnyen po nyid kyis sbyor bar mi byed na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po nyid kyis sbyor bar mi byed na ni ma yin no //
translated: and if they do not apply themselves as antidotes, then that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba mthong ba'i lam la zhugs pa gnyis pa dang / gang zag drug pa'ang mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa yin la //🔽de las gzhan pa lnga po dad pas mos pa dang mthong ba dang lus kyis mngon du byed pa dang shes rab kyis rnam @119a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba mthong ba'i lam la zhugs pa gnyis pa dang / gang zag drug pa'ang mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa yin la // de las gzhan pa lnga po dad pas mos pa dang mthong ba dang lus kyis mngon du byed pa dang shes rab kyis rnam @119a * //
translated: The two, the faith-follower and the Dharma-follower, who have entered the path of seeing, and the sixth person,🔽are those who abide in signlessness.🔽The other five, the one resolute in faith, the one who has attained through seeing, the one physically liberated, the one liberated by wisdom, and the one liberated in both ways,

original: par grol ba dang gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba de dag kyang 'gog pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa yin pas /
analyzed: par grol ba dang gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba de dag kyang 'gog pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa yin pas /
translated: abide with the perception of peace in cessation.

original: de'i phyir mtshan ma med par gnas pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan ma med par gnas pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore they are called those who abide in signlessness.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: sman pa zug rngu 'byin pa ni la la zhig gis 'bras shin tu yongs su smin par rig nas dang por mtshon rnon pos de brtol bar byed do //
analyzed: sman pa zug rngu 'byin pa ni la la zhig gis 'bras shin tu yongs su smin par rig nas dang por mtshon rnon pos de brtol bar byed do //
translated: a doctor who removes a dart first cuts open the abscess with a sharp instrument, knowing that the boil is fully ripened.

original: ji tsam du de brtol ba de tsam du de'i rnag 'dzag par 'gyur gyi rnag ma lus par 'dzag par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji tsam du de brtol ba de tsam du de'i rnag 'dzag par 'gyur gyi rnag ma lus par 'dzag par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as it is being opened, pus will flow out of it, but it will not flow out completely.

original: ji tsam du dral zhing shin tu btsir bar bya ste yang dang yang du btsir na /
analyzed: ji tsam du dral zhing shin tu btsir bar bya ste yang dang yang du btsir na /
translated: As long as it is being opened and pressed down again and again,

original: rnag 'khyims pa gang yin pa gzag par ni 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang de'i rma'i sgo de dag cing sos pa ni ma yin te /🔽de'i rma'i sgo de gso ba'i phyir phye mar gyi chang bu'am /
analyzed: rnag 'khyims pa gang yin pa gzag par ni 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang de'i rma'i sgo de dag cing sos pa ni ma yin te / de'i rma'i sgo de gso ba'i phyir phye mar gyi chang bu'am /
translated: the pus that has collected will flow out, but the opening of the wound will not heal.🔽In order to heal the opening of the wound,

original: ra da snum bag can gyis glon par byed do //
analyzed: ra da snum bag can gyis glon par byed do //
translated: it is covered with a plaster of ground barley or with oil-cakes.

original: de ltar phye mar gyi chang bu'am rma glon par da snum bag can gyis glon pa'i rma de ni rim gyis 'tsho bar 'gyur te de ni 'di lta ste /🔽don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir dper byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar phye mar gyi chang bu'am rma glon par da snum bag can gyis glon pa'i rma de ni rim gyis 'tsho bar 'gyur te de ni 'di lta ste / don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir dper byas pa yin no //
translated: The wound that is covered with a plaster of ground barley or with oil-cakes will gradually heal.🔽This is the meaning of the simile.

original: de la don ni 'di yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: This is how the meaning should be understood.

original: 'bras smin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni mthong bas spang par bya ba'i zag pa rnams kyi zag pa'i gnas lta bu'i dngos po rnams blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras smin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ni mthong bas spang par bya ba'i zag pa rnams kyi zag pa'i gnas lta bu'i dngos po rnams blta bar bya'o //
translated: The ripened fruit should be understood as being like the things that are the abode of the defilements to be abandoned by the path of vision.

original: mtshon gyis brtol ba ji lta ba de bzhin du ni lhag mthong gi phyogs su gtogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshon gyis brtol ba ji lta ba de bzhin du ni lhag mthong gi phyogs su gtogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam blta bar bya'o //
translated: The cutting with a knife should be understood as being like the path of vision which is on the side of insight.

original: btsir ba ji lta ba de bzhin du zhi gnas kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: btsir ba ji lta ba de bzhin du zhi gnas kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam blta bar bya'o //
translated: The pressing should be understood as being like the path of vision which is on the side of calm.

original: rnag ji lta ba de bzhin du ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal du gtogs pa'i zag pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnag ji lta ba de bzhin du ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal du gtogs pa'i zag pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: The pus should be understood as being like the defilements which are the latent tendencies to be abandoned by the path of vision.

original: rma ma dag pa ma sos pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa bzhi dang bcas pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rma ma dag pa ma sos pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa bzhi dang bcas pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: The unhealed wounds should be understood as being like the four defilements to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: phyi mar gyi chang bu'am rma glon pa'i ra da snum bag can ji lta ba de bzhin du ni bsgom pa'i lam blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi mar gyi chang bu'am rma glon pa'i ra da snum bag can ji lta ba de bzhin du ni bsgom pa'i lam blta bar bya'o //
translated: The after-purgation diet or the oily bandage should be understood as being like the path of cultivation.

original: de la so so'i skye bo'i 'dod pa'i khams sam /
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo'i 'dod pa'i khams sam /
translated: Ordinary beings who are free from attachment to the desire realm or

original: gzugs kyi khams las 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni bsgom pa'i lam kho nas byed kyi de la mthong ba'i lam ni med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams las 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni bsgom pa'i lam kho nas byed kyi de la mthong ba'i lam ni med do //
translated: the form realm do so only by the path of meditation, not by the path of seeing.

original: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba de de'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags @119b dang gnod sems dang de dang mthun pa'i chos dang 'brel ba'i nga rgyal dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa ni kun tu mi 'byung ba'i tshul gyis spong pa yin
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba de de'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags @119b dang gnod sems dang de dang mthun pa'i chos dang 'brel ba'i nga rgyal dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa ni kun tu mi 'byung ba'i tshul gyis spong pa yin
translated: Those free from attachment to the desire realm abandon attachment to desire realm objects, malice, pride consistent with that and ignorance concomitant with that through the mode of nonarising.🔽But the view of the

original: gyi / 'jig tshogs la lta ba sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: gyi / 'jig tshogs la lta ba sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: perishing aggregates and so on that are objects abandoned by the path of seeing are not abandoned in that way.

original: de dag kyang 'di na gnas pa lus 'di la gnas pa langs pa de la ni lan 'ga' kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur gyi gong mar skyes pa la ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'di na gnas pa lus 'di la gnas pa langs pa de la ni lan 'ga' kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur gyi gong mar skyes pa la ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: They arise occasionally for those who abide in this desire realm and arise for those born in higher realms but not for those born in the formless realm.

original: de bzhin du so so'i skye bo gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la khong khro ba ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du so so'i skye bo gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la khong khro ba ma gtogs pa /
translated: are always present in those who are born there,🔽who enter meditative attainment and who arise from meditative attainment.

original: de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ci rigs par blta bar bya'o ;
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ci rigs par blta bar bya'o ;
translated: The contaminants of the form and formless realms🔽are always present in those who are born there and who enter meditative attainment.🔽The contaminants of the form and formless realms are always present in those born there and who enter meditative attainment.🔽The contaminants of the desire realm are always present in those who are born there, who enter meditative attainment and who arise from meditative attainment.

original: / snyoms par zhugs pa dang langs pa dang skyes pa rnams kyi rang gi sa pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa ni rkyen dang phrad na rtag pa kho nar kun tu 'byung ngo //🔽de la gnas ngan len ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /🔽zag pa'i gnas ngan len dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: / snyoms par zhugs pa dang langs pa dang skyes pa rnams kyi rang gi sa pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa ni rkyen dang phrad na rtag pa kho nar kun tu 'byung ngo // de la gnas ngan len ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te / zag pa'i gnas ngan len dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: The contaminants of those who are born there and who enter meditative attainment are always present in those who are born there and who enter meditative attainment.🔽The contaminants of those who arise from meditative attainment are always present in those who arise from meditative attainment.🔽The contaminants of those who are born there are always present in those who are born there.🔽The contaminants of those who are born there are always present in those who are born there.

original: de la dgra bcom pa la ni zag pa'i gnas ngan len gang yin pa de bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir thams cad kyi thams cad du bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de la dgra bcom pa la ni zag pa'i gnas ngan len gang yin pa de bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir thams cad kyi thams cad du bral ba yin no //
translated: The contaminants of those who are born there are always present in those who are born there.🔽The contaminants of those who are born there are always present in those who are born there.🔽The contaminants of those who are born there are always present in those who are born there.🔽The contaminants of those who are born there are always present in those who are born there.🔽The contaminants of those who are born there are always present in those who are born there.🔽The contaminants of those who are born there are always present in those who are born there.🔽The contaminants of those who are born there are always present in those who are born there.

original: de yang bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i lus rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa la las su mi rung ba'i tshul gyi sa ngan par rnam par gnas pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i lus rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa la las su mi rung ba'i tshul gyi sa ngan par rnam par gnas pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the body with its latent tendencies and consciousness that is situated in a bad place in the manner of unserviceability.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i gnas ngan len ni bag la nyal spangs kyang sngon zag pas bskyed cing zag pas yongs su bsgos pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i gnas ngan len ni bag la nyal spangs kyang sngon zag pas bskyed cing zag pas yongs su bsgos pa ste /
translated: The bad habit of the contaminated is that which is generated by the contaminants and imbued by the contaminants, even though the latent afflictions have been abandoned.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i las su mi rung ba'i tshul gyis rang bzhin gyis ngan par gnas pa dang ngan par zhugs pa ches srab pa dang ches chung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i las su mi rung ba'i tshul gyis rang bzhin gyis ngan par gnas pa dang ngan par zhugs pa ches srab pa dang ches chung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the natural bad situation and bad engagement that are very slight and very small in the manner of unserviceability that is similar to that.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i gnas ngan len gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i gnas ngan len gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags zhes bya ste /
translated: That bad habit of the contaminated is called the “latent afflictions.”

original: de yang dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyis ni ma spangs kyi /
analyzed: de yang dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyis ni ma spangs kyi /
translated: Moreover, it is not abandoned by arhats and pratyekabuddhas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig gis spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig gis spangs pa yin te /
translated: but is abandoned by the Tathāgata alone.

original: de'i bag chags yang dag par bcom pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bag chags yang dag par bcom pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The complete destruction of the latent impressions of that is called the Buddha's unique qualities.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa lnga zhes bya'o /🔽// / bam po bcu gsum pa //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa lnga zhes bya'o / // / bam po bcu gsum pa //
translated: This is called the fivefold classification of the afflictive obstructions.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun rtog 'dod @120a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun rtog 'dod @120a * //
translated: The Lord has said, “Imagination is desire. Desire is the desire of a person.

original: chags skyes bu'i 'dod pa yin zhes gang gsungs pa de la ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa 'ba' zhig 'dod pa'i sgrar bstan la /
analyzed: chags skyes bu'i 'dod pa yin zhes gang gsungs pa de la ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa 'ba' zhig 'dod pa'i sgrar bstan la /
translated: ” Why is only the desire of the afflictions taught by the word desire,

original: dngos po'i 'dod pa ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po'i 'dod pa ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: and not the desire of things?

original: smras pa / nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa rnams ni ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa rnams ni ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We reply, because the desires of the afflictions are by nature afflictive.

original: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa rnams kho nas dngos po'i 'dod pa rnams 'dod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa rnams kho nas dngos po'i 'dod pa rnams 'dod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, only the desires of the afflictions cause the desires of things.

original: gzhan yang dngos po'i 'dod pas kun nas bslang ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pas byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po'i 'dod pas kun nas bslang ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pas byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, the fault of afflictions that is motivated by desire for things is created by desire for afflictions.

original: 'di lta ste dper na ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na ;
translated: For example,🔽if someone does not completely understand and abandon desire that is imagination, first they are burned by craving for desire.

original: gang la la zhig gis kun tu rtog pa'i 'dod chags yongs su ma shes bsam spangs pa gyur na de dang po kho nar 'dod pa'i sred pas yongs su sreg par byed pa dang 'dod pa'i sred pas yongs su bsregs pas 'dod pa yongs su tshol bar byed
analyzed: gang la la zhig gis kun tu rtog pa'i 'dod chags yongs su ma shes bsam spangs pa gyur na de dang po kho nar 'dod pa'i sred pas yongs su sreg par byed pa dang 'dod pa'i sred pas yongs su bsregs pas 'dod pa yongs su tshol bar byed
translated: Since they are burned by craving for desire, they seek out desire.🔽Since they seek out desire, they experience the suffering of physical and mental fatigue.

original: pa dang 'dod pa yongs su tshol bar byed pas lus dang sems yongs su ngal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / brtsal ba ma grub pa na ni kye ma bdag gi brtsal ba ni 'bras bu med do zhes ngal ba dang 'bras bu med pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: pa dang 'dod pa yongs su tshol bar byed pas lus dang sems yongs su ngal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / brtsal ba ma grub pa na ni kye ma bdag gi brtsal ba ni 'bras bu med do zhes ngal ba dang 'bras bu med pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: If their search is not successful, they experience the suffering of fatigue and futility, thinking, “Alas, my search has no result.”

original: grub na'ang kun tu bsrung ba'i gzhi'i phyir shin tu rtsol bar byed pa ni kun tu bsrung ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / yongs su longs spyod pa'i dus na'ang 'dod chags kyi mes yongs su sreg cing nang nye bar ma zhi ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: grub na'ang kun tu bsrung ba'i gzhi'i phyir shin tu rtsol bar byed pa ni kun tu bsrung ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / yongs su longs spyod pa'i dus na'ang 'dod chags kyi mes yongs su sreg cing nang nye bar ma zhi ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Even when one is enjoying one's wealth, one is burned by the fire of attachment and one experiences the suffering of inner unrest.🔽Even when one is in decline, one experiences the suffering of sorrow.🔽Even when one recalls the past, one experiences the suffering of discursive thought.

original: rgud par gyur pa na yang mya ngan gyi sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / rjes su dran pa na yang rnam par rtog pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / de ltar rgyu des na lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa lta bu dang /
analyzed: rgud par gyur pa na yang mya ngan gyi sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / rjes su dran pa na yang rnam par rtog pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / de ltar rgyu des na lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa lta bu dang /
translated: In this way, one experiences the suffering of the arising of physical, verbal, and mental misdeeds.

original: 'dod pa rnams yongs su spangs te rab tu byung ba ni 'dod pa rnams yongs su spangs nas kyang nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i gzhi rnams len par byed de /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams yongs su spangs te rab tu byung ba ni 'dod pa rnams yongs su spangs nas kyang nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i gzhi rnams len par byed de /
translated: Those who renounce the world after completely abandoning the desires, still take up the basis of the desire for the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i gzhi kho nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa dang / ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'i gzhi kho nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa dang / ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed do //
translated: By the basis of the desire for the defilements alone, one is born in the desire realm, and the suffering of old age, sickness, death, etc., and the suffering of the unfortunate realms are actualized.

original: @120b de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa yin te de'i rgyur gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa yin pas /
analyzed: @120b de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa yin te de'i rgyur gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa yin pas /
translated: Such are the faults of defilement. The cause of that is the desire for the defilements.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa kho na 'dod pa'i sgras yongs su bstan gyi dngos po'i 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa kho na 'dod pa'i sgras yongs su bstan gyi dngos po'i 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the desire for the defilements alone is taught by the word desire by the Lord, not the desire for things.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyed par byed pa'i kun tu rtog pa la rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyed par byed pa'i kun tu rtog pa la rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: How many kinds of conceptual thoughts generate desire for desire?

original: smras pa / rnam pa brgyad yod de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa brgyad yod de 'di lta ste /
translated: He said: There are eight types:

original: zlog par byed pa dang / sad par byed pa dang / kun tu sbyor bar byed pa dang / mtshan mar 'dzin par byed pa dang / chags par byed pa dang / rnam par 'dod par byed pa dang / nges par gnod par byed pa dang /
analyzed: zlog par byed pa dang / sad par byed pa dang / kun tu sbyor bar byed pa dang / mtshan mar 'dzin par byed pa dang / chags par byed pa dang / rnam par 'dod par byed pa dang / nges par gnod par byed pa dang /
translated: 1. turning away, 2. arousing, 3. fully connecting, 4. apprehending signs, 5. attachment, 6. desiring, 7. definitely harming, and 8.

original: mchog tu chags par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mchog tu chags par byed pa ste /
translated: supreme attachment.🔽The Sūtra of the Questions of Brahmā

original: tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: says:🔽Turning away, arousing, and likewise fully connecting,

original: zlog par byed dang sad byed dang // de bzhin kun tu sbyor byed dang // mtshan mar 'dzin byed chags byed dang // rnam par 'dod byed nges gnod byed //
analyzed: zlog par byed dang sad byed dang // de bzhin kun tu sbyor byed dang // mtshan mar 'dzin byed chags byed dang // rnam par 'dod byed nges gnod byed //
translated: apprehending signs, attachment, desiring, definitely harming,

original: de bzhin mchog tu chags byed ni //🔽'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyed byed pa'i //
analyzed: de bzhin mchog tu chags byed ni // 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyed byed pa'i //
translated: and likewise supreme attachment

original: kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ste //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ste //
translated: are the conceptions that generate attachment to desire.

original: mkhas pas de dag yongs su spang //🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas de dag yongs su spang //🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The wise abandon them.

original: de la zlog par byed pa ni dge ba la brtson pa'i sems kyi rgyud bzlog nas 'dod pa rnams la rtsol ba skyed par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la zlog par byed pa ni dge ba la brtson pa'i sems kyi rgyud bzlog nas 'dod pa rnams la rtsol ba skyed par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The reversal is the reversal of the mind's effort toward virtue and the production of effort toward sense-desire.

original: de la sad par byed pa ni yul nye bar ma gyur cing mngon du ma gyur pa la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pas kun tu 'ching bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sad par byed pa ni yul nye bar ma gyur cing mngon du ma gyur pa la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pas kun tu 'ching bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The binding is the binding by the fetter of the desire-attachment to the object which is not present and not manifest.

original: de la kun tu sbyor bar byed pa ni gang gis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa 'dod pa yongs su tshol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun tu sbyor bar byed pa ni gang gis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa 'dod pa yongs su tshol bar byed pa'o //
translated: The fetter is that by which the fetter of desire-attachment seeks after sense-desire.

original: de la mtshan mar 'dzin par byed pa ni gang gis yul nye bar gyur cing mngon du gyur pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan mar 'dzin par byed pa ni gang gis yul nye bar gyur cing mngon du gyur pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: The sign-grasping is the grasping of the sign and the grasping of the indication of the object which is present and manifest.

original: de la chags par byed pa ni yul nye bar gyur cing mngon du gyur pa la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pas kun tu 'ching bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //🔽de la rnam par 'dod par byed pa ni gang gis de ltar 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa /
analyzed: de la chags par byed pa ni yul nye bar gyur cing mngon du gyur pa la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pas kun tu 'ching bar byed pa gang yin pa'o // de la rnam par 'dod par byed pa ni gang gis de ltar 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa /
translated: Attachment to them is the fettering by the entanglement of desire-attachment to the objects that have come near and are present.

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod rnam pa du ma mngon par 'dod par byed pa'o //🔽de la nges par gnod par byed pa ni gang gis 'dod pa rnams yang dang yang du mngon par bsgrub pa na gcig tu @121a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod rnam pa du ma mngon par 'dod par byed pa'o // de la nges par gnod par byed pa ni gang gis 'dod pa rnams yang dang yang du mngon par bsgrub pa na gcig tu @121a * //
translated: Desire for them is the desire for the various enjoyments of desire, by one who is thus entangled by desire.

original: nges par yon tan du lta zhing nyes dmigs su mi lta bar yongs su longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nges par yon tan du lta zhing nyes dmigs su mi lta bar yongs su longs spyod pa'o //
translated: Definite harm is the enjoyment of the objects of desire, by one who, in repeatedly pursuing them, sees only their virtues and does not see their danger.

original: de la mchog du chags par byed pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa mthar thug pa dang mthar phyin pas kun nas 'ching bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mchog du chags par byed pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa mthar thug pa dang mthar phyin pas kun nas 'ching bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Extreme attachment is the fettering by the final and ultimate entanglement of desire-attachment.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad las 'dod chags kho na 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad las 'dod chags kho na 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su bstan ce na /
translated: Why is only attachment taught as the characteristic of the desire realm among all the afflictions that operate in the desire realm?

original: smras pa / rgyu gang kho nas sred pa kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su bstan pa'i rgyu de nyid kyis 'di yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu gang kho nas sred pa kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su bstan pa'i rgyu de nyid kyis 'di yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is said: By the very cause by which craving is taught as the characteristic of the truth of origin, this should be seen in the same way.

original: de ci'i phyir kun tu rtog pa dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su bstan ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir kun tu rtog pa dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su bstan ce na /
translated: Why is only attachment with conceptualization taught as the characteristic of the desire realm?

original: smras pa / 'dod chags mngon du gyur pa dang 'dod chags kun nas slong ba'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / dngos po'i 'dod pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus nas kun tu rtog pa 'dod chags zhes yongs su bstan to ;
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod chags mngon du gyur pa dang 'dod chags kun nas slong ba'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / dngos po'i 'dod pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus nas kun tu rtog pa 'dod chags zhes yongs su bstan to ;
translated: It is said: The cause of manifest attachment and the cause of the motivation of attachment, and the cause of the enjoyment of the desired thing, when combined into one, are taught as the attachment of conceptualization.

original: / gzhan yang rab tu byung ba 'dod pa spangs pa 'dod pa'i kun tu rtog pa la kun tu rtog pa de dag kha cig gi kun tu rtog pa 'ang 'dod pa zhes bya bar rig nas de spang ba'i phyir kun tu rtog pa'ang 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid🔽du yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: / gzhan yang rab tu byung ba 'dod pa spangs pa 'dod pa'i kun tu rtog pa la kun tu rtog pa de dag kha cig gi kun tu rtog pa 'ang 'dod pa zhes bya bar rig nas de spang ba'i phyir kun tu rtog pa'ang 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su bstan to //
translated: Furthermore, the renunciate who has abandoned desire, when he has understood that some of his thoughts are called “desire,” in order to abandon them, he teaches that thoughts have the characteristic of desire.

original: ci'i phyir sred pa kun tu 'byung ba'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sred pa kun tu 'byung ba'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su bstan ce na /
translated: Why is craving taught to have the characteristic of truth?

original: smras pa / rgyu gnyis kyi phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu gnyis kyi phyir te /
translated: It is said: because of two reasons.

original: sred pa ni smon pa dang mi smon par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / khyab par 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir te 'di ltar lus dang longs spyod dag la smon pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i sred pa ni nye bar blangs pa dang yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir smon par yang byed do //
analyzed: sred pa ni smon pa dang mi smon par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / khyab par 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir te 'di ltar lus dang longs spyod dag la smon pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i sred pa ni nye bar blangs pa dang yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir smon par yang byed do //
translated: Craving is the cause of both aspiration and non-aspiration, and it is the cause of pervasion, because craving that is directed toward the aspiration for body and enjoyments causes aspiration, because of taking up and using.

original: mi smon par byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: mi smon par byed pa yang yin te /
translated: It also causes non-aspiration.

original: de'i gnyen po dge ba la mi smon pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni de nye bar blang ba dang sbyor ba'i phyir mi smon par byed de de ltar smon pa dang mi smon pa las 'khor bar 'khor ba rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po dge ba la mi smon pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni de nye bar blang ba dang sbyor ba'i phyir mi smon par byed de de ltar smon pa dang mi smon pa las 'khor bar 'khor ba rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The remedy for that is the approach to the non-aspiration for virtue, because it is the taking up and application of that. Thus, the continuous cycle of existence occurs from aspiration and non-aspiration.

original: de'i khyab par 'jug pa nyid kyang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i khyab par 'jug pa nyid kyang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The pervasion of that is also to be understood as threefold:

original: 'di lta ste gnas skabs la khyab pa ni tshor ba thams cad sgo lngas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gnas skabs la khyab pa ni tshor ba thams cad sgo lngas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Pervasion of the occasion is due to the fact that all feelings are pervaded by the five doors.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: phrad par mngon par dga' ba dang / mi 'bral bar mngon par dga' ba dang / mi 'phrad par mngon par dga' ba dang / 'bral @121b bar mngon par dga' ba dang / rtag tu 'brel pa'i lus kun gzhi la chags pas so //
