analyzed: phrad par mngon par dga' ba dang / mi 'bral bar mngon par dga' ba dang / mi 'phrad par mngon par dga' ba dang / 'bral @121b bar mngon par dga' ba dang / rtag tu 'brel pa'i lus kun gzhi la chags pas so //
translated: There is the delight in contact, the delight in non-separation, the delight in non-encounter, the delight in separation, and the attachment to the all-ground of the body that is always connected.

original: dus la khyab pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dus la khyab pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Pervasion of time is as follows:

original: 'das pa la dmigs pa dang ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pa dang de ltar byung ba la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la dmigs pa dang ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pa dang de ltar byung ba la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the focus on the past, the focus on the future, and the focus on the present.

original: yul la khyab pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yul la khyab pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: As for the object, it is as follows:

original: tshe 'di pa dang tshe phyi ma pa'i lus la dmigs pa dang yul thob pa dang ma thob pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di pa dang tshe phyi ma pa'i lus la dmigs pa dang yul thob pa dang ma thob pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object is the body of this life and the next life, and the object is that which is obtained and not obtained.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dang zhe sdang dang bral ba dang gti mug dang bral bas sems 'dod chags dang bral bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dang zhe sdang dang bral ba dang gti mug dang bral bas sems 'dod chags dang bral bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Why is it said that the mind should be freed from attachment by being freed from attachment, hatred and delusion?

original: nyon mongs pa'i gzhi 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gzhi 'di lta ste /
translated: The basis of the afflictions is as follows:

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dag las ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dag las ma yin zhe na /
translated: It is not from form, feeling, etc.

original: smras pa / de dag las 'dod chags dang bral na de dag las kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / de dag las 'dod chags dang bral na de dag las kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: Because if one is freed from attachment to those, one will also be freed from attachment to them.

original: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i bdag nyid yin pas de'i phyir nyes pa mang ba'i phyir te 'di ltar gzhi las nyes pa gang la la 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad ni nyon mongs pa las gyur pa
analyzed: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i bdag nyid yin pas de'i phyir nyes pa mang ba'i phyir te 'di ltar gzhi las nyes pa gang la la 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad ni nyon mongs pa las gyur pa
translated: Thus, all faults that arise from a basis are

original: yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: seen to be due to the afflictions.

original: nyes pa de dag ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyes pa de dag ni 'di lta ste /
translated: These faults are as follows:

original: phung po la mkhas pa'i skabs su mi dge ba'i nyes dmigs yongs su brtag pa sngar bstan pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa'i skabs su mi dge ba'i nyes dmigs yongs su brtag pa sngar bstan pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be seen as the disadvantages of nonvirtue that were previously explained in the chapter on the aggregates.

original: gzhan yang bzlog par nus pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bzlog par nus pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Moreover, they can be overcome.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa ni gzhi las bzlog par nus kyi gzhi ni thams cad kyi thams cad du mi nus pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa ni gzhi las bzlog par nus kyi gzhi ni thams cad kyi thams cad du mi nus pa kho na yin no //
translated: Thus, the afflictions can be overcome by a basis, but a basis can never be overcome.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mi sdug pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas dngos po sun phyung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mi sdug pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas dngos po sun phyung ste /
translated: Moreover, the mundane path cultivates the meditation of foulness, etc., and thereby rejects things.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa la 'jug tu zin kyang 'di lta ste nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par ma grol ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pas de'i phyir rnam grangs des kyang nyon mongs pa
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa la 'jug tu zin kyang 'di lta ste nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par ma grol ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pas de'i phyir rnam grangs des kyang nyon mongs pa
translated: Although one has already entered the stage of freedom from attachment, one is still not completely free from the mental afflictions, and so one is still connected to the mental afflictions of the stage of freedom from attachment.

original: dang bral ba nyid kyis sems shin tu rnam par grol ba yin gyi gzhi'i 'dod chags dang bral bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dang bral ba nyid kyis sems shin tu rnam par grol ba yin gyi gzhi'i 'dod chags dang bral bas ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, by this explanation, the mind is completely liberated by freedom from the mental afflictions, not by freedom from the attachment of the stage.

original: skabs 'di'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo //
analyzed: skabs 'di'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo //
translated: The remainder of the text of this chapter does not appear in the root text.

original: ci'i phyir mdo sde dag las ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga'i ra 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon par zhen pa dang / bag la nyal rnams de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dag las logs shig tu bkar te kun nas nyon mongs pa'i @122a * //🔽phyogs su yongs su bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdo sde dag las ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga'i ra 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon par zhen pa dang / bag la nyal rnams de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dag las logs shig tu bkar te kun nas nyon mongs pa'i @122a * //🔽phyogs su yongs su bstan ce na /
translated: Why are the grasping at “I,” the grasping at “mine,” the pride of “I am,” the clinging, and the proclivities taught separately from the other mental afflictions in the sūtras as a category of mental afflictions?

original: smras pa rgyu gsum gyis te ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga'i ra 'dzin pa gnyis ni log par bsgrub pa la mngon par phyogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa rgyu gsum gyis te ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga'i ra 'dzin pa gnyis ni log par bsgrub pa la mngon par phyogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of three causes: because both the apprehension of “I” and the apprehension of “mine” are directed toward the wrong practice.

original: 'di ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten te /
translated: Thus, in dependence on the view of the transitory collection,

original: de'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis la kun tu dmigs na thar pa 'dod kyang thar pa log par bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis la kun tu dmigs na thar pa 'dod kyang thar pa log par bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: if one observes the sixty-two views that arise from its root, then even if one desires liberation, one will practice liberation wrongly.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang mngon par zhen pa gnyis ni yang dag par sgrub pa la mi phyogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang mngon par zhen pa gnyis ni yang dag par sgrub pa la mi phyogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because both the pride that thinks “I” and the manifest clinging to “mine” are not directed toward the right practice.

original: 'di ltar nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang mngon par zhen pa gnyis la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang mngon par zhen pa gnyis la brten nas /
translated: Thus, in dependence on the pride that thinks “I” and manifest clinging to “mine,”

original: chos 'dul ba 'di la dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi drung du mi 'gro zhing dge ba gang yin mi dge ba gang yin zhes yongs su zhu bar mi byed yongs su 'dri bar mi byed la /
analyzed: chos 'dul ba 'di la dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi drung du mi 'gro zhing dge ba gang yin mi dge ba gang yin zhes yongs su zhu bar mi byed yongs su 'dri bar mi byed la /
translated: In this Dharma and Vinaya, they do not approach spiritual benefactors who are buddhas, disciples of the Buddha, or holy beings, and they do not ask, “What is virtuous? What is nonvirtuous?”

original: de dag 'ongs te dris na'ang bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du smra bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'ongs te dris na'ang bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du smra bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And even if they do come and ask, they do not speak to them in accordance with the truth.

original: bag la nyal gcig tu ni khyad par thob pa las ltung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bag la nyal gcig tu ni khyad par thob pa las ltung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: One latent affliction is a downfall from attaining distinction,

original: 'di ltar srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du thob kyang sa 'og ma pa'i bag la nyal dang ldan na yang phyir ltung zhing phyir ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du thob kyang sa 'og ma pa'i bag la nyal dang ldan na yang phyir ltung zhing phyir ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though one attains up to the peak of existence, one still possesses the latent afflictions of lower stages and so one falls back and returns to lower stages.🔽There is another way of explaining the two obstructions:

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang shes bya rab tu rtogs par bya ba dang spong ba mngon du bya ba la gegs su gyur pa'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang shes bya rab tu rtogs par bya ba dang spong ba mngon du bya ba la gegs su gyur pa'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: The two obstructions are phenomena that obstruct the realization of objects of knowledge and the manifestation of abandonment.

original: log par bsgrub pa'i rgyu dang sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: log par bsgrub pa'i rgyu dang sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of false practice and the cause of the origination of suffering.

original: de la log par bsgrub pa'i rgyu ni lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis po dag ste /🔽de dag la mngon par zhen na sems can rnams la /
analyzed: de la log par bsgrub pa'i rgyu ni lta ba'i rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis po dag ste / de dag la mngon par zhen na sems can rnams la /
translated: The cause of false practice is the sixty-two views.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis log par sgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis log par sgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When one adheres to them, sentient beings practice falsely with body, speech, and mind.

original: sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu ni bag la nyal ba ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu ni bag la nyal ba ma spangs pa'o //
translated: The cause of the origination of suffering is the non-eradication of the latent proclivities.

original: chos de gnyis kyi rgyu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos de gnyis kyi rgyu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The cause of these two dharmas is also twofold.

original: log par bsgrub pa'i chos kyi rgyu'i rgyu ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga'i ra 'dzin pa'i rnam pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: log par bsgrub pa'i chos kyi rgyu'i rgyu ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga'i ra 'dzin pa'i rnam pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The cause of the cause of the dharma of false practice is the false view of the perishable constituents, which has the aspects of the grasping of the self and the grasping of “mine”.

original: sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu'i rgyu ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis dang po dang tha ma gnyis su mi bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu'i rgyu ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis dang po dang tha ma gnyis su mi bsgrub pa ste /
translated: The cause of the cause of the origination of suffering is the pride of thinking “I am”, which does not practice the first and last.

original: de la dang por ni mi nyan pa dang yang dag par mi bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dang por ni mi nyan pa dang yang dag par mi bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the first, one does not listen and does not practice correctly.

original: tha mar ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mar ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and finally, they are the source of manifest pride.🔽There are four other categories of qualities:

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la /
translated: the Dharma-Vinaya is well-spoken,🔽supreme, principal, excellent, sublime, and not shared in common with others.

original: mchog dang / gtso bo dang / rab dang / rab mchog @122b dang ; gya nom pa dang / 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i chos bzhi yod de bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: mchog dang / gtso bo dang / rab dang / rab mchog @122b dang ; gya nom pa dang / 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i chos bzhi yod de bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are these four?

original: bden pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / rang gi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag la yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'i chos rnams dang / phas kyi rgol ba dag la zhe sdang med pa dang / dag pa rnams las phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / rang gi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag la yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'i chos rnams dang / phas kyi rgol ba dag la zhe sdang med pa dang / dag pa rnams las phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: They are the discernment of the truths, the Dharma that delights one’s fellow practitioners of virtue, the absence of hostility toward opponents, and the absence of regression among the pure.

original: nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la ni de dag dang mi mthun pa'i chos bzhi yod de /
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la ni de dag dang mi mthun pa'i chos bzhi yod de /
translated: The Dharma-Vinaya that is poorly spoken has four qualities that are the opposite of these.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga'i ra 'dzin pa rnams 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen cing mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / bag la nyal ma spangs pa ste /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga'i ra 'dzin pa rnams 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen cing mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / bag la nyal ma spangs pa ste /
translated: The pride that thinks “I am” and the manifest clinging that thinks “this is true” are the grasping at the belief in a self.

original: des na srid pa'i rtse mor skyes kyang yang phyir ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na srid pa'i rtse mor skyes kyang yang phyir ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even if one is born at the peak of existence, one will return again.

original: gzhan yang mngon par zhen pa ni gnyis yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon par zhen pa ni gnyis yod de /
translated: Moreover, there are two kinds of manifest clinging:

original: dbang po dang yul la mngon par zhen pa dang / sems can gcig la gcig mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul la mngon par zhen pa dang / sems can gcig la gcig mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: the manifest clinging to the faculties and objects and the manifest clinging of one sentient being to another.

original: de la dbang po dang yul la mngon par zhen pa ni ngar 'dzin pa dang nga'i ra 'dzin pa gnyis kyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po dang yul la mngon par zhen pa ni ngar 'dzin pa dang nga'i ra 'dzin pa gnyis kyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: The manifest clinging to the faculties and objects should be understood in terms of the grasping of “I” and the grasping of “mine.”

original: sems can gcig la gcig mngon par zhen pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gcig la gcig mngon par zhen pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis blta bar bya ste /
translated: The manifest clinging of one sentient being to another should be understood in terms of the pride that thinks “I am.”

original: bdag ni che'o snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa de dag gis so //
analyzed: bdag ni che'o snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa de dag gis so //
translated: This is because of the aspects of thinking “I am great” and so on.

original: sred pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bdun pa 'ang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du yongs su bstan ce na /
analyzed: sred pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bdun pa 'ang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du yongs su bstan ce na /
translated: If craving is the cause of suffering, why did the Lord teach that the seventh link is also the cause of suffering?

original: smras pa / tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: He said: Because it is the cause of suffering in this life.

original: 'di ltar sems can gang dag la 'dun pa'am 'dod chags pa'am byams par gyur pa de dag rnam par gyur tam gzhan du gyur pa las mya ngan la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can gang dag la 'dun pa'am 'dod chags pa'am byams par gyur pa de dag rnam par gyur tam gzhan du gyur pa las mya ngan la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, when those sentient beings who have a desire, attachment, or love for something undergo a change or transformation, grief, etc., arise.

original: ci'i phyir sgrib pa lnga po dag rus sbal gyi sgrar gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgrib pa lnga po dag rus sbal gyi sgrar gsungs she na /
translated: Why are the five hindrances called the “tortoise” ?

original: smras pa / rnal 'byor yid la byed pa sgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yan lag lnga yod par chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rnal 'byor yid la byed pa sgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yan lag lnga yod par chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He said: Because they are the five limbs that are adverse to the cultivation of the yoga of mental attention, due to their similarity to a tortoise.

original: ci'i phyir khro ba sdig pa'i sgrar gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khro ba sdig pa'i sgrar gsungs she na /
translated: Why is anger called the “sin” ?

original: smras pa ; bka' blo mi bde ba dang tshig mi bzod pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa thob pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi de dang rang bzhin 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa ; bka' blo mi bde ba dang tshig mi bzod pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa thob pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi de dang rang bzhin 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He said: “It is because of the nature of the discouragement of the word of the Buddha and the intolerance of the word.

original: ci'i phyir phrag dog dang ser sna sha sna dgu'i sgrar gsungs she na /🔽smras pa / yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur @123a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir phrag dog dang ser sna sha sna dgu'i sgrar gsungs she na / smras pa / yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur @123a * //
translated: Why are envy and avarice called the two ‘legs’?

original: ba'i chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i gnas pa kun tu spyod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i chos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i gnas pa kun tu spyod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He said: “Because of the nature of the two legs of the attitude of desire for gain and honor which is the opposite of the Dharma that leads to true joy.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod pa rnams gtsod sha'i sgrar gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod pa rnams gtsod sha'i sgrar gsungs she na /
translated: Why are the sense desires called the ‘snare’?

original: smras pa / dge ba'i chos rnams rtag tu bsgoms bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bdag po dang 'brel par yongs su grub pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / dge ba'i chos rnams rtag tu bsgoms bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bdag po dang 'brel par yongs su grub pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He said: “Because of the nature of the snare of the sense desires which binds one to the master of the opposite of the wholesome dharmas.

original: ci'i phyir ma rig pa spre'u mjug rings kyi sgrar gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma rig pa spre'u mjug rings kyi sgrar gsungs she na /
translated: Why is ignorance called the ‘long tail’?🔽He said: “Because of the nature of the long tail of ignorance which is not the accomplishment of the opposite of the wholesome dharmas through constant cultivation.

original: smras pa / thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis de dang rang bzhin 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis de dang rang bzhin 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is said: Because the opposite of the knowledge that arises from hearing is similar in nature to that.

original: ci'i phyir som nyi lam kha brag gi sgrar gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir som nyi lam kha brag gi sgrar gsungs she na /
translated: Why is doubt said to be like a fork in the road?

original: smras pa / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis de dang rang bzhin 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis de dang rang bzhin 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is said: Because the opposite of the knowledge that arises from contemplation is similar in nature to that.

original: ci'i phyir nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal khor yug gi sgrar gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal khor yug gi sgrar gsungs she na /
translated: Why is the pride that thinks “I am” said to be like a whirlpool?

original: smras pa / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis de dang rang bzhin 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro /
analyzed: smras pa / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis de dang rang bzhin 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro /
translated: It is said: Because the opposite of the knowledge that arises from meditation is similar in nature to that.

original: ci'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong par byed pa dag kyang yod bzhin du chags pa dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug kho na logs shig tu bkar te mi dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na /🔽smras pa / mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong par byed pa dag kyang yod bzhin du chags pa dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug kho na logs shig tu bkar te mi dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na / smras pa / mdor bsdu na /
translated: Why are attachment, aversion, and delusion alone posited as roots of nonvirtue, when there are other afflictions that motivate the performance of misdeeds?

original: las kyi rgyu rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: las kyi rgyu rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: In brief, because there are three types of causes of action:

original: zang zing gi rgyu'i phyir dang / gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir dang / log pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zang zing gi rgyu'i phyir dang / gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir dang / log pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: the cause of materiality, the cause of harming others, and the cause of adhering to the presentation of wrong Dharma.

original: rgyu de dag la chags pa la sogs pa de dag gang gis zhen pa ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu de dag la chags pa la sogs pa de dag gang gis zhen pa ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: Attachment and so on are applied to those causes in whatever way is appropriate.

original: bar sdom ni /
analyzed: bar sdom ni /
translated: The intermediate summary is:

original: 'dod dang sred dang 'dod chags bral //
analyzed: 'dod dang sred dang 'dod chags bral //
translated: Desire, craving, and freedom from attachment,

original: ngar 'dzin la sogs de bzhin te //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin la sogs de bzhin te //
translated: ego, and so on,🔽aspiration, tortoise, and so on,

original: 'dun dang rus sbal la sogs dang // de bzhin chags sogs gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'dun dang rus sbal la sogs dang // de bzhin chags sogs gzhan yin no //
translated: and likewise attachment and so on.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bcu po gang dag yin pa de dag las du ni las kun nas slong bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bcu po gang dag yin pa de dag las du ni las kun nas slong bar byed pa yin /
translated: From among the ten afflictions such as attachment, how many motivate karma?

original: du ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: How many do not?

original: smras pa / thams cad kyang las kun nas slong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad kyang las kun nas slong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: All of them motivate karma.

original: ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las ni zil gyis gnon pa kun tu spyod pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas slong bar byed de /
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las ni zil gyis gnon pa kun tu spyod pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas slong bar byed de /
translated: Karma that leads to miserable realms is motivated by the affliction that is the universal engagement of subjugation.

original: brjed ngas pa kun tu spyod pas kyang ma yin kun brtags pa dang / rang bzhin pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa kun tu spyod pas kyang ma yin kun brtags pa dang / rang bzhin pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not motivated by the affliction that is the universal engagement of forgetfulness, nor by the affliction that is the universal engagement of imagination, nor by the affliction that is the universal engagement of nature.

original: @123b nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dus brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: @123b nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dus brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of affliction?

original: smras pa / mdor bsdu na mtshan nyid gsum gyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / mdor bsdu na mtshan nyid gsum gyis te /
translated: In brief, there are three definitions:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: the definition of its own characteristics, the definition of its general characteristics, and the definition of its specific characteristics.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i so so'i ngo bo nyid du gtogs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i so so'i ngo bo nyid du gtogs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The specific characteristic should be seen as the individual nature of each, such as attachment.

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni bye brag med par thams cad kyang rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni bye brag med par thams cad kyang rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The general characteristic is that which is the characteristic of all without distinction, namely, that they are not peaceful.

original: de la bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The particular characteristic is as follows:

original: rnam grangs kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid dang / 'jug pa'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid dang / 'jug pa'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The particular characteristic of enumeration, and the particular characteristic of engagement.

original: de la rnam grangs kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang bag la nyal dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun nas dkris pa la sogs pa ste sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de la rnam grangs kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang bag la nyal dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun nas dkris pa la sogs pa ste sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The particular characteristic of enumeration is as follows: fetters, bonds, latent tendencies, secondary afflictions, entanglements, and so on, as taught in the Abhidharma.

original: de la 'jug pa'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The particular characteristic of engagement is as follows:

original: bag la nyal gyi 'jug pa dang / dmigs pa'i 'jug pa dang kun tu 'byung ba'i 'jug pa dang / rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa dang / stobs dang ldan pa dang stobs dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'jug pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: bag la nyal gyi 'jug pa dang / dmigs pa'i 'jug pa dang kun tu 'byung ba'i 'jug pa dang / rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa dang / stobs dang ldan pa dang stobs dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'jug pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'jug pa dang /
translated: the engagement of latent propensities, the engagement of the object, the engagement of origination, the engagement of differentiation, the engagement of strength and weakness, the engagement of cause and effect,

original: log par bsgrub pa'i 'jug pa las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: log par bsgrub pa'i 'jug pa las blta bar bya'o //
translated: and the engagement of wrong practice.

original: de la bag la nyal gyi 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bco brgyad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bag la nyal gyi 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bco brgyad du rig par bya ste /
translated: The characteristic of the engagement of latent propensities should be understood in brief as having eighteen aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rang gi yul gyi rjes su song ba'i bag la nyal dang / gzhan gyi rjes su song ba dang / nyams pa dang ma nyams pa dang / bag la nyal dang / bag la nyal ma yin pa dang / mtha' dag dang / ma tshang ba dang /
analyzed: rang gi yul gyi rjes su song ba'i bag la nyal dang / gzhan gyi rjes su song ba dang / nyams pa dang ma nyams pa dang / bag la nyal dang / bag la nyal ma yin pa dang / mtha' dag dang / ma tshang ba dang /
translated: the latent propensities that follow one’s own object, those that follow others, those that are lost and those that are not lost, those that are latent propensities and those that are not latent propensities, those that are complete and those that are incomplete,

original: yang dag par gzhom du rung ba dang / yang dag par gzhom du mi rung ba dang / lhag pa dang / mnyam pa dang / stobs chung ba dang / sad pa dang / ma sad pa dang / sdug bsngal mang po bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par gzhom du rung ba dang / yang dag par gzhom du mi rung ba dang / lhag pa dang / mnyam pa dang / stobs chung ba dang / sad pa dang / ma sad pa dang / sdug bsngal mang po bskyed pa dang /
translated: those that are suitable to be completely vanquished, those that are not suitable to be completely vanquished, those that are superior, those that are equal, those that are weak, those that are awakened, those that are not awakened, those that generate much suffering,🔽

original: sdug bsngal nyung du bskyed pa dang / sdug bsngal mi bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyung du bskyed pa dang / sdug bsngal mi bskyed pa'o //
translated: to be completely overcome, not to be completely overcome, to be superior, to be equal, to be weak, to be strong, to be awakened, to be unawakened, to produce much suffering, to produce little suffering, and to not produce suffering.

original: de la rang gi yul gyi rjes su song ba ni khams gsum po dag na rang gis par gtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi yul gyi rjes su song ba ni khams gsum po dag na rang gis par gtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: To be in accord with one’s own realm means to be in accord with the three realms, which are one’s own.

original: de la gzhan gyi yul gyi rjes su song ba ni 'og ma dang gong mar skyed pa'i 'og ma'am gong ma'i sa ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi yul gyi rjes su song ba ni 'og ma dang gong mar skyed pa'i 'og ma'am gong ma'i sa ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: To be in accord with another’s realm means to possess the seeds of the afflictions of the lower or higher stages, which are produced in the lower or higher stages.

original: de la nyams pa ni 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa 'og @124a * //🔽ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyams pa ni 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa 'og @124a * //🔽ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: To be diminished means to be in the stage of being free from the desire of the lower realm.🔽To be increased means to be in the stage of not being free from the desire of the lower realm.

original: de la ma nyams pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dog ma'am 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i rang gi sa pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma nyams pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dog ma'am 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i rang gi sa pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which is not destroyed is that which is in one's own stage, whether one is detached or not detached.

original: de la bag la nyal ba ni rang gi sa pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bag la nyal ba ni rang gi sa pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which is a latent tendency is that which is in one's own stage.

original: de la bag la nyal ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi sa pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bag la nyal ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi sa pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which is not a latent tendency is that which is in another's stage.

original: de la mtha' dag ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: de la mtha' dag ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi gang yin pa'o ;
translated: Among them, that which is complete is that of ordinary beings.

original: / de la ma tshang ba ni so so'i skye bo ma yin pa slob pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: / de la ma tshang ba ni so so'i skye bo ma yin pa slob pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which is incomplete is that of learners who are not ordinary beings.

original: de la yang dag par gzhom du rung ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag par gzhom du rung ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which is completely destroyed is that of those who have the quality of attaining complete nirvana.

original: de la yang dag par gzhom du mi rung ba ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag par gzhom du mi rung ba ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which is not completely destroyed is that of those who have the quality of not attaining complete nirvana.

original: de la lhag ma ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la lhag ma ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which remains is that of those who engage in attachment and so on.

original: de la mnyam pa ni cha mnyam par spyod pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mnyam pa ni cha mnyam par spyod pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
translated: The equal is that of those who practice equally.

original: de la stobs chung ba ni nyon mongs pa chud pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la stobs chung ba ni nyon mongs pa chud pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
translated: The weak is that of those who are overwhelmed by the defilements.

original: de la sad pa ni kun nas dkris pa'i 'bras bu can te kun nas dkris pa can du 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sad pa ni kun nas dkris pa'i 'bras bu can te kun nas dkris pa can du 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The manifest is that which has the result of the envelopment and arises with the envelopment.

original: de la ma sad pa ni kun nas dkris pa med par rjes su 'brel pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma sad pa ni kun nas dkris pa med par rjes su 'brel pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The unmanifest is that which is related without the envelopment.

original: de la sdug bsngal mang po bskyed pa ni 'dod pa na skyod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal mang po bskyed pa ni 'dod pa na skyod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one that produces much suffering is that which is in the realm of desire.

original: de la sdug bsngal nyung du bskyed pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal nyung du bskyed pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one that produces little suffering is that which is in the realms of form and of the formless.

original: de la sdug bsngal mi skyed pa ni dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal mi skyed pa ni dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one that does not produce suffering is that of the bodhisattvas who have attained mastery.

original: gnas ngan len gyi lus dang gnas ngan len gyi bdag nyid kyi bag la nyal zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi lus dang gnas ngan len gyi bdag nyid kyi bag la nyal zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
translated: The body of negative reflex actions and the latent impressions of the nature of negative reflex actions.

original: ci nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len de 'du byed de dag las gzhan du brjod par bya ba'am /
analyzed: ci nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len de 'du byed de dag las gzhan du brjod par bya ba'am /
translated: Should the negative reflex action that is in conformity with the side of the defilements be described as other than those formative forces,

original: gzhan ma yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: or should it not be described as other?

original: smras pa / gzhan du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan du brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be described as other.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len yang dag par bcom pa'i dgra bcom pa rnams kyi 'du byed kyi rgyun rnam par ma chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len yang dag par bcom pa'i dgra bcom pa rnams kyi 'du byed kyi rgyun rnam par ma chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the stream of formative forces of the Arhats who have destroyed the negative reflex action that is in conformity with the side of the defilements is not interrupted.

original: gnas ngan len du zhig gi gnas ngan len bsdus she na /
analyzed: gnas ngan len du zhig gi gnas ngan len bsdus she na /
translated: How many negative reflex actions are included in this?

original: smras pa / rnam pa bco brgyad kyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa bco brgyad kyis te /
translated: It is said that there are eighteen kinds:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par smin pa'i gnas ngan len dang rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len dang / rang bzhin gyis las kyi gnas ngan @124b len dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / las kyi sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par smin pa'i gnas ngan len dang rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len dang / rang bzhin gyis las kyi gnas ngan @124b len dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / las kyi sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang /
translated: the natural negative tendencies of karmic ripening, the natural negative tendencies of afflictions, the natural negative tendencies of karma, the negative tendencies of the obscurations of afflictions, the negative tendencies of the obscurations of karma,

original: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / legs par rtogs pa ma yin pa'i gnas ngan len dang / mya ngan gyi gnas ngan len dang / 'jigs pa'i gnas ngan len dang / ngal ba'i gnas ngan len dang /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / legs par rtogs pa ma yin pa'i gnas ngan len dang / mya ngan gyi gnas ngan len dang / 'jigs pa'i gnas ngan len dang / ngal ba'i gnas ngan len dang /
translated: the negative tendencies of the obscurations of ripening, the negative tendencies of the obscurations, the negative tendencies of not being well understood, the negative tendencies of sorrow, the negative tendencies of fear, the negative tendencies of weariness,

original: zas kyi gnas ngan len dang / gnyid kyi gnas ngan len dang / 'khrig pa'i gnas ngan len dang / khams ma snyoms pa'i gnas ngan len dang / na tshod 'gyur ba'i gnas ngan len dang / 'chi pa'i gnas ngan len dang / gzhan yang thams cad du 'gro ba'i gnas ngan len te de ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zas kyi gnas ngan len dang / gnyid kyi gnas ngan len dang / 'khrig pa'i gnas ngan len dang / khams ma snyoms pa'i gnas ngan len dang / na tshod 'gyur ba'i gnas ngan len dang / 'chi pa'i gnas ngan len dang / gzhan yang thams cad du 'gro ba'i gnas ngan len te de ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: the negative reflex of food, the negative reflex of sleep, the negative reflex of sex, the negative reflex of the humors, the negative reflex of age, the negative reflex of death, and the negative reflex of all the rest.

original: de la dmigs pa'i 'jug pa dang / kun tu 'byung ba'i 'jug pa ni rang gi gnas su brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i 'jug pa dang / kun tu 'byung ba'i 'jug pa ni rang gi gnas su brjod par bya'o //
translated: The engagement of the object is to be understood as the engagement of the basis.

original: rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The engagement of the differentiation is as follows:

original: phung po la mkhas pa'i skabs su sngar bstan pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa'i skabs su sngar bstan pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is to be understood as it was previously taught in the chapter on the aggregates.

original: stobs dang ldan pa dang / stobs dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'jug pa yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa dang / stobs dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'jug pa yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The engagement of the powerful and the non-powerful is as follows:

original: sa'i dngos gzhir sngar bstan pa kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir sngar bstan pa kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is to be understood as it was previously taught in the chapter on the stages.

original: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The process of cause and effect is as follows:

original: nyon mongs pa yang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin la /
translated: The defilements arise from the cause of the defilements.

original: las kyang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin /
analyzed: las kyang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin /
translated: Actions arise from the cause of the defilements.

original: skye ba yang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba yang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: Birth arises from the cause of the defilements.

original: 'bras bu'ang de bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang de bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The effect should be understood in the same way, according to the case.

original: de la nyon mongs pa gang dag yin pa de dag las /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa gang dag yin pa de dag las /
translated: Among the defilements,

original: kha cig mi dge ba 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig mi dge ba 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: some unwholesome actions in the realm of desire have a ripening.

original: de las gzhan pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa med pa yin no //
translated: Others do not have a ripening.

original: de la log par bsgrub pa'i 'jug pa ni sa'i dngos gzhir mdor bstan pa las rnam pa bdun bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de la log par bsgrub pa'i 'jug pa ni sa'i dngos gzhir mdor bstan pa las rnam pa bdun bshad pa ste /
translated: The process of wrong practice is explained in the Abhidharma as sevenfold, as stated in the Abhidharma.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is its classification?

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang log par lta ba ni shes bya'i log par rtog pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag la log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang log par lta ba ni shes bya'i log par rtog pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag la log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The afflicted view of the self, the view of holding to an extreme, and false view are wrong engagements with the four noble truths through wrong conception of knowable objects.

original: ma rig pa ni de ma rtogs pa las so //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni de ma rtogs pa las so //
translated: Ignorance is due to non-realization of those.

original: the tshom ni de rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa las so //🔽lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul @125a * //🔽zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa lta ba la dmigs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang log par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pas /
analyzed: the tshom ni de rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa las so // lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul @125a * // zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa lta ba la dmigs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang log par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pas /
translated: Doubt is due to both realization and non-realization of those.

original: log par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: log par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: All those that are objects of the view, such as attachment and so on, that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing are also wrong engagements due to manifest adherence to wrong conception.

original: de dag thams cad kyang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la ni de'i rgyu'i gzhi'i gnas las log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la ni de'i rgyu'i gzhi'i gnas las log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: All of them are wrong engagements with the truth of suffering and the truth of origin because they are the basis of the cause of that.

original: de dag thams cad kyang 'gog pa'i bden pa dang lam gyi bden pa la ni des skrag par kun tu skye ba las log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang 'gog pa'i bden pa dang lam gyi bden pa la ni des skrag par kun tu skye ba las log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: All of them are misapprehensions of the truth of cessation and the truth of the path, because they are afraid of them.

original: de dag thams cad las rang bzhin gang dag yin pa de dag ni bsgom pa'i lam la rang bzhin du kun tu spyod pa las log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad las rang bzhin gang dag yin pa de dag ni bsgom pa'i lam la rang bzhin du kun tu spyod pa las log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: All of them are misapprehensions of the nature of things, because they are misapprehensions of the practice of the nature of things on the path of meditation.

original: de la sngar 'dul ba'i dbang du nyon mongs pa rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po shin tu rags pa bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sngar 'dul ba'i dbang du nyon mongs pa rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po shin tu rags pa bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In the past, the adverse factors and antidotes of the afflictions were taught in a very coarse way for the sake of those to be trained.

original: gdul ba rnams nyon mongs pa dag la log par bsgrub pa sna tshogs kyi nyes pa khong du chud pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi log par bsgrub pa rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gdul ba rnams nyon mongs pa dag la log par bsgrub pa sna tshogs kyi nyes pa khong du chud pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi log par bsgrub pa rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: The presentation of the misapprehensions of the afflictions was taught in order to generate understanding of the faults of the various wrong practices of those to be trained with regard to the afflictions.

original: 'dir ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi log par bsgrub pa rnam par gzhag pa shin tu cha phra ba'i rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dbye bas yongs su bstan to//
analyzed: 'dir ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi log par bsgrub pa rnam par gzhag pa shin tu cha phra ba'i rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dbye bas yongs su bstan to//
translated: Here, the incorrect practices of the afflictions are taught in terms of their divisions, which are very subtle aspects.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag las du ni gzhi dang bcas pa yin la du ni gzhi med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag las du ni gzhi dang bcas pa yin la du ni gzhi med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many of these afflictions are based on a real entity and how many are not based on a real entity?

original: smras pa / lta ba rnams dang nga rgyal ni gzhi med pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / lta ba rnams dang nga rgyal ni gzhi med pa yin te /
translated: It is said that the views and pride are not based on a real entity.

original: de dag ni 'du byed rnams la bdag med bzhin du yongs su brtags nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni 'du byed rnams la bdag med bzhin du yongs su brtags nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they engage their objects by superimposing a nature on formations that is contrary to their nature, such as the nonexistence of a self.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba ni gzhi dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba ni gzhi dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Attachment and aversion are based on a real entity.

original: ma rig pa dang the tshom ni gnyi gar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang the tshom ni gnyi gar rig par bya'o //
translated: Ignorance and doubt should be understood as both.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag las du ni bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin la du ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'i bar dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag las du ni bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin la du ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'i bar dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many of these afflictions are associated with the faculty of pleasure and how many are associated with the faculty of equanimity?

original: smras pa / gang dag rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa yin pa de dag thams cad ni tshor ba gsum po dag la gang gi phyir dmigs shing kun tu spyod par byed pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs thams cad dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni🔽dbang po thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / gang dag rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa yin pa de dag thams cad ni tshor ba gsum po dag la gang gi phyir dmigs shing kun tu spyod par byed pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs thams cad dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni dbang po thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: Those that are concomitant with all the aggregates of consciousness are concomitant with all the faculties.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs thams cad dang mi ldan @125b pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni yid las byung ba'i dbang po thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs thams cad dang mi ldan @125b pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni yid las byung ba'i dbang po thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: Those that are not concomitant with all the aggregates of consciousness are concomitant with all the mental faculties.

original: rang bzhin pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi mtshungs par ldan pa ni ci rigs par brjod par bya ste /🔽'dod chags ni lan 'ga' bde ba dang yid bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan par byed la /
analyzed: rang bzhin pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi mtshungs par ldan pa ni ci rigs par brjod par bya ste / 'dod chags ni lan 'ga' bde ba dang yid bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan par byed la /
translated: Those that are natural are concomitant in whatever way is appropriate.🔽Attachment is sometimes concomitant with pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: lan 'ga' ni sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dag dang ngo //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dag dang ngo //
translated: Sometimes it is concomitant with pain and mental dissatisfaction.

original: lan 'ga' ni btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
translated: Sometimes it is associated with equanimity.

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na la la bde ba'i tshor ba dang phrad par sred pa'am mi 'bral par sred pa mngon du byas shing gnas te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na la la bde ba'i tshor ba dang phrad par sred pa'am mi 'bral par sred pa mngon du byas shing gnas te /
translated: It is said: In this world, someone experiences the craving for contact with pleasant feeling or the craving for non-separation from it.

original: de ltar gyur pa de bde ba'i tshor ba dang ma phrad cing phrad par ma gyur la bral zhing ldan par ma gyur pa dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mi phrad par sred pa dang bral bar sred pa mngon du byas shing gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de bde ba'i tshor ba dang ma phrad cing phrad par ma gyur la bral zhing ldan par ma gyur pa dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mi phrad par sred pa dang bral bar sred pa mngon du byas shing gnas te /
translated: When that person does not experience contact with pleasant feeling, does not experience contact with it, does not experience separation from it, and experiences the craving for non-contact with painful feeling, the craving for separation from it,

original: de ltar gyur pa de sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang phrad cing ma phrad par ma gyur la ;
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang phrad cing ma phrad par ma gyur la ;
translated: when that person does not experience contact with painful feeling, does not experience contact with it,

original: ma bral zhing bral bar ma gyur pa de lta na 'dod chags ni lan 'ga' sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ma bral zhing bral bar ma gyur pa de lta na 'dod chags ni lan 'ga' sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan par byed pa yin no //
translated: does not experience separation from it, then attachment is sometimes associated with pain and mental dissatisfaction.

original: de las bzlog pa las ni bde ba dang yid bde ba de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa las ni bde ba dang yid bde ba de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as being associated with pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: 'dod chags sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs la ro myang ba las ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs la ro myang ba las ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that craving is associated with the faculty of equanimity in the state of neither pleasure nor pain.

original: khong khro ba ni lan 'ga' sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan par byed pa la lan 'ga' ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
analyzed: khong khro ba ni lan 'ga' sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan par byed pa la lan 'ga' ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
translated: Anger is sometimes associated with pain and mental dissatisfaction, and sometimes it is associated with pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na kha cig bdag nyid kyi lus la sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa'am sems la gnod pa'i zhe 'gras pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur nas bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs de nyid yid la byed dam /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na kha cig bdag nyid kyi lus la sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa'am sems la gnod pa'i zhe 'gras pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur nas bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs de nyid yid la byed dam /
translated: It is said: In this way, when someone has a hostile mind, either with regard to bodily pain or mental distress, he thinks about that state of his own pain.

original: 'du byed mi 'dod pa dag gam sems can mi 'dod pa dag gam chos mi 'dod pa dag la zhe 'gras pa dang ldan pa'i sems yid la byed pa de lta na /
analyzed: 'du byed mi 'dod pa dag gam sems can mi 'dod pa dag gam chos mi 'dod pa dag la zhe 'gras pa dang ldan pa'i sems yid la byed pa de lta na /
translated: When one attends to the mental activity of aversion toward unlikable compositional factors, unlikable sentient beings, or unlikable phenomena,

original: khong khro ba sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khong khro ba sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan par byed pa yin no //
translated: then anger is concomitant with suffering and mental dissatisfaction.

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha @126a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha @126a * //
translated: In this way,

original: cig dgrar gyur pa'i sems can mi 'dod pa rnams la zhe 'gras pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'am gyur pa yid la byed pa dang bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang rgud pa yid la byed pa de ltar na khong khro ba bde ba
analyzed: cig dgrar gyur pa'i sems can mi 'dod pa rnams la zhe 'gras pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'am gyur pa yid la byed pa dang bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang rgud pa yid la byed pa de ltar na khong khro ba bde ba
translated: when one attends to the mental activity of aversion toward unlikable sentient beings who are one’s enemies, and one thinks about their suffering or one thinks about their misfortune, which is not pleasant, then anger is concomitant with pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: dang yid bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dang yid bde ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan par byed pa yin no //
translated: In this way, anger is concomitant with pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni bde ba dang ldan pa'i phung po rnams la /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni bde ba dang ldan pa'i phung po rnams la /
translated: In this regard, the afflicted view of the self and the view grasping an extreme are concomitant with pleasure when one focuses on the pleasant aggregates.

original: bdag gam bdag gi dang rtag par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba las ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
analyzed: bdag gam bdag gi dang rtag par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba las ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
translated: When one sees the self or what belongs to the self as permanent in the aggregates associated with pleasure, then one becomes associated with the faculty of mental pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang ldan pa'i phung po rnams la bdag gam bdag gi dang rtag par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba las ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang ldan pa'i phung po rnams la bdag gam bdag gi dang rtag par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba las ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
translated: When one sees the self or what belongs to the self as permanent in the aggregates associated with suffering, then one becomes associated with the faculty of mental dissatisfaction.

original: btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i phung po rnams la bdag gam bdag gi dang rtag par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba las ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i phung po rnams la bdag gam bdag gi dang rtag par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba las ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
translated: When one sees the self or what belongs to the self as permanent in the aggregates associated with equanimity, then one becomes associated with the faculty of equanimity.

original: chad par lta bas bsdus pa'i mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chad par lta bas bsdus pa'i mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The view of annihilation included in the extreme view should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba de dag mchog tu 'dzin pa de bzhin du mtshungs par ldan par ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba de dag mchog tu 'dzin pa de bzhin du mtshungs par ldan par ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The overesteeming of morality and ritual and the overesteeming of views are associated with the view that overestimates them, as is appropriate.

original: log par lta ba ni legs par bya ba byed pa rnams kyi gang yin pa de ni yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba ni legs par bya ba byed pa rnams kyi gang yin pa de ni yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Wrong views are associated with mental dissatisfaction when they are the cause of good conduct.

original: nyes par bya ba byed pa rnams kyi gang yin pa de ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes par bya ba byed pa rnams kyi gang yin pa de ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: They are associated with mental satisfaction when they are the cause of bad conduct.

original: nga rgyal ni lan 'ga' yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par byed la lan 'ga' ni yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni lan 'ga' yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par byed la lan 'ga' ni yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
translated: Pride is sometimes associated with mental satisfaction and sometimes with mental dissatisfaction.

original: de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: smras pa / nga rgyal ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / nga rgyal ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is said: Pride is twofold:

original: khengs pa'i nga rgyal dang / 'dud pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: khengs pa'i nga rgyal dang / 'dud pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: arrogance and conceit.

original: de la khengs pa'i nga rgyal ni khengs pa rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la khengs pa'i nga rgyal ni khengs pa rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: Arrogance of pride is to be known through three types of pride.

original: khengs pa rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: khengs pa rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three types of pride?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: yongs su 'jal bas khengs pa dang / srid pas khengs pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur stis khengs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'jal bas khengs pa dang / srid pas khengs pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur stis khengs pa'o //
translated: pride of self-satisfaction, pride of conceit, and pride of vanity.

original: de la khengs pa'i nga @126b rgyal ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
analyzed: de la khengs pa'i nga @126b rgyal ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
translated: Among them, the arrogance of pride is associated with mental pleasure.

original: 'dod pa'i nga rgyal ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nga rgyal ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The arrogance of desire is the opposite of that.

original: yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
translated: It is associated with mental discomfort.

original: the tshom ni rnyed pa'am bkur sti'am /
analyzed: the tshom ni rnyed pa'am bkur sti'am /
translated: Doubt is associated with mental discomfort when others generate doubt about gain, honor,

original: grags pa'am bstod pa'am bde ba'am /
analyzed: grags pa'am bstod pa'am bde ba'am /
translated: fame, praise, pleasure,🔽or a good rebirth.

original: bde 'gro la nges pa rnams la gzhan dag gis the tshom bskyed pa ni yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
analyzed: bde 'gro la nges pa rnams la gzhan dag gis the tshom bskyed pa ni yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
translated: Doubt is associated with mental pleasure when there is no gain, no honor,🔽no fame, no praise, no pleasure,

original: rnyed pa med pa'am bkur sti med pa'am grags pa med pa'am smad pa'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: rnyed pa med pa'am bkur sti med pa'am grags pa med pa'am smad pa'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: or no good rebirth.

original: ngan 'gro la nges pa rnams la gzhan dag gis the tshom bskyed pa ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
analyzed: ngan 'gro la nges pa rnams la gzhan dag gis the tshom bskyed pa ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
translated: The doubt that is certain to lead to a bad destiny is associated with contentedness.

original: ma rig pa ni lnga char dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni lnga char dang mtshungs par ldan par byed do //
translated: Ignorance is associated with all five.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa nye bar sbyar ba'i dpe lhag ma rnams ni mi snang ngo //🔽de la sngar ni mi 'chol bar bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams dang dbang po'i mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshul che long rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi 'dir ni rang gi dang gzhan gyi rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'jug pa rab tu dbye ba'i phyir tshul
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa nye bar sbyar ba'i dpe lhag ma rnams ni mi snang ngo // de la sngar ni mi 'chol bar bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams dang dbang po'i mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshul che long rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi 'dir ni rang gi dang gzhan gyi rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'jug pa rab tu dbye ba'i phyir tshul
translated: The remaining examples of association are not mentioned here.🔽Here, the method of association of the afflictions with the faculties is presented in a rough way, not in a subtle way.

original: zhib mos rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: zhib mos rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: But here, the method is presented in a subtle way, in order to distinguish the various ways in which they function as one’s own and others’ causes.

original: nyon mongs pa'i ris ni mdor bsdu na gsum po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ris ni mdor bsdu na gsum po 'di dag yin te /
translated: The classes of affliction are, in brief, these three:

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang gzugs dang ldan pa dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang gzugs dang ldan pa dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: those associated with the desire realm, those associated with the form realm, and those associated with the formless realm.

original: nyon mongs pa'i ris gsum po de dag las du ni mi dge ba yin du ni lung ma bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ris gsum po de dag las du ni mi dge ba yin du ni lung ma bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: Among these three types of afflictions, how many are nonvirtuous and how many are neutral?

original: smras pa / de dag las dang po kha cig ni mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / de dag las dang po kha cig ni mi dge ba yin no //
translated: Some of the first type are nonvirtuous.

original: gnyis ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: Two are neutral.

original: mi dge ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yang yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yang yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those that are nonvirtuous should be understood as having karmic maturation.

original: du ni bdag nyid mang po yin la du ni bdag nyid nyung du yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni bdag nyid mang po yin la du ni bdag nyid nyung du yin zhe na /
translated: How many are many in themselves and how many are few in themselves?

original: smras pa / dang po ni bdag nyid mang po yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / dang po ni bdag nyid mang po yin no //
translated: Some of the first type are many in themselves.

original: lhag ma dag ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma dag ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The rest are not like that.

original: bdag nyid mang po dang bdag nyid nyung du ji lta ba bzhin du shas che ba dang yun ring ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi rang bzhin dang / shas che ba dang yun ring ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid mang po dang bdag nyid nyung du ji lta ba bzhin du shas che ba dang yun ring ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi rang bzhin dang / shas che ba dang yun ring ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa dang /
translated: As with many in themselves and few in themselves, so too there are those that are predominant and long-lasting and those that are not predominant and not long-lasting.

original: phyir bltas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / kha nang du bltas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / nyes par spyod pa kun @127a * //🔽nas slong bar byed pa ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal mang po skyed par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal nyung du skyed par byed pa dang / kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba chung ngu dang bcas pa dang /🔽bul bar 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / myur du 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang ma bral bas rab tu phye ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bas rab tu phye ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa dang /
analyzed: phyir bltas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / kha nang du bltas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / nyes par spyod pa kun @127a * //🔽nas slong bar byed pa ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal mang po skyed par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal nyung du skyed par byed pa dang / kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba chung ngu dang bcas pa dang /🔽bul bar 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / myur du 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang ma bral bas rab tu phye ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bas rab tu phye ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa dang /
translated: It is that which motivates the afflicted view of the self, the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, and the view that grasps an inferior view as supreme.🔽It is

original: ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa med pa dang / rnam pa du mar skye bar nges pa dang / rnam pa gcig tu skye bar nges pa rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa med pa dang / rnam pa du mar skye bar nges pa dang / rnam pa gcig tu skye bar nges pa rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the concentrations that are not incompatible, that are certain to arise in many aspects, and that are certain to arise in one aspect.

original: bar sdom ni /
analyzed: bar sdom ni /
translated: The summary:

original: mang dang nyon mongs can dang ni //
analyzed: mang dang nyon mongs can dang ni //
translated: Many, afflicted,

original: spyod dang sdug bsngal nyid dang spang //
analyzed: spyod dang sdug bsngal nyid dang spang //
translated: practice, suffering, abandonment,🔽without offense, delay,

original: kha na ma tho bul bral dang // ting nge 'dzin dang skye ba'o //🔽nyon mongs pa rnams ni ji ltar ni spong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: kha na ma tho bul bral dang // ting nge 'dzin dang skye ba'o // nyon mongs pa rnams ni ji ltar ni spong bar 'gyur /
translated: concentration, and arising.🔽How are the afflictions abandoned?

original: ji tsam gyis na nyon mongs pa rnams spangs bar brjod par bya //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na nyon mongs pa rnams spangs bar brjod par bya //
translated: By how much are the afflictions said to be abandoned?

original: nyon mongs pa gang las ni spang bar bya /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang las ni spang bar bya /
translated: From what afflictions are they abandoned?

original: ci nyon mongs pa cig car ram 'on te rim gyis spang bar bya /
analyzed: ci nyon mongs pa cig car ram 'on te rim gyis spang bar bya /
translated: Are the afflictions abandoned all at once or gradually?

original: go rims gang gis ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya /🔽nyon mongs pa spong pa la rnam pa ni du yod /
analyzed: go rims gang gis ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya / nyon mongs pa spong pa la rnam pa ni du yod /
translated: By what order are the afflictions abandoned?🔽How many kinds of abandonment of the afflictions are there?

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rtags ni gang dag yin /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rtags ni gang dag yin /
translated: What are the signs of abandonment of the afflictions?

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phan yon ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phan yon ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the benefit of abandoning the defilements?

original: smras pa / tshogs yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang sbyor ba'i sa la zhugs pa dang mthong ba'i sa thob pa dang / sgom pa'i sa yongs su 'dris pas ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / tshogs yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang sbyor ba'i sa la zhugs pa dang mthong ba'i sa thob pa dang / sgom pa'i sa yongs su 'dris pas ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: It is said: The defilements are to be abandoned by one who has correctly accumulated the provisions, who has entered the path of application, who has attained the path of vision, and who has become familiar with the path of cultivation.

original: mthar thug pa'i sa thob pa las ni nyon mongs pa spangs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i sa thob pa las ni nyon mongs pa spangs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: They are to be declared abandoned by one who has attained the path of conclusion.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang rnal 'byor rnam pa bzhi bsgoms pas ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang rnal 'byor rnam pa bzhi bsgoms pas ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the defilements are to be abandoned by one who has cultivated the four yogas.

original: legs par bsgoms pas ni spangs bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par bsgoms pas ni spangs bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: They are to be declared abandoned by one who has cultivated them well.

original: rnal 'byor rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste nyan thos kyi sar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste nyan thos kyi sar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The four yogas are as taught in the Sravakabhumi.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang sems kyi rgyud yongs su smin pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag dang so so'i rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang gnyen po skyed pas ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang sems kyi rgyud yongs su smin pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag dang so so'i rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang gnyen po skyed pas ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: There is another formulation: One should abandon the afflictions by means of the instructions that are in accord with the complete maturation of the mind continuum, by means of one’s own proper mental attention, and by means of the development of the antidotes.

original: gnyen po mthar thug par gyur pa nyid kyis ni spangs par brjod @127b par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po mthar thug par gyur pa nyid kyis ni spangs par brjod @127b par bya'o //
translated: One should say that they are abandoned by means of the ultimate development of the antidotes.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yongs su shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa dang / byung ba dang du mi len pa dang / gnyen po yongs su 'dzin pas ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yongs su shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa dang / byung ba dang du mi len pa dang / gnyen po yongs su 'dzin pas ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: There is another formulation: One should abandon the afflictions by means of the complete knowledge of the basis of the afflictions, by means of the complete knowledge of the nature of the afflictions, by means of the complete knowledge of the faults of the afflictions, by not tolerating their arising, and by means of the complete possession of the antidotes.

original: gnyen po bskyed pas ni spangs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po bskyed pas ni spangs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say that they are abandoned by means of the development of the antidotes.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang zhi gnas la goms pa dang lhag mthong la goms pas ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang zhi gnas la goms pa dang lhag mthong la goms pas ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: There is another formulation: One should abandon the afflictions by means of the cultivation of serenity and the cultivation of insight.

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las nges par grol ba dang gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las nges par grol bas ni spangs par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las nges par grol ba dang gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las nges par grol bas ni spangs par brjod par bya ste /
