translated: And it should be said that they are abandoned by being definitely liberated from the bondage of signs and by being definitely liberated from the bondage of negative reflex actions.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: As the Bhagavān said:

original: skye ba po yi zhi gnas dang // lhag mthong goms par byas na ni //
analyzed: skye ba po yi zhi gnas dang // lhag mthong goms par byas na ni //
translated: When the person is habituated to śamatha and vipaśyanā,

original: gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba dang / mtshan ma'i 'ching las grol bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba dang / mtshan ma'i 'ching las grol bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: they are liberated from the bondage of negative reflex actions and the bondage of signs.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang / dmigs pa la mngon par dga' bas ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang / dmigs pa la mngon par dga' bas ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: Another enumeration: Afflictions are to be abandoned by fully understanding the objective support and by delighting in the objective support.

original: gnas ngan 'gags pa dang gnas gyur pas ni spangs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan 'gags pa dang gnas gyur pas ni spangs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: And it should be said that they are abandoned by the transformation of negative reflex actions and the transformation of the basis.

original: nyon mongs pas ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang dmigs pa las spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang dmigs pa las spang bar bya ste /
translated: Afflictions are to be abandoned by being free from the associated and objective supports.

original: 'di ltar gnyen po skyes na nyon mongs pa mi skye zhing mi skye ba'i chos can du'ang 'gyur bas mtshungs par ldan pa de las spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyen po skyes na nyon mongs pa mi skye zhing mi skye ba'i chos can du'ang 'gyur bas mtshungs par ldan pa de las spangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if the antidote arises, affliction does not arise and it becomes a phenomenon that does not arise, so it is abandoned from that which is concomitant with it.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa las spangs na dmigs par byed pas dmigs pa de las kyang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa las spangs na dmigs par byed pas dmigs pa de las kyang spangs pa yin no //
translated: If it is abandoned from that which is concomitant, it is also abandoned from the focal object since it focuses on that focal object.

original: nyon mongs pa ni cig car spong bar rig par bya'i rim gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni cig car spong bar rig par bya'i rim gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Afflictions are known to be simultaneously abandoned, not gradually.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, the knowledge of realization that realizes the four truths abandons afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: mngon par rtogs pa de'ang bden pa 'dren pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pas /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa de'ang bden pa 'dren pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pas /
translated: That realization is concomitant with attention that focuses on the four truths that are being realized.

original: de'i phyir sems gsum gyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa la log par zhugs pa thams cad cig car spang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems gsum gyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa la log par zhugs pa thams cad cig car spang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, all the afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing, which are wrongly engaged with regard to the truths of suffering, etc., are simultaneously abandoned by the three kinds of seeing.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni rim gyis spang bar rig par bya ste /🔽lam @128a * //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni rim gyis spang bar rig par bya ste / lam @128a * //
translated: But those to be abandoned by cultivation are to be abandoned in sequence.

original: goms par spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms par spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: dang po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The first is as follows:

original: khyim na gnas pas mi dge ba'i las kyi mtha' rnams dang sdig pa can gyi lta ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pas mi dge ba'i las kyi mtha' rnams dang sdig pa can gyi lta ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: A householder should abandon unwholesome actions and sinful views.

original: de'i 'og tu rab tu byung ba la mngon par dga' ba'i gags su gyur pa 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rab tu byung ba la mngon par dga' ba'i gags su gyur pa 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one who delights in going forth should abandon the thoughts of sensual desire, thoughts of malice, and thoughts of violence, which are obstacles to that.

original: de'i 'og tu sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gags su gyur pa nye du'i rnam par rtog pa dang yul gyi rnam par rtog pa dang mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gags su gyur pa nye du'i rnam par rtog pa dang yul gyi rnam par rtog pa dang mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should eliminate the discursive thoughts of relatives, the discursive thoughts of objects, and the discursive thoughts of death, which are obstacles to the concentration of the mind in equipoise.

original: de'i 'og tu yid la byed pa la thob pa'i gags su gyur pa dben pa la mngon par mi dga' ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas ngan len spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yid la byed pa la thob pa'i gags su gyur pa dben pa la mngon par mi dga' ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas ngan len spang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should eliminate the bodily defilements that are favorable to the lack of delight in solitude, which are obstacles to the attainment of mental attention.

original: de'i 'og tu mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //🔽de'i 'og tu bsgom pas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o // de'i 'og tu bsgom pas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should eliminate the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing.🔽Then, one should eliminate the afflictions to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: de'i 'og tu sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: Then, one should eliminate the afflictions associated with suffering and mental dissatisfaction.

original: de'i 'og tu bde ba dang yid bde ba dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bde ba dang yid bde ba dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: Then, one should eliminate the afflictions associated with pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: de'i 'og tu btang snyoms dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu btang snyoms dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: Then, one should eliminate the afflictions associated with equanimity.

original: de'i 'og tu snyoms par 'jug pa la sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sgrib pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu snyoms par 'jug pa la sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sgrib pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should eliminate the obscurations that are concordant with the obscurations to meditative concentration.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag las gang zag kha cig gis ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag las gang zag kha cig gis ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ste /
translated: Then, some individuals should eliminate the obscurations that are concordant with the obscurations to omniscience.

original: de ltar go rims des nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar go rims des nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should eliminate the afflictions in this order.

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba la rnam pa ni mang du yod par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba la rnam pa ni mang du yod par blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that there are many aspects to the elimination of the afflictions.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, there are two types:

original: kun nas dkris pa spong ba dang / bag la nyal spong ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa spong ba dang / bag la nyal spong ba'o //
translated: the elimination of the entanglements and the elimination of the latent states.

original: de la kun nas dkris pa spong ba dang 'dod chags spong ba dang zhe sdang spong ba dang the tshom gyi bar du spong ba dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong ba dang / log par lta ba'i bar du spong ba dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong ba dang /
analyzed: de la kun nas dkris pa spong ba dang 'dod chags spong ba dang zhe sdang spong ba dang the tshom gyi bar du spong ba dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong ba dang / log par lta ba'i bar du spong ba dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong ba dang /
translated: The elimination of the entanglements is the elimination of desire, the elimination of hatred, up to the elimination of doubt, the elimination of the afflicted view of the self, up to the elimination of the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, the elimination of the afflictions to be eliminated by seeing suffering,

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du spong ba dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa spong ba dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i bar du spong ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba spong ba dang gzhan 'debs pa'i spong ba dang / rtse 'jil bar byed pa'i spong ba dang /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du spong ba dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa spong ba dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i bar du spong ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba spong ba dang gzhan 'debs pa'i spong ba dang / rtse 'jil bar byed pa'i spong ba dang /
translated: up to the abandonment of the objects to be abandoned by the path of cultivation; the abandonment of those associated with the desire realm; up to the abandonment of those associated with the formless realm; the abandonment of distraction; the abandonment of others; the abandonment of the peak of existence;

original: rnam par gnon pa'i spong ba dang / 'bral @128b ba'i spong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par gnon pa'i spong ba dang / 'bral @128b ba'i spong ba'o //
translated: the abandonment of subjugation; and the abandonment of separation.

original: de la 'bral ba'i spong ba gang yin pa de ni bag la nyal spong ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'bral ba'i spong ba gang yin pa de ni bag la nyal spong ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Among these, the abandonment of separation should be regarded as the abandonment of latent tendencies.

original: de la nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni kun tu chags par 'gyur ba'i chos dman pa'ang gya nom pa dang phrad pa'am lkog na 'dug pa dag la shas cher lta zhing dpyod par byed kyang kun tu chags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni kun tu chags par 'gyur ba'i chos dman pa'ang gya nom pa dang phrad pa'am lkog na 'dug pa dag la shas cher lta zhing dpyod par byed kyang kun tu chags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the abandonment of afflictions means that even when encountering or observing in secret excellent objects that would normally cause attachment, one does not become attached.

original: ji ltar kun tu chags par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la kun tu chags par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la yang zhe sdang bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar kun tu chags par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la kun tu chags par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la yang zhe sdang bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Just as he does not become attached to things that cause attachment, he does not become averse to things that cause aversion.

original: kun tu rmongs par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la yang kun tu rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun tu rmongs par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la yang kun tu rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And he does not become confused about things that cause confusion.

original: de bzhin du mig gis gzugs rnams mthong na yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gis gzugs rnams mthong na yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Similarly, when he sees forms with his eyes, he does not become pleased,

original: yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur bar dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis btang snyoms su gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur bar dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis btang snyoms su gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: but remains with mindfulness and introspection in equanimity.

original: ji ltar mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba bzhin du yid kyis chos rnams mthong ba'i bar du yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba bzhin du yid kyis chos rnams mthong ba'i bar du yang de bzhin no //
translated: And just as with the eyes, so also with the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'dod pa chung ba yin te mchog tu yongs su grub pa'i 'dod pa chung ba nyid dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'dod pa chung ba yin te mchog tu yongs su grub pa'i 'dod pa chung ba nyid dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is naturally of few desires, and has the highest perfection of few desires.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa chung ba bzhin du chog shes pa dang rab tu dben pa dang brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa chung ba bzhin du chog shes pa dang rab tu dben pa dang brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with few desires, so too should you understand contentment, solitude, the cultivation of effort, the establishment of mindfulness, meditative concentration, and wisdom.

original: rang bzhin gyis spros pa med pa la dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis spros pa med pa la dga' ba yin te /
translated: You delight in the natural absence of conceptual elaboration.🔽You engage the mind in analysis with conceptual elaboration.

original: spros pa la so sor brtags nas sems 'jug par byed de de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rtags rnams yin par rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: spros pa la so sor brtags nas sems 'jug par byed de de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rtags rnams yin par rig par bya'o ;
translated: You should understand that these are the signs of the abandonment of the mental afflictions.

original: / nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phan yon ni mang du yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: / nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phan yon ni mang du yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: You should understand that the benefits of abandoning the mental afflictions are many.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba las rnam par 'das pa rjes su thob pa yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba las rnam par 'das pa rjes su thob pa yin /
translated: You attain the transcendence of suffering and mental unhappiness.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba las rnam par 'das pa rjes su thob pa yin gzugs dang thogs pa dang sna tshogs kyi 'du shes las rnam par 'das pa rjes su thob pa yin /
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba las rnam par 'das pa rjes su thob pa yin gzugs dang thogs pa dang sna tshogs kyi 'du shes las rnam par 'das pa rjes su thob pa yin /
translated: They attain the transcendence of the perceptions of form, obstruction, and variety.

original: ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das pa rjes su thob pa yin /
analyzed: ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das pa rjes su thob pa yin /
translated: They attain the transcendence of the suffering of the lower realms.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das pa rjes su thob pa yin /🔽dbugs phyin pa rjes su thob pa yin mchog @129a * //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das pa rjes su thob pa yin / dbugs phyin pa rjes su thob pa yin mchog @129a * //
translated: They attain the transcendence of the suffering of birth and so forth.🔽They attain the supreme relief.

original: tu dbugs phyin pa rjes su thob pa yin /🔽bsil ba'i dngos po thob pa yin /
analyzed: tu dbugs phyin pa rjes su thob pa yin / bsil ba'i dngos po thob pa yin /
translated: They attain the supreme relief.🔽They attain the state of coolness.

original: mchog tu bsil ba'i dngos po rjes su thob pa yin /
analyzed: mchog tu bsil ba'i dngos po rjes su thob pa yin /
translated: They attain the supreme state of coolness.

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i mchog thob pa dang rang gi sems la dbang bsgyur ba dang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rgyu zhing gnas pa dang yang phyir mi ldog pa'i chos can dang bdag gi don mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs pa dang bya ba thams🔽cad la ched du brtsal mi dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i mchog thob pa dang rang gi sems la dbang bsgyur ba dang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rgyu zhing gnas pa dang yang phyir mi ldog pa'i chos can dang bdag gi don mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs pa dang bya ba thams cad la ched du brtsal mi dgos pa yin no //
translated: They obtain the supreme state of happiness in this life, they control their own minds, they go and stay as they wish, they are irreversible, they perfect all their own goals, and they do not need to make an effort to do anything.

original: de dag las kha cig ni gzhan la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang lha dang mi rnams kyi don dang phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa yang yin te de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'i phan yon mang po dag yin par rig par bya'o
analyzed: de dag las kha cig ni gzhan la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang lha dang mi rnams kyi don dang phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa yang yin te de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'i phan yon mang po dag yin par rig par bya'o
translated: Some of them benefit others, benefit many people, bring happiness to many people, and have compassion for the world. They are dedicated to the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans. These and other such qualities should be understood as the many benefits of abandoning the afflictions.

original: // nyon mongs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: // nyon mongs pa rnams kyi dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the afflictions?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bco lngar rig par bya ste /🔽mtha' dag la dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bco lngar rig par bya ste / mtha' dag la dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /

original: 'jig tshogs la lta bal sogs pa'i'o //🔽phyogs gcig la dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta bal sogs pa'i'o // phyogs gcig la dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The first is that which has all as its object-field, such as the afflicted view of self.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal rnams kyi'o //🔽gzhi dang bcas pa la dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal rnams kyi'o // gzhi dang bcas pa la dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gzhi dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi'o // gzhi med pa la dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The third is that which has a basis as its object-field, such as the afflicted views.

original: gzhi med pa la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi'o //🔽nang la dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa skye mched drug la dmigs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzhi med pa la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi'o // nang la dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa skye mched drug la dmigs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The fourth is that which has no basis as its object-field, such as the afflicted views of the realm of immateriality.🔽The fifth is that which has the internal as its object-field, such as the defilements of the stage of contemplation and of the stage of non-contemplation, which have the six sense-sources for their object-field.

analyzed: phyi rol la dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The sixth is that which has the external as its object-field, such as the defilements which have the five objects of enjoyment for their object-field.

analyzed: mngon sum la dmigs pa ni 'di lta ste da ltar la dmigs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi'o //

analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i srid pa la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi'o //

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi'o //

original: gang zag rnam pa nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag rnam pa nyi shu gang zhe na /

translated: It is said: the householder, the renunciate, the one with a poorly explained Dharma, the one with a well explained Dharma, the one who practices with a predominance of afflictions, the one who practices evenly, the one with few afflictions,

translated: the one who is free from worldly attachment, the one who is not free from attachment, the one who has seen the basis, the one who has not seen the basis,

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can no //

original: nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba rnam pa nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba rnam pa nyi shu gang zhe na /

original: smras pa / 'dod cing khas blangs pa'i kun nas dkris pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / 'dod cing khas blangs pa ma yin pa'i kun nas dkris pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / so sor yang dag par ma rig pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang /

translated: He replied, “The occurrence of the afflictions that are the entanglements of desire and acceptance, the occurrence of the afflictions that are the entanglements of non-desire and non-acceptance, the occurrence of the afflictions of individual non-understanding,

original: so sor yang dag par rig pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa rags pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa mnyam pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa cha phra ba kun tu 'byung ba dang /

translated: the occurrence of the afflictions of individual understanding, the occurrence of coarse afflictions, the occurrence of equal afflictions, the occurrence of subtle afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa nang du bltas pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa phyir bltas pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / brjed ngas pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang /

original: kun brtags pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / yongs su tshol ba'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / rang dbang med pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / yongs su tshol ba'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / rang dbang med pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang /
translated: the afflictions that arise through imputation, the afflictions that arise naturally, the afflictions that arise through seeking, the afflictions that arise through lack of mastery,

original: rang dbang can gyi nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / gzhi la mi gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / gzhi la gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / bsgrub tu rung ba'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: rang dbang can gyi nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / gzhi la mi gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / gzhi la gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang / bsgrub tu rung ba'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba dang /
translated: the afflictions that arise through mastery, the afflictions that arise without a basis, the afflictions that arise with a basis, the afflictions that arise through being suitable to be accomplished,

original: bsgrub tu mi rung ba'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub tu mi rung ba'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba'o //
translated: and the afflictions that arise through being unsuitable to be accomplished.

analyzed: kun tu 'byung ba'i rkyen rnam pa nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty conditions for the arising of afflictions?

translated: He replied, “The conditions of pleasure, the conditions of pain, the conditions of neither pleasure nor pain, the conditions of aspiration, the conditions of discursive thought, the conditions of contact, the conditions of latent tendencies,

translated: the conditions of previous habituation, the conditions of associating with the ignoble, the conditions of hearing the teachings of the ignoble, the conditions of improper mental activity, the conditions of lack of faith, the conditions of laziness,

translated: The conditions for the arising of the afflictions are: forgetfulness, distraction, poor understanding, carelessness, the afflictions themselves, not being free from desire, and being an ordinary person.

translated: What kind of body is connected to what kind of realm?

analyzed: ci khams thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis nying mtshams sbyor bar brjod par bya ba'am 'on te ma tshang ba dag gis she na /
translated: Should it be said that all the afflictions of all the realms connect to rebirth, or that some are incomplete?

original: smras pa / thams cad kyis yin gyi ma tshang ba dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad kyis yin gyi ma tshang ba dag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: They are all complete, not incomplete.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni rang gi skye ba'i gnas su skye bar 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni rang gi skye ba'i gnas su skye bar 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, one who is not free from attachment is born in a place of birth, but one who is free from attachment is not.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i lus ni gzhan du lus gzhan skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i lus ni gzhan du lus gzhan skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the body of one who is not free from attachment is connected to all the negative tendencies that are the cause for the arising of another body in another place, which are in the class of afflictions.

original: rnam grangs des na nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis nyid mtshams sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis nyid mtshams sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
translated: By this enumeration, one should understand that one is conceived through all the afflictions.

original: gzhan yang skye ba na lus la sred pa yang kun nas 'byung la bud med skyes pa la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba'ang kun tu 'byung /
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba na lus la sred pa yang kun nas 'byung la bud med skyes pa la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba'ang kun tu 'byung /
translated: Moreover, craving for the body arises at birth, and attachment to a woman or a man and anger also arise.

original: ci bud med dam skyes pa 'di dag dang lhan cig 'grogs par 'gyur ram 'on te mi 'gyur snyam du the tshom yang kun tu 'byung /
analyzed: ci bud med dam skyes pa 'di dag dang lhan cig 'grogs par 'gyur ram 'on te mi 'gyur snyam du the tshom yang kun tu 'byung /
translated: Doubt also arises, thinking, “Will I be able to associate with these women or men, or not?”

original: nang dang phyi rol la ngar 'dzin pa dang / ba'i ra 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la sogs pa yang kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol la ngar 'dzin pa dang / ba'i ra 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la sogs pa yang kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Also, the grasping of the inner and outer as “I” and “mine,” the pride that thinks “I am,” and so on, arise.

original: rnam grangs des kyang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis nying mtshams sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des kyang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis nying mtshams sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
translated: By this enumeration, one should understand that all afflictions link to the next existence.

original: gzhan yang nying mtshams sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang nying mtshams sbyor ba ni /
translated: Moreover, linking to the next existence

original: mdor bsdu na bdun yod de /🔽kun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na bdun yod de / kun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: is sevenfold in brief.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi'o //🔽bag la nyal gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi'o // bag la nyal gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Linking through entanglements and latent afflictions is like that of ordinary beings.

original: gzhi mthong ba rnams kyi'o //🔽shes bzhin du 'jug pas nying mtshams sbyor ba na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhi mthong ba rnams kyi'o // shes bzhin du 'jug pas nying mtshams sbyor ba na 'di lta ste /
translated: Linking through latent afflictions is like that of those who see the truths.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: Linking through entering with vigilance is like that of wheel-turning kings.

original: shes bzhin du 'jug cing gnas pas nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin du 'jug cing gnas pas nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o //
translated: Linking through entering and abiding with vigilance is like that of pratyekabuddhas.

original: thams cad du brjod pa med pas nying mtshams @131a * //
analyzed: thams cad du brjod pa med pas nying mtshams @131a * //
translated: In all cases, it is the absence of verbal expression.

original: sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The seven kinds of conception are as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
translated: The conception of the bodhisattvas.

original: las mngon par 'du byed pas nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: las mngon par 'du byed pas nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The conception of those who are conceived through the performance of action,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ma gtogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ma gtogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: with the exception of the conception of the bodhisattvas.

original: ye shes mngon par 'du byed pas nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ye shes mngon par 'du byed pas nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The conception of those who are conceived through the performance of knowledge,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
translated: which is the conception of the bodhisattvas.

original: gnod pa dang ldan pas nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnod pa dang ldan pas nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The conception of those who are conceived with injury,

original: las mngon par 'du byed pas nying mtshams sbyor ba de nyid do //
analyzed: las mngon par 'du byed pas nying mtshams sbyor ba de nyid do //
translated: which is the same as the conception of those who are conceived through the performance of action.

original: don dang ldan pas nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dang ldan pas nying mtshams sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The conception of those who are conceived with benefit,🔽which is the same as the conception of those who are conceived through the performance of knowledge.

original: ye shes mngon par 'du byed pas nying mtshams sbyor ba de nyid de de dag bsdus na nying mtshams sbyor ba bdun nam dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes mngon par 'du byed pas nying mtshams sbyor ba de nyid de de dag bsdus na nying mtshams sbyor ba bdun nam dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: These seven or nine kinds of conception are included in the three kinds of conception.

original: gzhi de dag thams cad la tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba dang tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i tshul gyis mu bzhir bshad pa'i gzhung ni mi snang ngo //
analyzed: gzhi de dag thams cad la tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba dang tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i tshul gyis mu bzhir bshad pa'i gzhung ni mi snang ngo //
translated: In all these bases, the treatise does not appear to explain the four possibilities by the method of determining the terms in relation to the preceding terms and in relation to the subsequent terms.🔽The summary:

original: sdom ni / las dang mtshan nyid gzhi dang ni //
analyzed: sdom ni / las dang mtshan nyid gzhi dang ni //
translated: Karma, characteristics, basis,🔽happiness, nonvirtue, and so on,🔽abandonment, focal object, origin,

analyzed: bde dang mi dge la sogs dang // spong dang dmigs dang kun 'byung dang // nying mtshams sbyor ba tha ma yin / // / bam po bcu bzhi pa /

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Karma is presented in five ways:

original: las kyi lam gyi dngos kyis bsdus pa'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las dang de dag nyid kyi sbyor bas bsdus pa'i las dang mjug gis bsdus pa'i las kyis so //
analyzed: las kyi lam gyi dngos kyis bsdus pa'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las dang de dag nyid kyi sbyor bas bsdus pa'i las dang mjug gis bsdus pa'i las kyis so //
translated: Karma subsumed by the actual basis of the karmic path, physical karma, verbal karma, mental karma, karma subsumed by the preparation of those karmas and karma subsumed by the conclusion of those karmas.

original: de la mi dge ba'i las kyi lam ji skad bstan pa rnams ni las kyi lam gyi dngos kyis bsdus pa'i mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba'i las kyi lam ji skad bstan pa rnams ni las kyi lam gyi dngos kyis bsdus pa'i mi dge ba'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las zhes bya'o //
translated: The nonvirtuous paths of action that have been taught are called nonvirtuous actions of body, speech, and mind that are included in the actual basis of the paths of action.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las kyi lam de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las kyi lam de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of the nonvirtuous paths of action such as killing?

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang de'i bsam pas de nyid la las de kun tu spyad cing yongs su rdzogs pa ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang de'i bsam pas de nyid la las de kun tu spyad cing yongs su rdzogs pa ni /
translated: It is the performance and completion of that action with an afflicted mind and with that intention.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las kyi lam de dag thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las kyi lam de dag thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be regarded as the definition of all the paths of action such as killing.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can gyi sems ni chags shing chags pas zil gyis non pa dang sdang zhing sdang bas zil gyis non pa dang rmongs shing rmongs pas zil gyis non pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can gyi sems ni chags shing chags pas zil gyis non pa dang sdang zhing sdang bas zil gyis non pa dang rmongs shing rmongs pas zil gyis non pa'o //
translated: Therein, an afflicted mind is one that is attached, overwhelmed by attachment; one that is averse, overwhelmed by aversion; and one that is confused, overwhelmed by confusion.

analyzed: @131b gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi sems yod kyang de'i bsam pas kun tu ma spyad na /

analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byas kyang las kyi lam du gtogs pa'i las de yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin no //

analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyang yod la de'i bsam pa'ang yod mod kyi sems phyin ci log gis dngos po gzhan kho na zhig la kun tu spyad na mthar thug par gyur du zin kyang de ltar na las de yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin
translated: If one has an afflicted mind and that intention, but due to a distorted mind one fully engages in a different action, then even if the action is completed, that action does not constitute a karmic path.

analyzed: no // gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyang yod la de'i bsam pa'ang yod mod kyi kun tu ma spyad cing mthar thug par ma gyur na /
translated: If one has an afflicted mind and that intention, but does not fully engage in the action and does not complete it,

analyzed: de ltar na 'ang las de yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin no //
translated: then that action does not constitute a karmic path.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyang yod /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyang yod /

analyzed: de'i bsam pa'ang yod la de nyid la yang kun tu spyad mod kyi mthar thug par ma gyur na de lta na'ang las de yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: if there is the intention, if there is

analyzed: gzhi dang 'du shes dang / bsam pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang mtha'o //

analyzed: de la gzhi ni las kyi lam so so dag la so sor nges par blta bar bya ste /

translated: On that basis, whether it is a sentient being or not a sentient being, the ten paths of nonvirtuous action arise in the appropriate way.

analyzed: 'du shes ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
translated: Perception should be understood as fourfold:

original: de la der 'du shes pa dang / de ma yin pa la der 'du shes pa dang / de la de ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / de ma yin la de ma yin par 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la der 'du shes pa dang / de ma yin pa la der 'du shes pa dang / de la de ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / de ma yin la de ma yin par 'du shes pa'o //

analyzed: de la bsam pa zhes bya ba ni 'du shes phyin ci log gam 'du shes phyin ci ma log pa byed 'dod pa nyid gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: de la mtha' ni 'di yin te 'di lta ste /

translated: The action is completed at that very time or at a later time by the connection with that very action that is desired, by the preparation.

original: rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the nature of all ten of these paths of action, from taking life up to wrong view, should be understood in detail as completely established by these five aspects, as is appropriate.

original: srog gcod pa'i gzhi ni srog dang ldan pa'i sems can no //
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i gzhi ni srog dang ldan pa'i sems can no //
translated: The basis of taking life is a living being.

analyzed: gal te gsod par byed pa de srog chags de la srog chags yin pa'i 'du shes kyang yod la /
translated: If the one who is killing has the conception of a living being in regard to that living being,🔽and

original: srog chags gang gsad par 'dod pa la der 'du shes pa'ang yod pa de ni de la de'i 'du shes phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: srog chags gang gsad par 'dod pa la der 'du shes pa'ang yod pa de ni de la de'i 'du shes phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one wishes to kill a living being, the perception of that being is accurate.

original: de 'du shes de la brten te 'di gsad par bya'o snyam du sems mngon par 'du byed pa de ni de'i gsod pa'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'du shes de la brten te 'di gsad par bya'o snyam du sems mngon par 'du byed pa de ni de'i gsod pa'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: When one thinks, “I will kill this being,” that is the intention to kill.

original: de la chags pas zil gyis non tam zhe sdang gis zil gyis non tam gti mug gis zil gyis non tam /
analyzed: de la chags pas zil gyis non tam zhe sdang gis zil gyis non tam gti mug gis zil gyis non tam /
translated: When one is overcome by attachment, hatred, or delusion,

original: de dag las gnyis kyis zil gyis non tam /
analyzed: de dag las gnyis kyis zil gyis non tam /
translated: or by two of these,

original: thams cad kyis zil gyis non nas de ltar sems mngon par 'du byed pa de ni de'i nyon mongs pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyis zil gyis non nas de ltar sems mngon par 'du byed pa de ni de'i nyon mongs pa yin no //
translated: or by all three, that is the affliction.

original: de bsam pa de dang de ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis rang ngam gzhan dag gis gsad pa'i sbyor ba rtsom zhing mtshon gyis 'debs par byed la /
analyzed: de bsam pa de dang de ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis rang ngam gzhan dag gis gsad pa'i sbyor ba rtsom zhing mtshon gyis 'debs par byed la /
translated: When one, with such an intention and an afflicted mind, either personally engages in the activity of killing or instigates others to do so,

original: gal te btab ma thag kho nar sbyor ba des shi bar gyur na dus de nyid kyi tshe de'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs pas mthar thug pa yin par blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: 'thab mo dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / bram ze'i gsang sngags rnams dang / nyam thag cing smra ba dang / bgad pa dang / rtses pa dang / dga' bar byas pa dang / dga' dgur spyad pa smra ba dang /
translated: quarreling, finding fault, arguing, disputing, the secret mantras of brahmins, speaking in a distressed manner, and speaking about laughter, play, joy, and enjoyment.

original: 'du 'dzi'i gtam smra ba dang / ra ro ba dang / smyos pa lta bur smra ba dang / log pa'i 'tsho bas smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi'i gtam smra ba dang / ra ro ba dang / smyos pa lta bur smra ba dang / log pa'i 'tsho bas smra ba'o //
translated: It is speaking about the talk of crowds, speaking like a drunkard or a madman, and speaking with a wrong livelihood.

original: khyim gyi rje dpon la 'dod pa'i rnam pa skyed par byed pa dang / kye ma khyim gyi rje dpon gang yin pa de bdag gi bran g-yog tu gyur cing ci 'dod pa bzhin du byar rung bar gyur na ci ma rung snyam pa ni brnab sems yin par brjod par bya'o //🔽khyim gyi rje dpon la de nyid kyi pha ma'am /
analyzed: khyim gyi rje dpon la 'dod pa'i rnam pa skyed par byed pa dang / kye ma khyim gyi rje dpon gang yin pa de bdag gi bran g-yog tu gyur cing ci 'dod pa bzhin du byar rung bar gyur na ci ma rung snyam pa ni brnab sems yin par brjod par bya'o // khyim gyi rje dpon la de nyid kyi pha ma'am /
translated: One should say that covetousness is the desire to become the master of the household, and the desire to be able to do whatever one wants with the master of the household, thinking, “Oh, if only the master of the household were my servant and I could do whatever I want with him!”

original: bu'am / chung ma'am /
analyzed: bu'am / chung ma'am /
translated: One should understand that covetousness is the desire to become the father, mother, son, wife,

original: bran nam / bran mo'am /
analyzed: bran nam / bran mo'am /
translated: servant, servant,

original: las byed pa'am /
analyzed: las byed pa'am /
translated: worker,

original: zho shas 'tsho ba'am rgyas par yongs su bzung ba'i dngos po bdun nam /
analyzed: zho shas 'tsho ba'am rgyas par yongs su bzung ba'i dngos po bdun nam /
translated: or hired person of the master of the household, or to obtain the seven kinds of property that are held in common,

original: zas la sogs pa lus kyi yo byad bcu po dag la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zas la sogs pa lus kyi yo byad bcu po dag la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: or the ten kinds of necessities of life such as food.

original: kye ma bdag la gzhan dag 'dod pa chung ba yin par yid ches par bya'o snyam du 'dod pa'i rnam pa skyed par byed na yang brnab sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kye ma bdag la gzhan dag 'dod pa chung ba yin par yid ches par bya'o snyam du 'dod pa'i rnam pa skyed par byed na yang brnab sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say that covetousness is the desire to be trusted by others as a person of few desires, thinking, “Oh, if only others would trust me as a person of few desires!”

original: 'dod pa chung ba ji lta ba bzhin du chog shes pa dang / rab tu dben pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / shes rab can dang / zag pa zad pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba ji lta ba bzhin du chog shes pa dang / rab tu dben pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / shes rab can dang / zag pa zad pa dang /
translated: meditative concentration,🔽wisdom,🔽the elimination of the contaminants,

original: mang du thos pa dang / gtong ba'i ngang tshul can yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mang du thos pa dang / gtong ba'i ngang tshul can yang de bzhin no //
translated: and being learned.

original: kye ma bdag pha rol rgyal po nas /
analyzed: kye ma bdag pha rol rgyal po nas /
translated: “Oh, may I become one who is honored,🔽respected, revered, worshiped,🔽and venerated by kings,🔽princes,🔽ministers,🔽 Translation: 隨順少欲知足，🔽遠離精進，🔽安住念定，🔽智慧，🔽漏盡，🔽多聞，

original: rgyas par ded dpon dang / dge @136a * //
analyzed: rgyas par ded dpon dang / dge @136a * //
translated: The extensive version is found in the Sutra of the Wise and the Foolish (mDzangs-blun).🔽

original: slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i bar dag gis bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / ri mor bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i bar dag gis bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / ri mor bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be venerated, respected, revered, honored, and worshipped by the king, the royal court, the people of the land, the brahmins, the householders, the monks, the nuns, the male lay vow holders, and the female lay vow holders.

original: kye ma bdag gis zas dang gos dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / nad kyi gso sman dang / yo byad thob par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam du 'dod pa'i rnam pa skyed par byed na yang brnab sems yin par brjod par bya'o //🔽kye ma bdag nyid phyi ma la lha'i 'jig rten du skye zhing lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas brtson par gyur cig snyam pa dang ; kye ma bdag phyi ma la drag po'i 'jig rten dang / khyab 'jug gi 'jig rten dang / mi skal ba can rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ces bya ba nas rgyas par gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa'i bar skye bar gyur cig snyam du 'dod pa'i rnam pa /
analyzed: kye ma bdag gis zas dang gos dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / nad kyi gso sman dang / yo byad thob par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam du 'dod pa'i rnam pa skyed par byed na yang brnab sems yin par brjod par bya'o // kye ma bdag nyid phyi ma la lha'i 'jig rten du skye zhing lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas brtson par gyur cig snyam pa dang ; kye ma bdag phyi ma la drag po'i 'jig rten dang / khyab 'jug gi 'jig rten dang / mi skal ba can rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ces bya ba nas rgyas par gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa'i bar skye bar gyur cig snyam du 'dod pa'i rnam pa /
translated: If one generates the aspect of desire, thinking, “Oh, how nice it would be if I could obtain food, clothing, bedding, seats, medicine for illness, and articles for my use,” it should be said that this is covetousness.

original: skyed par byed na yang brnab sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed na yang brnab sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: If one generates the aspect of desire, thinking, “Oh, how nice it would be if I could be born in the world of the gods in the next world and be endowed with the five divine pleasures,” and “Oh, how nice it would be if I could be born in the world of Rudra, the world of Vishnu, and be born in the same place as those who have good fortune,” and so on, in detail, up to “Oh, how nice it would be if I could be born in the same place as the gods who control the enjoyments created by others,” it should be said that this is covetousness.

original: tha na pha ma dang bu dang chung ma dang bran dang bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / gros grogs dang / nye du dang / rgan rabs dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi yo byad la 'dod pa'i rnam pa skyed par byed na yang brnab sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tha na pha ma dang bu dang chung ma dang bran dang bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / gros grogs dang / nye du dang / rgan rabs dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi yo byad la 'dod pa'i rnam pa skyed par byed na yang brnab sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Even if one generates a form of desire for the possessions of one’s parents, children, spouse, male and female servants, workers, hired persons, friends, companions, relatives, elders, or fellow religious practitioners, this should be called covetousness.

original: 'di ni bdag la gnod pa bya bar 'dod pa yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag la gnod pa bya bar 'dod pa yin no snyam nas /
translated: If one thinks, “This person wishes to harm me,”

original: de la gnod par bya ba'i phyir sems par byed na gnod sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnod par bya ba'i phyir sems par byed na gnod sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: and one thinks about harming him or her in return, this should be called malice.

original: bdag la gnod pa byas so byed do byed par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa byas so byed do byed par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: If one thinks, “This person harmed me in the past, is harming me in the present, or will harm me in the future,”

original: de la gnod par bya ba'i phyir sems par byed na yang gnod sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnod par bya ba'i phyir sems par byed na yang gnod sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: and one thinks about harming him or her in return, this should be called malice.

original: rgyas par kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood that this is also the case with the nine bases of resentment.

original: kye ma bdag gi gshed ma rnams dang / dgra bo rnams dang / phas kyi dgra rnams dbang du 'gyur zhing bdag gis de dag bsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / spyugs pa dang / lcag dag gis gzhu ba dang / de longs spyod rnams dang dbral ba dang /
analyzed: kye ma bdag gi gshed ma rnams dang / dgra bo rnams dang / phas kyi dgra rnams dbang du 'gyur zhing bdag gis de dag bsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / spyugs pa dang / lcag dag gis gzhu ba dang / de longs spyod rnams dang dbral ba dang /
translated: If one thinks, Oh, may my enemies, adversaries, and opponents come under my power, and may I kill them, bind them, banish them, beat them with whips, and deprive them of their possessions,

original: bu smad rnams dang / rtsa 'jing dang / 'khor dang khyim dang bral bar bya'o snyam du kun nas mnar sems kyi sems skyed par @136b byed na yang gnod sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bu smad rnams dang / rtsa 'jing dang / 'khor dang khyim dang bral bar bya'o snyam du kun nas mnar sems kyi sems skyed par @136b byed na yang gnod sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: their wives and children, their relatives, their retinue, and their homes, then, even if one generates a hostile mind, it should be called malice.

original: gzhan dag la bdag gi gshed ma rnams dang / dgra bo rnams dang / phas kyi dgra rnams la ji skad brjod pa'i gnod pa bya bar 'tshol ba'i kun nas mnar sems kyi sems skyed par byed na yang gnod sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la bdag gi gshed ma rnams dang / dgra bo rnams dang / phas kyi dgra rnams la ji skad brjod pa'i gnod pa bya bar 'tshol ba'i kun nas mnar sems kyi sems skyed par byed na yang gnod sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: If one seeks to inflict the harm described above on others, thinking, May my enemies, adversaries, and opponents come under my power, then, even if one generates a hostile mind, it should be called malice.

original: rang nyid de lta de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid kyis sgrub cing des de dag gi longs spyod rnams dang / rtsa 'jing dang / 'khor dang / grags pa dang / nad med pa dang / gson pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams yongs su nyams par gyur cig snyam pa dang /
analyzed: rang nyid de lta de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid kyis sgrub cing des de dag gi longs spyod rnams dang / rtsa 'jing dang / 'khor dang / grags pa dang / nad med pa dang / gson pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams yongs su nyams par gyur cig snyam pa dang /
translated: and he himself practices in that way with his body, speech, and mind, and he thinks, “May they lose their enjoyments, their power, their retinue, their fame, their health, their life, and their virtuous qualities!”

original: lus zhig nas kyang ngan song rnams su skye bar gyur cig snyam du kun nas mnar sems kyi sems skyed par byed na yang gnod sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lus zhig nas kyang ngan song rnams su skye bar gyur cig snyam du kun nas mnar sems kyi sems skyed par byed na yang gnod sems yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: and after the dissolution of his body, may he be reborn in the lower realms!”🔽If he generates the thought, “There is no giving!”

original: byin pa med do snyam du nges par sems skyed par byed na yang log par lta ba yin par brjod par bya'o //🔽rgyas par rgyu la skur pa 'debs sam /
analyzed: byin pa med do snyam du nges par sems skyed par byed na yang log par lta ba yin par brjod par bya'o // rgyas par rgyu la skur pa 'debs sam /
translated: it should be said that he has wrong view.🔽If he denies the cause,

original: 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs sam /
analyzed: 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs sam /
translated: denies the effect,

original: bya ba la skur pa 'debs sam /
analyzed: bya ba la skur pa 'debs sam /
translated: denies the action,

original: yod pa'i dngos po 'jig par byed na yang log par lta ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po 'jig par byed na yang log par lta ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: or destroys an existent thing, it should be said that he has wrong view.

original: gang gi tshe log pa'i lta ba thams cad log par lta ba zhes bya na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba 'di kho na las kyi lam rnams su log par lta ba yin par gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe log pa'i lta ba thams cad log par lta ba zhes bya na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba 'di kho na las kyi lam rnams su log par lta ba yin par gsungs she na /
translated: If all wrong views are called wrong views, why did the Bhagavān say that only this wrong view that denies the existence of objects is a wrong view that is a karmic path?

original: 'di ltar 'di ni log par lta ba thams cad kyi mchog yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni log par lta ba thams cad kyi mchog yin te /
translated: Because this is the worst of all wrong views.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar log par lta ba 'di la brten nas dge sbyong dang / bram ze kha cig dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par gcod par byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar log par lta ba 'di la brten nas dge sbyong dang / bram ze kha cig dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par gcod par byed cing /
translated: Because some śramaṇas and brahmins completely sever their roots of virtue in dependence on this wrong view.

original: sdig pa la ci 'dod dgur spyod pa'i lta ba 'di ni shin tu sdig pa byed pa dang mthun pa yin pas de'i phyir mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams su de kho na gsungs kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa la ci 'dod dgur spyod pa'i lta ba 'di ni shin tu sdig pa byed pa dang mthun pa yin pas de'i phyir mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams su de kho na gsungs kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: This view that engages in evil as one pleases is compatible with the performance of great evil. Therefore only that wrong view is said to be a karmic path and not others.

original: log par lta ba'i mtshan nyid du rigs pa ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i mtshan nyid du rigs pa ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be viewed as illogical to characterize it as a wrong view.

analyzed: de la srog gcod pa ni rgyu lngas lci ba yin par brjod par bya ste /
translated: Killing is said to be heavy due to five causes.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / gnyen po med pa dang / log pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / gzhis so //🔽de la gal te chags pa'i bsam pa drag pos byed dam /
analyzed: bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / gnyen po med pa dang / log pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / gzhis so // de la gal te chags pa'i bsam pa drag pos byed dam /
translated: Intention, performance, absence of antidote, strong adherence to error, and basis.🔽If one kills with a strong intention of attachment,

original: zhe sdang gi bsam pa drag pos sam /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi bsam pa drag pos sam /
translated: or with a strong intention of hatred,

original: @137a * // gti mug gi bsam pa drag pos byed pa ni srog gcod pa lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: @137a * // gti mug gi bsam pa drag pos byed pa ni srog gcod pa lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: or with a strong intention of delusion, it is said that killing is heavy.

original: de las zlog pa ni yang ba yin no //🔽gal te byed par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de las zlog pa ni yang ba yin no // gal te byed par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: The opposite of that is light.🔽If one is pleased with the act,🔽or is pleased with the agent, or is pleased with the deed, or is pleased with the result, or if one is pleased with the praise of the deed,

analyzed: byed pa'am / byas pa la sems rangs pa dang ldan pa dang / rab tu dga' ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang / rang yang byed la gzhan yang de yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / de'i bsngags pa rjod par byed pa dang /
translated: or if one is pleased with the praise of the agent, or if one is pleased with the praise of the deed, or if one is pleased with the praise of the result, or if one is pleased with the praise of the praise,🔽or if one is pleased with the praise of the praise of the praise, or if one is pleased with the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise, or if one is pleased with the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise, or if one is pleased with the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise, or if one is pleased with the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise, or if one is pleased with the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise, or if one is pleased with the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise, or if one is pleased with the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise, or if one is pleased with the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise, or if one is pleased with the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise, or if one is pleased with the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise of the praise, or if one is pleased with the praise of

original: chos ma thun pa pa mthong na yid dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yun ring po nas bsags shing yun ring po nas bsags pa'i sems kyis byed pa dang / rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa dang / lan cig la yang mang du gsod par byed pa dang /
analyzed: chos ma thun pa pa mthong na yid dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yun ring po nas bsags shing yun ring po nas bsags pa'i sems kyis byed pa dang / rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa dang / lan cig la yang mang du gsod par byed pa dang /
translated: If one kills with a mind that has accumulated such actions for a long time, if one kills constantly, if one kills respectfully, if one kills many at one time,

original: nyon mongs pa'i las rab tu drag pos gsod par byed pa dang / 'jigs pas de bya ba ma yin pa byed du bcug nas gsod par byed pa dang / zhan pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bkren pa dang / nyam thag par smra ba dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i las rab tu drag pos gsod par byed pa dang / 'jigs pas de bya ba ma yin pa byed du bcug nas gsod par byed pa dang / zhan pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bkren pa dang / nyam thag par smra ba dang /
translated: if one kills with a very strong affliction, if one kills after forcing someone to commit an improper action out of fear, if one kills the weak, the suffering, the poor, the desperate,

original: snying rje bar smre sngags 'don bzhin du gsod par byed pa ni srog gcod pa sbyor ba las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje bar smre sngags 'don bzhin du gsod par byed pa ni srog gcod pa sbyor ba las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: if one kills while they are begging for mercy, then it is said that the preparation of killing is heavy.

original: gal te srog gcod par byed pa yang yin la nyin gcig bzhin du bslab pa 'ga' yang ldan par mi byed la /
analyzed: gal te srog gcod par byed pa yang yin la nyin gcig bzhin du bslab pa 'ga' yang ldan par mi byed la /
translated: If one is a killer and does not possess any training whatsoever,

original: zla ba phyed la tshes brgyad dang / tshes bcu bzhi dang / tshes bco lnga la bsnyen gnas la gnas par mi byed pa dang / dus dus su sbyin pa dag sbyin par mi byed pa dang / bsod nams dag mi byed pa dang / mngon du smra ba dang /
analyzed: zla ba phyed la tshes brgyad dang / tshes bcu bzhi dang / tshes bco lnga la bsnyen gnas la gnas par mi byed pa dang / dus dus su sbyin pa dag sbyin par mi byed pa dang / bsod nams dag mi byed pa dang / mngon du smra ba dang /
translated: not giving gifts from time to time, not making merit, not speaking in a way that is clear,

original: phyag 'tshal ba dang / ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyor ba dang 'dud pa la sogs pa mi byed pa dang / dus dus su ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / 'gyod pa shas chen po mi thob pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la mi reg pa dang /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba dang / ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyor ba dang 'dud pa la sogs pa mi byed pa dang / dus dus su ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / 'gyod pa shas chen po mi thob pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la mi reg pa dang /
translated: not bowing, rising, joining palms, or bowing down, not attaining a great deal of shame, embarrassment, and regret from time to time, not touching the worldly freedom from attachment,🔽and not touching the realization of the Dharma.

original: chos mngon par rtogs pa la mi reg pa ni srog gcod pa gnyen po med pa las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos mngon par rtogs pa la mi reg pa ni srog gcod pa gnyen po med pa las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that this is heavier than killing without antidote.

original: gal te dge sbyong dang bram ze mchod sbyin log par byed pa rnams kyi lta ba'i rjes su yid 'dod par byed cing /
analyzed: gal te dge sbyong dang bram ze mchod sbyin log par byed pa rnams kyi lta ba'i rjes su yid 'dod par byed cing /

analyzed: chos 'dod pas srog gcod par byed pa ni srog gcod pa log pa la mngon par zhen pa las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //

original: gal te sems 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gal te sems 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: 'di ltar phyugs rnams ni skye dgu'i @137b bdag pos yo byad kyi rgyur sprul pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na yang srog gcod pa lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //

original: de ltar log par lta ba gang yang rung ba las brten te /

analyzed: gal te slob pa'am /

analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa'am /

analyzed: gal te dgra bcom pa'am /

analyzed: gal te rang sangs rgyas gsod par byed dam / de bzhin gshegs pas ni bgrongs pha ma yin par shes bzhin du /

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rgyu de dag las bzlog pa ni srog gcod pa yang ba yin par brjod bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rgyu de dag las bzlog pa ni srog gcod pa yang ba yin par brjod bar bya'o //
translated: The basis of killing is light when the opposite of the above causes are present.

original: 'di man chad ni ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i gzhi'i lci ba nyid dang yang ba nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i gzhi'i lci ba nyid dang yang ba nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: lhag ma ni srog gcod pa bzhin du ji rigs par blta bar bya'o //

original: gal te rang sangs rgyas las sam /
analyzed: gal te rang sangs rgyas las sam /
translated: or if one steals from a pratyekabuddha,

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi'am /🔽gal te mchod rten gyi 'phrog par byed na yang ma byin par len pa gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi'am / gal te mchod rten gyi 'phrog par byed na yang ma byin par len pa gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //

original: 'jug par bya ba ma yin par 'jug pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'jug par bya ba ma yin par 'jug pa las brtsams te /
translated: Stealing is also said to become heavier in terms of basis in the case of engaging in what should not be engaged in.

analyzed: skyes pa yid gcugs pa'i chung ma'am /
translated: or with the wife of a trusted man,🔽or if one steals the wife of a trusted man,

original: brtul zhugs la gnas pa'i dge @138a * //
analyzed: brtul zhugs la gnas pa'i dge @138a * //
translated: and a nun who is a celibate,

original: slong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul ma la nyal po byed na yang 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'i gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: slong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul ma la nyal po byed na yang 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'i gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: nad kyis btab pa la nyal po byed na 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: or with someone who is sick, it should be said that it is a basis that is weighty for sexual misconduct.

original: gnas ma yin par 'jug pa las brtsams te /🔽gal te mchod rten gyi gnas sam /🔽mchod rten gyi drung ngam /
analyzed: gnas ma yin par 'jug pa las brtsams te / gal te mchod rten gyi gnas sam / mchod rten gyi drung ngam /
translated: Beginning with engaging in an improper place,🔽if one engages in sexual intercourse in a place of worship,🔽in front of a stūpa,

analyzed: dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra bar nyal po byed na /
translated: or in the pleasure grove of the Saṅgha,

original: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Sexual misconduct is said to be weighty in terms of the basis.

analyzed: gal te gzhan brid par 'dod cing bslu bar 'dod pas don mang pos brdzun gyi tshig smra na brdzun du smra ba gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: If one lies with many purposes, such as wanting to deceive and wanting to mislead others, then lying is said to be weighty in terms of the basis.

original: gal te bzang po'am rab tu mchog gam /
analyzed: gal te bzang po'am rab tu mchog gam /
translated: If one lies to a good person, a superior person,

original: gal te yid gcugs pa'am /
analyzed: gal te yid gcugs pa'am /

original: gal te ma'am /
analyzed: gal te ma'am /

analyzed: gal te pha'am /

analyzed: rgyas par snga ma bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar la brdzun zer na brdzun du smra ba gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o // gzhan yang brdzun du smra ba ni gzhan dag srog gcod pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba yang yod / longs spyod nyams pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: or, in detail, up to the Tathāgata, then lying is said to be weighty in terms of the basis.🔽Moreover, lying is the cause for others to engage in killing,🔽it is the cause for others to engage in the destruction of property,

original: chung ma chud gzan pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba yang yod de /
analyzed: chung ma chud gzan pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba yang yod de /
translated: and it is the cause for others to engage in the destruction of wives.

original: de la brdzun du smra ba gang srog gcod pa lci ba skyed par byed pa dang / ma byin par len pa'i lci ba dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'i lci ba skyed par byed pa de yang brdzun du smra ba gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la brdzun du smra ba gang srog gcod pa lci ba skyed par byed pa dang / ma byin par len pa'i lci ba dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'i lci ba skyed par byed pa de yang brdzun du smra ba gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Lying that generates the same gravity as killing, stealing, or sexual misconduct is called “lying that is grave in terms of its basis.”

original: gal te dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir brdzun zer na brdzun du smra ba de ni brdzun du smra ba thams cad kyi nang na lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir brdzun zer na brdzun du smra ba de ni brdzun du smra ba thams cad kyi nang na lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: If one lies in order to divide the Saṅgha, that lying is called “lying that is grave among all lies.”

original: gal te yun ring po nas bshes par gyur pa rnams dbye ba'i phyir sbyor bar byed pa ni phra ma gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te yun ring po nas bshes par gyur pa rnams dbye ba'i phyir sbyor bar byed pa ni phra ma gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //

original: gal te dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'byed par byed dam /
analyzed: gal te dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'byed par byed dam /

original: gal te ma dang bu dag gam /
analyzed: gal te ma dang bu dag gam /
