original: gal @138b te pha dang bu dag gam /
analyzed: gal @138b te pha dang bu dag gam /
translated: or a father and child,

original: gal te dge 'dun 'byed par byed dam /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun 'byed par byed dam /
translated: or the Saṅgha,

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa skyed pa'i phra ma ni snga ma'i tshul bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa skyed pa'i phra ma ni snga ma'i tshul bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Malicious speech that generates killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct should be understood in the same way as the previous.

original: pha ma la sogs pa dang bla ma lta bu dag la ngag rtsub po rjod par byed pa ni ngag rtsub po gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pha ma la sogs pa dang bla ma lta bu dag la ngag rtsub po rjod par byed pa ni ngag rtsub po gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Harsh speech is said to be heavy in terms of its basis when it is spoken to parents and so on and to those who are like gurus.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / de kho na ma yin pa'i brdzun smra ba dang / mngon sum du gshe ba dang / spyo ba dang / brgyad bkag zer ba yang /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / de kho na ma yin pa'i brdzun smra ba dang / mngon sum du gshe ba dang / spyo ba dang / brgyad bkag zer ba yang /
translated: Lying that is not true and not real, and harsh speech that is direct abuse, reproach, and slander,

original: ngag rtsub po lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ngag rtsub po lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: are said to be heavy in terms of harsh speech.

original: brdzun du smra ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i tshig kyang la pa gang yin pa de'i lci ba dang / yang ba yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i tshig kyang la pa gang yin pa de'i lci ba dang / yang ba yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The lightness and heaviness of words that become lying and so on are also like this.

original: de dag gi ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in the same way as the previous.

original: 'thab mo dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang 'gyed pa la brten pa'i tshig kyal pa gang yin pa de yang lci ba yin no //🔽chags pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis phyi rol pa'i bstan bcos don dang mi ldan pa dag lung 'bogs pa dang / kha don byed pa dang / gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston pa gang yin pa de yang tshig kyal ba gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'thab mo dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang 'gyed pa la brten pa'i tshig kyal pa gang yin pa de yang lci ba yin no // chags pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis phyi rol pa'i bstan bcos don dang mi ldan pa dag lung 'bogs pa dang / kha don byed pa dang / gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston pa gang yin pa de yang tshig kyal ba gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Also, idle chatter that is based on quarreling, slander, disputes, and contentions is heavy.🔽Also, idle chatter that is done with a mind of attachment, such as teaching, reciting, and explaining to others in detail the non-Buddhist treatises that are devoid of meaning, should be said to be heavy in terms of basis.

original: pha ma dang / nye du dang / bla ma lta bu dag la bsting slad dang / co 'dri ba dang / tshig gi lam mi bsha' ba dang kun tu brjod pa gang yin pa de yang tshig kyal pa gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pha ma dang / nye du dang / bla ma lta bu dag la bsting slad dang / co 'dri ba dang / tshig gi lam mi bsha' ba dang kun tu brjod pa gang yin pa de yang tshig kyal pa gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Also, idle chatter that is done to one's parents, relatives, and those who are like teachers, such as teasing, joking, and speaking harsh words, should be said to be heavy in terms of basis.

original: dge 'dun gyi dang / mchod rten gyi yo byad dag la brnab sems skyed par byed pa ni brnab sems gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dang / mchod rten gyi yo byad dag la brnab sems skyed par byed pa ni brnab sems gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that covetousness is heavy in terms of its basis when one generates covetousness for the property of the Saṅgha or a stūpa.

original: bdag nyid kyi yon tan gyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed cing rgyal po la sogs pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams la shes kyi khe dang bkur sti'i 'dod pa skyed par byed pa yang brnab sems gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi yon tan gyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed cing rgyal po la sogs pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams la shes kyi khe dang bkur sti'i 'dod pa skyed par byed pa yang brnab sems gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that covetousness is heavy in terms of its basis when one generates the desire for gain and honor through boasting about one’s own good qualities and when one generates the desire for gain and honor from kings, etc., and from learned fellow practitioners of virtue.

original: pha ma dang / nye du dang / bla ma lta bu dag la kun nas mnar sems skyed par byed pa ni gnod sems gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pha ma dang / nye du dang / bla ma lta bu dag la kun nas mnar sems skyed par byed pa ni gnod sems gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that malice is heavy in terms of its basis when one generates malice toward one’s mother, father, or guru.

original: nyes pa med pa dang / bkren pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / snying rje ba'i gzhi dag la kun nas mnar sems skyed par byed pa yang gnod sems gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par @139a * //
analyzed: nyes pa med pa dang / bkren pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / snying rje ba'i gzhi dag la kun nas mnar sems skyed par byed pa yang gnod sems gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par @139a * //
translated: It should be said that malice is heavier on the basis of those who are innocent, the poor, the suffering, and the pitiful.

original: bya'o ; / nyes pa byas ba bsam pa thag pa nas 'chags par byed pa la kun nas mnar sems skyed par byed pa yang gnod sems gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //🔽thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa'i log par lta ba gang yin pa de ni gzhi thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i sgor zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya'o ; / nyes pa byas ba bsam pa thag pa nas 'chags par byed pa la kun nas mnar sems skyed par byed pa yang gnod sems gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o // thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa'i log par lta ba gang yin pa de ni gzhi thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i sgor zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It should be said that malice is heavier on the basis of those who confess their faults from the depth of their hearts.

original: da las gzhan pa'i log par lta ba thams cad pas lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da las gzhan pa'i log par lta ba thams cad pas lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that wrong view is heavier than all other actions because it is the door to the denial of all bases.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa dang yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams med do zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher lta ba gang yin pa de yang log par lta ba gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa dang yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams med do zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher lta ba gang yin pa de yang log par lta ba gzhi las lci ba yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the view that the world does not exist as an arhat, a perfect being, or one who has entered the path is also said to be a grave wrong view.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i gzhi rnams ma gtogs pa de las bzlog pa thams cad ni yang ba yin par ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i gzhi rnams ma gtogs pa de las bzlog pa thams cad ni yang ba yin par ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Except for the bases that have been taught, all other views should be understood as being grave in the same way.

original: srog gcod pa dang ldan pa'i mi dge ba ni byas la bsags pa ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang ldan pa'i mi dge ba ni byas la bsags pa ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There is nonvirtuous killing that is done but not accumulated.

original: bsags la ma byas pa yang yod do //
analyzed: bsags la ma byas pa yang yod do //
translated: There is that which is accumulated but not done.

original: byas kyang byas la bsags kyang bsags pa yang yod do //
analyzed: byas kyang byas la bsags kyang bsags pa yang yod do //
translated: There is that which is both done and accumulated.

original: ma byas shing ma bsags pa yang yod do //
analyzed: ma byas shing ma bsags pa yang yod do //
translated: There is that which is neither done nor accumulated.

original: de la mu dang po ni byis pa mi mkhas pas byas pa dang / rmi lam na byas pa dang / ched du ma byas pa dang ; mi 'dod bzhin du gzhan dag gis nan gyis byed du bcug pa dang / lan cig kho na byas shing byas nas kyang 'gyod pa'i sems dang nyes dmigs kyi sems kyi rgyun drag pos bcom nas /
analyzed: de la mu dang po ni byis pa mi mkhas pas byas pa dang / rmi lam na byas pa dang / ched du ma byas pa dang ; mi 'dod bzhin du gzhan dag gis nan gyis byed du bcug pa dang / lan cig kho na byas shing byas nas kyang 'gyod pa'i sems dang nyes dmigs kyi sems kyi rgyun drag pos bcom nas /
translated: The first possibility is that which is committed by a child who is not skilled, that which is committed in a dream, that which is committed without intention, that which is committed by one who is forced by others, that which is committed only once, that which is committed and then destroyed by a strong mind of regret and a mind of the fault of that action,

original: spong ba'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pas shin tu srab mor byas pa dang / rnam par smin pa ni ma bskyed pa kho nar 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas sa bon nas bcom pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spong ba'i lam gyis sa bon nas yang dag par bcom pa yin no //
analyzed: spong ba'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pas shin tu srab mor byas pa dang / rnam par smin pa ni ma bskyed pa kho nar 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas sa bon nas bcom pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spong ba'i lam gyis sa bon nas yang dag par bcom pa yin no //
translated: that which is committed and then destroyed by the vow of abandoning it, that which is committed and then destroyed by the mundane path of separation from attachment without generating the karmic maturation, and that which is committed and then destroyed by the supramundane path of abandonment.

original: bsags la ma byas pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la srog chags bsad pa'i phyir yun ring po nas rjes su rtog par byed rjes su dpyod bar byed pa de la srog gcod pa dang ldan pa'i mi dge ba bsags pa ni yod la /
analyzed: bsags la ma byas pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la srog chags bsad pa'i phyir yun ring po nas rjes su rtog par byed rjes su dpyod bar byed pa de la srog gcod pa dang ldan pa'i mi dge ba bsags pa ni yod la /
translated: That which is accumulated but not committed is as follows: Here someone for a long time plans and investigates in order to kill a living being. He has accumulated nonvirtue consisting of killing,

original: des srog gcod pa ni ma byas pa yin no //
analyzed: des srog gcod pa ni ma byas pa yin no //
translated: but he has not committed killing.

original: byas kyang byas la bsags kyang bsags pa ni rnam pa gang dag gis byas la bsags pa ma yin pa @139b dang ; bsags la ma byas pa'i rnam pa ji skad bstan pa dag ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i srog gcod pa thams cad do //
analyzed: byas kyang byas la bsags kyang bsags pa ni rnam pa gang dag gis byas la bsags pa ma yin pa @139b dang ; bsags la ma byas pa'i rnam pa ji skad bstan pa dag ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i srog gcod pa thams cad do //
translated: That which is committed and also accumulated is all killing other than that which is not committed and also not accumulated, and that which is not committed but is accumulated, and that which is committed but is not accumulated, as they were previously explained.

original: ma byas shing ma bsags pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma byas shing ma bsags pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: That which is neither committed nor accumulated is that which is not included in those.

original: lhag ma ma byin par len pa la sogs pa nas tshig kyal pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag kyang srog gcod pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ma byin par len pa la sogs pa nas tshig kyal pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag kyang srog gcod pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining karmas, from taking what is not given up to idle speech, should be viewed in the same way as killing, as appropriate.

original: brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba dag la ni bsags la ma byas pa zhes bya ba'i mu gnyis pa med do //
analyzed: brnab sems dang gnod sems dang log par lta ba dag la ni bsags la ma byas pa zhes bya ba'i mu gnyis pa med do //
translated: Covetousness, malice, and wrong views do not have a second alternative, called “accumulated but not done.”

original: mu dang po las kyang ched du ma byas pa yang med la /
analyzed: mu dang po las kyang ched du ma byas pa yang med la /
translated: The first alternative also does not have “not intended”

analyzed: gzhan dag gis nan gyis byed du bcug pa yang med do // lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no /

original: gal te de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skyes na yang tshe thung bar 'gyur ba de ni srog gcod pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //

translated: If one is born here among humans after death, with a life span that is short, that is called the corresponding result of killing.

original: phyi rol gyi snod kyi 'jig rten gyi bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / 'bras bu dang / sman la sogs pa mthu chung ba dang / nyams pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / mthu stobs chung ba dang / 'ju dka' zhing nad skyed par byed la /🔽des sems can phal cher tshe ma zad pa bzhin du dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur bde ni srong gcod pa'i dbang gi 'bras bu zhes bya'o //

original: dbang gi 'bras bu ni bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu ni bshad par bya ste /

original: de la ma byin par len pa'i dbang gi 'bras bus ni snod kyi 'jig rten na 'bras bu nyung ba dang / 'bras bu mi grung ba dang / 'bras bu rul ba dang / 'bras bu lod pa dang / than pa che ba dang / char ches pa dang /

analyzed: tshig kyal pa'i /
translated: The land will be without lakes and ponds, dry, with salt-encrusted soil, a desert, a wilderness, a place of misfortune and sin, and will be full of many causes of fear and terror.

analyzed: gnod sems kyi dbang gi 'bras bus ni snod kyi 'jig rten na yams kyi nad @140b mang ba dang / gnod pa mang ba dang / 'go ba'i nad mang ba dang / 'khrug pa mang ba dang / pha rol gyi dmag tshogs las gyur ba'i 'khrug long gi 'jigs pa mang ba dang /

translated: By the power of the result of wrong views, whatever is the best, the chief, and the most exalted of the elements in the world of the environment will disappear, and impure things will appear as the most pure.

analyzed: sdug bsngal bar gyur ba dag mchog tu bde bar snang ba dang / gnas med pa dang / skyob pa med pa dang / skyabs med par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gal te sha la sogs pa 'dod pas gsod par byed pa ni chags pa las byung ba'i srog gcod pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: If one kills out of desire for meat and so on, it should be called killing that arises from attachment.

analyzed: gal te gsad nas de la yod pa'i rdzas dag dbrog par bya'o snyam pa /

translated: If one kills thinking, “This person is not acquiring for me,” or “This person is an obstacle to my acquisition,”

analyzed: bstod pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba la yang ci rigs par blta bar bya ste /

analyzed: thams cad kyang chags pa las byung ba'i srog gcod pa yin par blta bar bya'o //

translated: If one kills with the thought, “This one harmed me in the past,”🔽or “This one will harm me in the future,”🔽or “This one is harming me now,”🔽or if one kills with the thought, “This one is dear to my enemy,”
